0.33 bottle. Pours dark brown color with large, lasting off-white creamy head. Aroma of fruits, wine, malts, yeast. Light to medium sweet, light bitter. Medium long chocolate, caramel bitter finish. Well hidden alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation. Great beer.
Elle est bonne pour une trappiste.  Belle texture avec une robe du couleur solaire et non persistante.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

W tym piwie robotę robią dwie rzeczy (główną, bo zalet jest więcej) - tęgie ciało i złożony smak. Już aromat zapowiada, że będzie ciekawie - leśne owoce mieszają się z czekoladą, suszonymi owocami (figi i daktyle) i opiekaną skórką chleba. Smak to potwierdza dodając do tego nutkę winną kojarzącą mi się z porto. A w tle wspomnianych nut pałętają się orzechy. Piwo jest niziutko wysycone, gęste jak olej i choć należy do ciężkich zawodników (9,2% alkoholu), to zupełnie nie męczy.

Farbe: dunkelbraun
Schaum: dicht, reich, beständig.
Nase: hm, karamell, alkoholisch, verbranntes, malzig und noch was.
Geschmack: feinsprudlig, bitter, dann erst rauchiges Aroma, so angekokeltes Malziges Holz, alkoholisch, wie die Nase eigentlich. Im Nachgeschmack wieder das "und noch was". Mit dem präsenten Alkohol und dem sehr dunkel-würzigen und-noch-was (ich sehe "Trockenfrucht und Weinbrand" in einer Bewertung, hm) an der Grenze zu unangenehm.
Nicht für jeden Tag aber ziemlich komplex und ausgewogen. Ich vermute mal eines der Besten unter den starken Mönchsbieren.

- braun-trübe Farbe mit guter cremigerSchaumbildung
- gut erkennbare Aromen nach Kirsche, Trockenobst und einem leichten
 Weinbrandtouch
- die Carbonisierung ist mir etwas zu moussierend
- der Antrunk bringt dann den erhöhten Alkoholgehalt stetig zum Vorschein
- dieses stark alkoholische, verbunden mit dem m. E. zu hohen Kohlen-
 säuregehalt schränkt das Geschmackserlebnis dann leider etwas ein
- der Abgang klingt dann versöhnlich mit einer würzigen Note aus
Fazit: Nicht schlecht, aber der Alkohol verbunden mit der zu hohen Kohlensäure drängt sich zu sehr in den Vordergrund

Bottle. Somewhere between herbal, spices and fruity. Good balance between this, less candy than others. Medium to heavy, pillowed by a crisp carbonation. Very sweet, also the palate which is lasting. Get very typical on the palate, but in good way.
Almost the same with Rochefort 10, with less alcohol and malt. Very good, though I like 10 more.

Almost opaque dark copper color with a strong amount of activity. Extra creamy beige 3 finger island head, lasting more than 20 minutes, with some good leggings.

Flavors of dark fruits, roasted grains, ester fruits, floral and herbal spices. Highly resinous, vinous, and acidic. Cellar like taste of oak.

Slick medium to full body with prickly carbonation. Strong finish of medium length, ending with a thick smoky wood feel, dry vinous fruits, and a nice lingering peppercorn spiciness.

Overall extremely well crafted having incredible flavors and a perfect finish. Super complex and fresh. Nice balance with a highly sugary feel that is still pleasant with a good amount of sharpness. Warming although highly boozy, and the smell is not very inviting and too faint.

Pours a cloudy brown with a moderate amount of head, a little retention. Aroma is heavy on dark fruits, bread, and some alcohol. Taste also contains alcohol, but with a world of complexity underneath. Raisins, bread, figs, caramel, spices, all burst through. Quite a bit of carbonation, but not overwhelming. Dark fruits permeate the finish. This is an addicting one.
UPDATED: AUG 29, 2016 Pours deep brown with a off white head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruits, plum, light liquorice, belgian yeast, raisins, light sugary feel.

A clear copper-colored body with a large, well-lasting light brown head. Nose has sweet aromas of raisins, prunes, caramel, honey, vanilla and spicy yeast phenols. Taste is quite sweet with a somewhat harsh bitterness that lingers on the tongue. Very high carbonation and thanks to that, a fairly light mouthfeel. Well hidden alcohol with a pleasant slowly unfolding warmth. Extremely well balanced beer with lots of aromas and depth.

Completely opaque, dark ruby red, sort of muddy-looking; fizzy head that disappears relatively quickly, but the carbonation is really pretty. Scent is wonderfully complex - lots of dark fruit, fig, currant, cherry, nutmeg. Taste is also rich in dark fruit, caramel, a bit of gingerbread spice. Overall, the Rochefort 10 strikes me as slightly more fruity and tannic, whereas the Rochefort 8s spicy characteristics are a bit more pronounced. What a treat these beers are.
Good beer, almost on the edge of tasting too artificial. But good mouthfeel and great aftertaste, almost like a dessertwine. Yet it misses the wow of a great ipa.

Bottle. In the beginning nice, head with small bubbles but very unstable. Brown colour of the beer. THe aroma is very fruity, ester, very sweet with notes of plums, cherries and raisins. The flavour is malty-fruity, with dry finish. The alcohol a little warms the throath.

Brown color. High carbonation. Surpringly light malty and yeast aroma with some chocolate notes. Rich caramel flavor, milk chocolate, some spicy phenols, a bit fruity. Very smooth and sweet, but not overly so. Good beer.

Superb. Beercraft at its finest.
Bread, floral, grass, herbs, cheese, raisin.
Brown, hazy body, frothy, tan head.
Lightly sweet and sour, medium bitter. Amazing!
Full body, thick feel. Average carbonation, abrupt finish.

Poured from a 11.2 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Appearance is a hazy brown with a brief tan head that dissipates with no lacing at all. Nose is a wonderful blend of caramel, fruits and a little hint of chocolate. Medium body with lively carbonation. Very complex, medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Long finish starts sweet and ends with a little bitter. Very nice!

dark chocolate-brown beer and cloudy. Significant level of carbonation, as happens to many of the beers of the genre. Crown comprehensive and lasting foam, which helps to carbon despite the high alcohol content. Leaves traces defined as rings attached to glass. sweet and fruity aroma. Notes jujube, fig and prune, on background of roasted malt, freshly baked bread, nuts and caramel. sidebars fainter chocolate and coffee. Body medium-high pulling robust

Chocolate and smoke taste. Impressive combination, most of the team very surprised because of dark colour

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2016 Lesser version of Rochefort 10, but still an amazing beer! Aroma is fruity but slightly more sour. Taste is complex. Dark fruits, spices, caramel, chocolate... But less pronounced than the 10.

[backlog] 11-12-15 / bottle bought in Rochefort, drank at home. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating: 3.75/5

BBE 25.1.2011, eli 6 vuotiasta tavaraa. En ole tuoreempaa koskaan maistanut, joten todella vaikea vertailla. Ihan pirteä tapaus tämäkin, valkoista vaahtoa omassa lasissa reilusti. Hajussa banaania, maku banaaninen, hiilihappoinen, hieman alkoholinen. Lievää maakellarin sivumakua havaittavissa. Ei tämä mikään mestariteos ole, ja näin pitkä ikäännyttäminen lienee kääntänyt tämän jopa jo laskuun, sen verran tässä sivumaku puskee päälle varsinkin loppulasista. Täytyy metsästää tuoreempi tuote maisteluun. 6.3.2015: Nyt BBE 16.9.2019, joten tuoretta tavaraa. Ja eipä ole enää virhemakuja tai kellaria havaittavissa, ei kyllä banaaniakaan. Syvän oranssin ruskea olut vaahtoaa mukavan reilusti. Hiivaapartikkeleita näyttää olevan todella runsaasti kaadettaessa. Väri on selvästi kutosta tummempi ja taas toisaalta kymppiä vaaleampi. Vaahtoa jää pieni kerros oluen pinnalle, mutta silmämääräisesti sanoen kutonen peittoaa kasin taas tässä suhteessa. Maltainen, kevyen belgihiivainen ja hedelmäinen tuoksu on pehmeämpi ja jopa miedompi kuin kuutosen. Maku maltaisen sokerinen, mausteinen ja hedelmäinen kuivahkolla melko täyteläisellä suutuntumalla. Hiilihappoja ei ehkä ihan kutosen veroisesti.

330 ml bottle. Solid brown body with a tawny highlight at the edge and a creamy off-white head. Lots of carbonation. Aromas of dark plums, raisins, dark bread, lemon and spice. Taste kicks off with light dried fruit before a more substantial note of plums, prunes, dates, brown sugar and mixed spice ramps up. Substantial though not thick body. Long finish with a slightly sweet fruity aftertaste. Pretty great Trappist beer.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 Bottle. Pours hazy brown with beige head. Aroma has ripe fruits and caramel with fig and date and light chocolate, nutty notes too. Taste is more complex with malt, caramel, nuts, fig and dry liquorice and lightly roasted notes. Easy drinking beer that is surprisingly dry and light with very well hidden alcohol.

Pours a very dark Amber pour with a nice beige head. Nose is floral mixed with spices with some alcohol , and toffee and caramel notes.Taste is sweet with buttery caramel and toffee notes and a bit of spice . Finish is sweet molasses, dry with a moderately long ending. Nice BSA if it is your brew of choice ! Quaff Score 8 / 10

Pours in hazy brown and covered by a thick creamy tan head. Aroma is fruity and malty with a hint of alcohol. Taste bouquet is very complex and delicious. Starts off with a soft malty touch which is instantly followed and twisted over by fruity and spicy notes. Finish brings out some burnt flavors and even dark chocolate. High alcohol level is well balanced and precisely set on the right line. Eight is Great.
Het blijft een mooie tripel maar vergeleken met de andere trappisten van Rochefort valt deze toch echt tegen.

Pours a ruddy brown from a bottle with a quick-foaming cream-colored foamy head, just as quickly dissipating. Not much of a nose that Im picking up, even though its rather warm after sitting out for a while. Flavor is dried fruits: cherries, plums, a little raisin, even apricot. Very effervescent in the mouth, almost too much so. A little alcohol burn. Good beer.

Apparence : Entre brune et rouge, reflets rouges vifs, belle mousse beige avec une bonne rétention, limpide, effervescence rapide et soutenue.

Nez : Pain grillé, rapidement caramel, levure belge, fruits séchés moyens, caractère boisé, léger alcool. Intensité élevée.

G : Malt : pain grillé, caramel, légèrement sucrée, levure en arrière-plan, finale présentant une légère amertume, des fruits séchés et des fruits rouges ainsi que la levure. Intensité moyenne. 

S : Corps moyen à plein, effervescence moyenne, finale de longueur moyenne et légère chaleur en fond de gorge. 

O : Il y a tout ce quon recherche dans une bonne bière brune belge : caramel, levure, fruits séchés, corps. Par contre, lintensité en bouche en fait une 9% sessionable! En effet, le nez annonce plus que ce que la bouche peut offrir. On a parfois limpression quelle est plus mince que ce quelle est réellement tellement on a le goût dy replonger les lèvres. Pour plusieurs ce nest peut-être pas un défaut en soi, mais ça diminue quelque peu son intérêt come bière de dégustation sur laquelle on sattarde longuement.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2016 Bottle. Shared with JD and Olesen. Creamy and round, but mild aroma. Soft and sweet taste, with classic belgian characteristics. I can see why it is popular, but it is just not my kind of beer.
330ml. Bottle shared with junes and Chris in odder. Big creamy head with nice lacing. Sweet aroma. Taste is sweet, dried fruit, dades long lasting aftertaste. Medium texture. Good beer.

Bottiglia. Colore tonaca di frate con una schiuma fine e persistente. Aroma maltato, zucchero candito, caramello e frutta sotto spirito. Al palato è rotonda con un bel gusto dolce che riesce a coprire benissimo i 9 gradi alcolici. Favolosa
Flaska från ölbutikken. Brun med fluffigt beige skum. Lite vinös doft med karamell. Värmande alkohol och smak av karamell, kola och lite körsbär.

Bottle. Hazy brown with a big white head, dissipates slowly leaving lots of lacings. Aroma is sweet cookies, malt, dark fruit, also a sour vinous tone in between. Taste is medium sweet with dates, plums, malt, again a complex vinous/berry tone with a creamy bitterness towards the end as well some warming alcohol. Medium to big body, medium carbo, sticky texture. Beautiful.

Brown color. Very fruity aromas, oranges, citrus, tropical fruit. Taste is if possible even more fruity - oranges, tropical fruits, yeast. Sweet fruits throughout the finish. A bit too one-dimensional.
Very good belgium trappe beer close to number 10 of this brand. The taste is going changing with less temperature.

Sicuramente un ottima birra , abbastanza complessa e piacevole da bere , il colore è ambrato con riflessi marroni,velato , la schiuma di color beige  tiene bene ed è compatta e persistente, alla prima versata è molto abbondante pur essendo una trappista, al naso non mi ha colpito molto mi aspettavo profumi ancora più forti ma sono percepibili banane mature , uvetta , prugne e un sentore liquoroso, tuttavia appena la birra si scalda anche a temperature superiori a quella di servizio emergono note di frutta secca , in bocca discretamente densa, anche qui mi aspettavo di più, ma si fa perdonare per la carbonatura allinizio marcata ma poi molto più adatta ad una bevuta rilassata quasi sorseggiata perché lalcool allinizio non si avverte con la sensazione di caldo ,anche se lodore è estremamente impregnato di frutta sotto spirito difatti la bevuta è liscia pur essendo impegnativa , nel finale infatti i suoi 9.2 gradi vengono fuori in maniera molto progressiva insieme ad un retrogusto di noci e datteri , i sapori sono gli stessi sentiti al naso con in più caramello e un sapore tendente al dolce . In generale una birra da bere quando si è davvero in vena di assaporare , sotto le mie aspettative ad esempio rispetto alla sorella La Trappe  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Barna, homályos. Óriási, bézs habja sokáig kitart. Illata gyümölcsös, enyhén karamelles jeggyel. Ez IGEN! Gazdag, komlós, enyhén édeskés karamelles ízvilág, rendkívüli harmóniában. A korty enyhe pörkölt jellegben cseng le. Egyetlen összetevő sem tolakodó, az ízek összesimulnak. Szénsavas, de még ez sem zavaró. Enyhe keserűsség, utóíze rövid, és a komló dominál benne. Testes, hihetetlenül eltalált sör.

Pours a hazy brown beer with a white head. Aroma is caramel sweet, plum and other dried fruits. One can also notice the alcohol in it. Taste is initially sweet but still rich and develops to lightly more sour afterwards. Notes of dried fruits, caramel malts with some alcohol sweetness. Palate is full and pleasant and the aftertaste is light sour. Carbonation is in nice balance with the rest of the drink. Overall very enjoyable strong beer, perfect for slow sipping.
UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Flaska rose red cafe. Brun kulör. Doft av kakdeg och julkryddor. Söt smak. Torkad frukt, äpplekart och sirap.

Scents of malt toffee and sherry.Pours a cloudy brown with a massive tan head with tight bubbles which suspend some sediment. Big sweet tastes of leather and caramel. No sour and very light alcohol and sweet bread. fizzy carbonation. Quite nice

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2016 Huge creamy tan head.
Aroma is smooth and complex: caramel, candy and toast on top notes followed by other wonderful malty aromas (baguette crust, dark bread, malt), dried fruit, nuts and linden blossom.
Taste: medium/high sweetness with light sourness and light bitterness from start to finish, aftertaste somewhat more bitter than sweet.
Palate: medium/full body, somewhat oily texture that is cut right through by high carbonation, nice little alcoholic warmness, almost no stickiness - perfect palate for such a strong beer.
Overall a great beer - extremely well balanced, with a well rounded palate and full of caramelly/malty/dried fruit flavors.

Botlle at home. Pours deep brown with a off white head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruits, plum, light liquorice, belgian yeast, raisins, light sugary feel. Taste is quite heavy sweet, with loads of dried and dark fruits, rasins, fig, plum. Quite complex, but a wonderful yeast.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 330 ml bottle. Pours copper with a beige head. The aroma is yeasty with some caramel malt. Medium to full body with average carbonation. The taste is pretty sweet with some acidity from overripe apples and pears. Caramel, honey, raisins, spices and alcohol. A little to sweet in combination with the high alcohol volume.

Bouteille 33 cl - couleur sombre chocolat, tête blanche, odeur de café, caramel, complexe, goût sur le caramel, café, des éclats de chocolat par moment, épices, complexe mais efficace, onctueuse dans la texture

Murky brown body, beige head that lasts. Intense aroma of banana, cake, chocolate, leather, herbs, light vinous notes and even a hint of cinammon. Medium sour taste dominated by yeast, with light fruity notes of apricot and strawberry - these belgian strong ales always remind me so much of fruit cakes. Medium body, creamy texture and lively carbonation. What is there much to say? It deserves the praise it gets.

Bottle 
Clear brown red, slight brown head 
Aroma of caramel, grain, syrup
Nice texture, rich taste. Alcoholic sweet. 
Like it.

Bottle. Deep Amber-brownish pour, turbid with a large frothy off-white head, crazy retention. Nose is chewy dried fruit (dates, prunes, figs), toffee, vanilla, molasses, leather, super-faint phenolic note. Mouth is medium bodied, decent carbonation, lightly creamy, sweetness, dried fruit, spice cake, candy sugar, orange peel, almost no detectable bitterness, finishes with some spice and a pleasant warmth. Very good.
0,33l bottle. Pours clear amber color with biege head. Sweet aroma with strong presence of alcohol. Sweet taste of candid fruit, apricot, strong tadte of alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation

Mörk brun öl med beige skum. Malt, jäst, bröd, sötma, karamell, russin. Bra styrka i den utan att alkoholen stör utan den är väl dold. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown body with creamy beige head. Hazy appearance. Smell is a bit faint, mostly sweet, a bit herbal, a bit toffee.

Full body with thick texture and very subtle carbonation. Mostly sweet taste with slight alcohol burn on the tongue. Aroma is pleasant, herbal, floral; caramel, toffee, spices.... Excellent. 

Lovely balanced ale.
bottle @ antwep. dark brown colour, heavy body, malty, but fruity, quite good belgian beer

Chyba jeszcze lepsze niż "dziesiątka". W nosie belgijskie drożdże, marcepan, figi, porto, pieprzne fenole. Na języku jak to w mocnych belgach gruszka z jabłkiem ale też wanilia, nuta czekolady (najbliższa deserowej), suszone śliwki, lekka pieprzność. Wszystko idealnie zharmonizowane. Dobre wysycenie, przyjemnie "pracuje" w ustach. Rozgrzewa, alkohol oczywiście mniej wyczuwalny niż w 10. Pierwsza liga.
Surprised I havent rated this yet considering I drink it regularly. Its just a solid anytime beer. Summer, winter, morning, night.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 Bottle at home. Brown colour with a small beige head. Nose is slight banana, molasses, light booze. Taste is low-medium sweetness with banana, esters, faint roasted malty backtones. Silk smooth mouthfeel. Lovely.
Hazy brown with creamy off white head. Aroma is malt, yeast and caramel. It has been a long time since I had one of this. Really good and tasteful, although I actually prefer the no.10.
Pours clear deep amber. Very fruity aroma. Prunes, raisins, roasted notes, oak, toffee. Complex. Sweet. Highly carbonated

Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass; room temperature.

Good Trappist beer, a little bit greedy in taste in comparison with his big sister. Nice aroma and taste dominate by the Trappist yeast.

Try it.
Used to be one of my favourites. Still one of the better style examples, but Ive travelled on from Belgium.

Type: 330-ml. bottle (11.2 oz.)
Glass: Westvleteren 12 Trappist glass
From: San Diego Wine Company in Miramar (San Diego), Calif.
Price: $5.99
Purchased: N/A; Received on April 23, 2016
Consumed: April 27, 2016
Misc.: Best before July 23, 2019

Thanks, Tom!

My wifes uncle, Tom, brought this as a gift, along with Founders KBS and Acoustic Ales Instant Triple Karma. Unbelievably nice as I hadnt had the chance so have either. Have always wanted to try these Trappistes Rochefort beers, but this will be my first. 

Poured an auburn, murky color with 1-to-2 fingers of frothy, khaki head. Light bubbles coming up from the bottom. Minimal wet lacing. Average retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled that 9.2 pct. ABV right away. Once that settled, got spoiled plum, toffee, some candied caramel, red apple, purple grape, raisins, prunes and more dark fruits. Funky overall. (Smell - 4.00)

Taste was a bit better, but still on those funky notes. Got roasted toffee, candied caramel, spoiled plum, raisins, prune juice, dates, rye bread, purple grape, red apple, some blackberry, hints of rum, light notes of chocolate and some wintry spices. (Taste - 4.00)

Medium body. Oily texture. Average-to-lively carbonation. Long, warming finish. (Feel - 4.25)

I really wanted to like this one but probably ended up overrating it as a result. It was good, but not something I would need to try again. Its not like Ive never tried a Belgian Strong Dark Ale (this was my 12th) but it was just good, not great. Maybe this is supposed to be the standard, but I reviewed it as is. (Overall - 4.00)

4.03 90 A-
The same dark honey colour as number 6, but slightly darker with smaller beige top and stronger carbonation. Complex liquid with potent aroma and taste. Intense strong ale. Highest world class.
Hazy brown with light beige head. Aroma is caramel, raisins, yeast, dried fruits. Taste is caramel, yeast, sweet brown sugar, some coffee. Very classical and good Belgian.

Served in a La Trappe Trappist glass from a bottle. Pours chestnut brown colour with a creamy fast diminishing head. Aroma is yet again a typical Trappist beer aroma - caramel, malt, bread, yeast. Taste is bready and slightly salty but nicely balanced. Medium body with lively carbonation (almost on a prickly side). Nice enough to have more.

Bootle 0,33. Pours dark amber with medium diminishing off-white head. Aroma of yeast, caramel, sweet fruits, a hint of coffee and raisins. Sweet taste that follows the aroma, however more of dark fruits and a hint of vanilla. Creamy, somewhat sticky texture with full body. Excellent, looking forward to the 10.
Certainly a fine fine beer, its drier (in the port sense, not the overhopped awful sense) but it has a perfect rich raisin-y palate and finishes in a balanced way. Slightly hoppy

Hazy, brown colour. Thin white head. Hints of vanilla, toffee, hints of coffee, dark fruits in the aroma. Toffee at first. Vanilla. Caramel. Nice spiceness in the middle. Dark fruits. Hints of raisins. Toffee in the end. Hints of vanilla, caramel and hints of fruits in the aftertaste. Quite nice mouthfeel. Sweetnes is in balance. Makes bit warm inside, but covers alchohol very well. Rather medium bodied, medium carbonated, very good beer.
From bottle. Pours dark amber, with big, beige head. Grapes, walnut, woody, quality alcohol, honey, caramel. Medium to high carbonation, light, well covered alcohol.

Malty aroma of caramel, bread, toast, raisin, quite complex. 
A bit darker than the 6, but still some red.
Taste is sweet, dark fruit, some dark chocolate even, with a rather thick texture.
Great Trappist beer.
Bière très foncé avec une belle mousse blanche qui disparaît très rapidement. Au nez elle est très agréable. Au goût elle est très surprenante. Seul défaut, un arrière goût un peu sec.
Clear dark amber with medium off-white head. Aroma of pruins, malt and caramel. Taste is raisin, nuts and yeast.

Bruin bier met rijkelijke beige schuimkraag. Geur: geroosterde mout, noten, gedrogde vruchten, abrikoos en wat citrus en pompelmoes. Smaak: Moutzoetig, zoethout, melkchocolade, vijg, wat moutbitterheid. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoetig, fruitig.

One of my favorite beer.
Looking good, and when you taste it, it reveal all aroma.
One of the best beers that I have drunk, it has great aroma like fruits, it has intense brown colour.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a nice medium walnut color with a thicker off white head that lasts and lasts. There isn't any lace as it falls. The aroma is pretty interesting. There is a lot of bready malts and a great dark fruit presence. There is almost a juiciness that comes with the dark fruits. It's not as Belgian forward as I was expecting and I like it for that. The flavor is very very bready. There is a nice figginess to it. Lots of sweet malts and a fair bit of dark fruits. The mouth feel is a little lighter and quite effervescent. The aftertaste is lingeringly fruity and carries a lot of bready malts. It's a lot better than I thought it would be.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is sweet malt, figgy, lots of dark and dried fruit, slight booze, bubblegum but in a good way. Appearance is walnut brown, light brown, hazy, the head hasnt left and I doubt it will. Taste is bready, figgy, dried fruit, dark fruit, yeasty, lots of stuff happening here. Mouthfeel is medium body, crisp carbonation, bready yeasty aftertaste. Overall, this tastes like a lighter version of 10, which I guess is what they were going for, but I expected it to be better.

(bottle 0,33l)
Aroma: Sweet, toffee, caramel, alcohol, later light chocolate.
Appearance: Cloudy brown color. All time, creamy, light brown head.
Taste: Medium sweet, alcohol, spicy, light dark malts, caramel, toffee.
Palate: Medium-full body. Sticky texture. Astringent, warm finish.
Overall: Malty, alcoholic, dark belgian.
Great beer! Red, with a nice head. Very intense wine aroma and flavour. Hope I will have a chance to taste it again!

Belle bière. Mousse très épaisse qui disparaît assez vite. Opacité très importante et couleur fût de chêne-rubis magnifique. Un peu déçu en comparaison à la Rochefort 10. Un peu courte et sèche. Un peu dépice et présence subtile de torréfaction, café mais léger. Amertume équilibrée. Cela reste tout de même un bonne bière.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 Sweet, cake, caramel and very intensive aroma, alcohol very well hidden. Long lasting, full and complex taste. Sits on tongue wonderfully. Its always surprise to taste it again.

Bottle 330 ml. Medium brown with a thin offwhite head. Little lacing. Aroma has sweet caramel and apple. Taste is complex with plenty of sweet fruit like apples and pears. Also some malty notes. Long aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2016 33cl bottle, served in Rochefort trappist chalice. Poured a dark brown with an ivory one finger head. Lots of yeast swimming in glass. Aromas of prunes, dates, wine, apples. Taste: Prunes, dates, whole wheat bread, hazelnuts, caramel, dark fruits, sweet spices, figs, raisins, plums, tart, wine. A full body with a creamy, frothy, vinous finish. Overall a deliciously dark brew, and it succeeds in keeping up there with its bigger brother, the 10.
en rigtig klassiker. Den har blomme og fylde fra malten, og ikke mindst den belgiske gær.
Bottle (11.2oz $5.50) Reddish with white head. Fruity aroma. Taste is somewhat fruity and sweet. Overall very good. There was a fair amount of sediment in my bottle.(bottle conditioned?)

Appearance- clear dark chestnut with thick tan foam. Aromas-complex malt, bready notes with raisin and rich dark boozy fruits which have a sweet edge, notes of caramelised cherry and brandy. Palate: oily, full bodied, with a creaminess brought by the thick foam. Heavy to drink. Taste: Hardcore. Raisin, dark fruits. Packs a punch. Overall: a very complex ale, highly recommended but too heavy for me.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2016 Aroma: fruity and spicy; Appearance: extremely dark, ruby red with off white, thin head that dissipates slowly; Taste: sweet and fruity, but with solid malt backbone; Palate; medium body with long, sweet finish; Overall: delicious and smooth; a little too sweet, but still a favorite.
Re-rate comments: had at a bar in Antwerp; yes, still sweet but deserves a higher rating than 3.9.

Pours a dark ruby brown with a creamy head. The aroma is quite subdued, a little ripe banana, a little cloves but nothing strong. A strong clove taste, some banana notes, some spicyness. A great version of a Belgian strong ale. Not as good as the 10 though.
Aroma of dark fruits and wine. Nica taste of the same, but ends up with spices and alcohol. A complex taste. Very nice and worth its above 4 rating. Quality!

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 Short lasting rocky white foam. Aroma of stone fruit and caramel. No chocolate, no nut and no coffee at all despite its color which is about 16 SRM, so that I guess its all due by brown candy sugar additions. Very very attenuated (I measured its FG: its 1006! Ridiculous! It means the OG is equal to 1072 and the attenuation is about 92%!), its ethylic feel is more than just subtle: its actually invasive and a bit unpleasant. Really high carbonation. Bodys just absent. Im a fan of Rochefort 10, a huge one, but this beer lacks the big sisters complexity. They used more sugar than malt. Why? Do the monks have any money issues?

Tasting another bottle: I confirm what i wrote before but this time I notice some spicy aromas, maybe phenols, maybe orange peel and coriander. The aroma is more complex than I remembered... hard to explain: a mix of fruit, spices and alcohols.

Aroma: raisins, smooth-gentle alcohol, some kandi sweetness, toasty. very pleasant and gentle.
appearance: amber, slightly hazy, white foam, minimal head, good retention. 
taste: ligh sweetness, light bitterness, gentle and smooth alcohol, some raisins, fruitcake. 
semi medium body, slick, average carbonation, sweetish finish. 
overall a very drinkable, pleasant, complex brew.
Bottle at home. Deep amber with a white head, leaves no lacing, doesnt last long. Spice, yeast, bread, malt on the nose, intensive and pleasant. Medium to high carbonation, a bit alcoholic.

Found myself randomly drinking at a French place on UES. No fucking way have I never had this but apparently I havent and always assumed I did. Poured sloppily by bartender resulting in spillage from bottle. Chestnut coloration lovely two finger head. Nose is dark fruits and bready. Tastes of figs, plums, caramel, dates, some yeast, bread. Touch sweet and fruity on palate. High carbonation and hides alcohol well.
Compleja, afrutada, vainilla, alcohol bien integrado. Una delicia asequible y facil de encontrar.
Aroma of yeast, vanilla, wine, nuts and brown sugar. Taste is lighty sweet, complex, with some warming alcohol. Very smooth and well balanced.

La birra si presenta con schiuma beige con una breve persistenza.
All'esame visivo risulta di colore ambrato, velato.
All'esame olfattivo il suo aroma è abbastanza intenso e si percepisce l'aroma del fruttato - maltato
Nel complesso questa birra risulta armonica e molto piacevole.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

That cheesecake beer pairing guide I shared a few weeks ago recommended pairing it with a Dubbel so I hit up Ohtsuki for a Trappistes Rochefort 8 (9.2%) and picked up some cheesecake to give it a try.

The rochefort is a dark oaky brown with minimal head and a rich raisins, bready cinnamon bun sweetness while the cheesecake contributes a creamy cheese and baked Graham crust in the aroma. Mouthwatering.

Full bodied but with a sharp carbonation and a bone dry finish the Rochefort presents boozy stone fruit, woodsiness and a herbal hop character. 

The cheesecake counteracts some of the dryness with its rich flavor and accentuates the spices and fruits. I get an image in my mind of eating butter cookies while drinking eggnog.

The beer on its own is too dry and gassy for me but with the cheesecake it rocks
Good beer fine taste flavor allright fine aroma is in many stores for sell for me its one of my favorites
Colore bruno con poca schiuma beige. Sotto le aspettative rispetto a quanto ricordavo, è comunque una ottima birra.
Belle couleur brune, avec des arômes de fleurs et de caramel. Alcool bien masqué....

Petite mousse blanche cassée, couleur brun-ambrée, arôme levures, malt, la bière était probablement trop fraîche, au goût ses arômes nont pas été à la hauteur, lalcool est très bien dissimuler dans ce breuvage complexe... à réessayer absolument. 33 Cl Paris Saint-Bière
Aroma like bread, hops - resin.Cant feel 9,2%. Color - brown black. Cloudy, minimal head.heavy sweet and light sour. Long finish. From bottle 0,33 cl.
0.33 bottle. Hazy, brown-amber colored with thin head. Malts, sugar, and fruits in aroma. Pretty much the same taste that you expect after smelling it. Good beer.

Piwo trapistów. Piana Intensywna. ładna, szybko znika, ale zostawia kożuszek.. Barwa ciemny brąz, lekko mętna, Wysokie wysycenie szczypie w język. Ciało pełne, oleiste. Zapach bardzo intensywny, złożony, winny, śliwkowy, delikatnie drożdżowy. Trochę ziemisty i alkoholowy. Smak ziemisty, Korzenny. Potem czuć smaczki ciemne, palone, wyrazistą alkoholowość i rózne owocowo-winne, lekko cierpkie nutki. Czuć moc piwa. Końcówka trochę gorsza.
Bottle poured a hazy brown-amber colpur beer. Nut-like flavour. Slightly bitter. I liked the 10 better but still pretty good beer.

Hazy tan to brown, tall rocky head vanishing to a thick film on beer. Aroma of rich malts, yeasty spiciness, some strong alcohol like grappa. The rest is hard to describe and beautiful. Even a note of fresh cucumber. Medium to full body. Oily to creamy. The taste is similarly complex. Dark fruit, grappa, sherry, I dont even know what. A great experience drinking this-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle pour. Darker brown amber pour, thin rocky tan head. Decent lacing. Dark malt aroma, toffee, brown sugar, bread, dark fruit, a little bit of yeasty ester. A little bit of warming alcohol in the body. Medium body overall, carbonation is on the creamier side.

Zaczyna się od drożdżowego, zbożowego aromatu z alkoholową nutą, który nie ulatnia się ani na moment, pozostaje do ostatniego łyku. Barwa ciemny brąz, całość pokryta z początku obfitą, szybko opadającą jednak pianą. Wysokie wysycenie szczypie w język. Ciało pełne, oleiste. W smaku mocna zbożowość z wyczuwalnym alkoholem, słodowa podbudowa. Zarówno w ustach jak i w nosie wyczuwalne kwaśne owoce, z czasem zaczynają dominować, narzucając nieco smaku kompotu z suszonych owoców.. Każdy łyk bardzo przyjemnie rozgrzewa. Piwo znakomicie ułożone, wszystko jest na swoim miejscu. Sączy się je cudownie, trudno się do czegoś przyczepić. Idealne na długie zimowe wieczory.

11.2 oz. bottle. Pours a dark amber-brown with an off-white head that is initially a little fizzy and then eventually settles into more of a thin creamy film. Moderate lacing that slides down the glass back into the beer. Aroma of dark fruits, malt, caramel, and some alcohol. Flavors of dark fruit, spice, caramel, wine, nuts, and light Belgian yeast. Warm, slightly bitter finish. Strong carbonation. Some creaminess in the mouthfeel. Had this for the first time in Brussels, Sept. 2015, and I was hooked! Absolutely fantastic.
Notig en zacht. Rijk van smaak, licht zoet op de tong, bitter in de afdronk. Veel smaakevolutie. Niet zo lekker als de 10, maar nog steeds uitstekend.
bubble smooth taste good bread smell long lingering aftertaste alcohol bitter tones
Brown colour with tan head. Malt, raisin, bread aroma. Sweet, malt, raisin, fig, caramel and bread taste. Medium to full body.

Bottle @ DØE. Appearance: pours clear red-brown with good beige soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: brown sugar, chocolate, dried fruits/dades, plums, alcohol and lots of spices, palette: strong yeasty aroma, average to sparkling carbonation, full body, medium to notable sugar sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, medium to long duration and an oily texture. Overall: nice complex strong ale.
Trübes dunkelbraun mit reichlich Schaum. Röstmalzig, fruchtig, Kirsche, Waldbeeren, süß, leicht würzig, spritzig
Very good Beer. Interesting fruity flavour. Full aroma. Good sweeteness. Creamy taste.
Extraordinaria, incluso, según mi opinión personal, por encima de la Rochefort 10, al entras más fácil, teniendo notas muy similares. Muy recomendables las 3 Rochefort, un acierto seguro.

Excellent beer. Crisp, balanced. Definitely not as robust as the 10, but still very enjoyable and better then most capital Belgian beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Everything it is supposed to be as a Trappist Golden Strong. Fruity esters, moderate phenols on the nose. Ruddy light brown with chunks from bottle and wonderful thin head. Sweet, dry, balanced, drinkable, figgy, carmel, grainy, bits of hops shining through. Wonderful palate, high carb but muted by viscous nature of brew. Just a wonderful brew throughout. More simple/straightforward than some other Trappist ales but just as good or better in some ways.
One of the best beers I have ever had. Rich bitter tones and a long lingering aftertaste.

33cl bottle from the local supermarket. Pours a murky brown with a tall cream head with very good retention. Smells of dark fruit, prunes, raspberry jam, caramel and spices. The taste follows the same notes and resembles Rochefort 10 quite a bit (though I still need to do a head-to-head tasting). Sweet and a bit bitter, a bit sour, spicy and complex. Not as full-bodied and smooth as the 10, but still world class.
Donkerbruin bier met schuim. Smaak is zoet, krachtig. licht hoppig bitter met iets van drop, caramel en anijs. Mogelijk zelfs beter dan de 10.

9.2%ABV. Belgian Strong Ale.

Poured out black brown. 28ºSRM.

Nose has some nice roasty malty aromas. The chin chow or licorice nose is back again. There are some nice roasted nutty aromas of chestnuts and hazelnuts. Maybe honeyed or carmelized cashews. Creme brulee.

Mouthfeel is soapy. There is pronounced carbonation and the palate is bitter with alcohol being a very prominent feature. There are pronounced flavors of dates, black plums, toffee and percolated coffee which you get more in the finish. 

Finish is medium and malty with an aftertaste of chocolate alcohol fumes.

Goes on Favorites List!

Arômes de fruits des bois et caramel, mousse blanche abondante et résiliente, robe marron. En bouche, un équilibre parfait entre le fort taux dalcool, le corps, la faible amertume et le goût de caramel (sans être sucrée). Sans aucun doute une des meilleures bière au monde.
Great stuff. Smell is of brown sugar a little more so than the 10 taste is smooth and sweet with a little bitterness. I'll go with this if I don't wanna get drunk to fast.
UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 Bottle at home. Poured tawny brown with no head. Aromas of treacle, cognac, Madeira. Excellent taste, sugary sweet, yeasty, slight bitter. Strong, Great stuff!
The best of all dark beers! Rochefort are the grandmasters of the trappist triples! Ingenious flavours and aroma, what more can you add?

Cloudy amber beer with a thick, foamy head. Slightly sour, rich fruit aroma. Quite a bit of sediment in there too. Tastes absolutely outstanding. Spicy, fruity flavour with hits of both malt and hops. It feels both quite rich but also has a refreshing, crisp quality as well. Aftertaste is surprisingly mellow, mostly malt and fruit and theres caramel going through the whole thing as well. Really very tasty.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2016 Inutile de commenter car cette bière est la meilleure de Belgique -pays de la bière- et peut-être la meilleure au Monde !

Amusant de goûter des bières de toutes les régions mais on revient souvent à la Rochefort 8. Un belge un peu chauvin !
Bottle Amsterdam in tulip. Aroma dry fig. Taste is sweet fruit fig mix. Mouthfeel is slight dry and sticky. Overall very enjoyable on Christmas.

Bottle, BB 06.01.2020 - meaning, bottled almost a year ago. Opened with the longest pssssssst Ive heard; pours coppery brown reddish amber with a big light beige head that retains nicely. Drops after a while to leave islets. Aroma: malts, caramel, slight herbs and cherries... Not too exciting to be honest. Tastes quite bland, sweetish with a bitterish twist... prunes and figs soaked in alcohol. And a hollow bitter-caramelly-alcoholic finish. Great alcoholic warmth - the ABV really shows. Im not a fan, but think I should give it another try one day. Would be fun to try a fresh bottle and one close to its BB side by side.

Aromat bardzo intensywny, winny, śliwkowy, słodki, delikatnie drożdżowy. Barwa ciemna, rubinowa, mętne. Piana obfita, kremowa, opada powoli i zostaje do samego końca picia. Bardzo bogate w smaku, rodzynki, orzechy, śliwki. Lekko wyczuwalny alkohol, który przyjemnie grzeje. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie wysokie. Co tu dużo mówić, klasyk, świetne piwo.

This is a very special beer. The taste and aroma is very unique of a sweet caramel and dried fruits with a high concentration and complexity. A perfect or near perfect beer. Drinks well with christmas cookies.
2010 version from Waterboy, thanks Ric! Shared with ck1 during the Spit Cup/2000th weekend. Cloudy grayish pour. Grapes. Light wine. Not what expected. 14.2

pours room temp into tulip glass, nice thick tan head, dark amber brown good carbonation. Aroma is off fruit, pear, fig, sip get spicy smooth velvet texture with a balanced finish, lasting hint of high alcohol but not overpowering. A complex beer, very good.
Butelka 0,33l. Kolor brązowy zamglony, piana nikła bez trzymania się szkła. Aromat suszonych owoców, czekolady. Smak estrów, goryczka średnia alkohol wyczuwalny tylko lekko. Typowe Trapistenbier.
Bottle. Pours a hazy dark amber with generous beige head. Spicy and fruity aroma. Mostly fruity flavor with raisin notes and some spiciness. Medium bodied. Very good.

Bottled from Carrefour.
White top with brown body.
The form is dense and smoothy.
Strong malt. A little bitter but smoothy.
Nice one~
Flaske. Farven er kobberbrun, og aromaen er rom, rosiner og abrikos, medens smagen er malt og chokolade og tørret frugt.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2015 Aroma and taste of dried fruits; figs, prunes - over-riped fruits and malty cacao. Body is medium and texture is creamy. Its sweet and well-carbonated and finish with a lingering alcohol burn. The plumcake of Beers....
Wow.. I really like to drink this beer. One of the best beer not only among Trappist beer, but also among all the beer!!
UPDATED: DEC 10, 2015 No muy aromatica, aunque se detectan aromas a tostado. Sabor dulce, caramelo, toffe. No muy persistente en paladar, fácil de beber. Muy recomendable.

De rocheforts zijn prachtige bieren, deze ook. Niet te koud dronken. Drop en caramel. Weinig schuim, hazelnootkleur.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 0.33l. Cloudy brown color with thin creamy off-white head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of yeast, caramel, dried fruits and alcohol. Taste starts with rich and sweet grainy and toasted malt, following is fruity, yeasty and bready, mouthfeel is warming and spicy, while finish is mild bitter. Full body, thick texture and lively carbonation in palate. Perfect Trappist brew...
Very well balanced. Heavy still refreshing. You wouldnt want to drink a bucket of them but the flavour is really appealing.

Bottle, 33 cl. Slightly hazy red/brown body with a foamy light beige head. Sweet aroma with notes of fruit, spice and alcohol. Very rich taste with moderate sweetness and light bitternss. Solid malt and spice flavour. Warming alcohol. Medium body with prickly carbonation. A bit overcarbonated, like Rochefort 6. Dry, almost tasteless, finish. An elegant and balanced beer. One to be savoured slowly in quiet contemplation.
Bottle at La cervesera artesana. Brown colour with tan head. Malt, raisin, bread aroma. Sweet, malt, raisin, fig, caramel and bread taste. Medium to full body.
What i didnt like was the overcarbonation.The alcohol was there at the end of the taste.
Nice syrupy, cough medicine, spicy gumball, toffee, dark fruity and balanced masterpiece. Backlog from originally 2014/08/10, recent taste 2015/10/01.

Butelka. Barwa herbaciana, mętna. Piana wysoka, biała, wolno opadająca. Utrzymuje się do Aromat przyjemny, można wyczuć suszone owoce (figi, morele, rodzynki), czekolada, miód. Smak typowo belgijski, estrowy. Goryczka średnia do niskiej, alkohol doskonale ukryty. Bardzo dobre chodź Rochefort 12 bardziej mi smakował.
Bottle while In brussels Belgium. Poured murky brown lil head. Aroma sweet malty syrup. Light carb med bod. Taste sweet brown sugar balanced malty cereal.

Embouteillée 17/12/2014, bue après 11 mois. Robe ambrée très foncée et particulièrement trouble surmonté dun épais et crémeux col de mousse. Dentelle timide. Arômes de fruits séchés, levures, dattes, miel, mélasse. Surtout orienté vers le sucre, complexité moyenne, alcool bien caché. En bouche, assez sucré mais un sucre de fruits confit. Mûres, pruneaux, raisins rouges. Notes de dattes, levures, caramel et pain. Un léger côté de malt grillé, chocolat, miel et mélasse. Texture légère-moyenne, corps assez rond. Haut taux dalcool imperceptible et coule toute seule. Une autre dangereuse!
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 Wow. En virkelig god og lækker øl. Ud over det sædvanlige. Tilpas med sødme og bitterhed.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a clear ruby brown colour with a fizzy tan head. Aroma of red berries, raisin, some fig, spice, slight bready malt, like fruitcake, subtle nuts and a little alcohol. Taste of bready malts, fruitcake, raisin, fig, red currants, spice, subtle nuts, a little chocolate, maybe pepper and brown sugar. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A warming, bittersweet, fruitcake, peppery bitterness in the finish. Quite a rich, fruity beer with a spicy, fruitcake character. A really nice Belgian beer, its up there.
Aromen von Rumrosinen und Aprikosen, feine Malz und Schokotöne. Weich im Abgang.

What can I say that others haven't? It's wonderful from the start and better at the finish. Just a fantastic enjoyable beer. Drinking this is an experience to be savored!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 30, 2016 Long tan head, cloudy brown. Strong malty aroma, a hint of alcohol and vanilla. Taste is complex, spicy, sweet. Full body, slick texture. A bit too sweet, and sweetness holds too long in the aftertaste.

Pours a dark brown with a thin off-white head. Aroma is dark fruits, some Belgian yeast, and slight booze notes. Flavor is semi-sweet dark fruits. Deceptively strong - I dont taste the alcohol at all, and the body is much lighter than Id expect. Lacks the complexity and heft of Rochefort 10, but definitely a great beer.

St Annaland 11-09-2015 samen met Lou

Rochefort 8
Wat minder dan de '10'. Hele zachte smaak. Donkerbruine kleur met dikke schuimkraag. Smaakt naar bruine suiker, caramel, noten. Dikke voldoende! Weinig prik in de mond maar wel een hele lekkere nasmaak (bruine suiker).

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2017 Bottle. Dark color, hazy liquid, tan head. Higher carbonation. Wine smell. Aroma of nuts, cognac and malt. Medium sweet. Not bad, but Ive had better. Re-rate: More or less the same as first time, slightly bland.

11.2 bottle into a stemmed harpoon Leviathan glass. Thanks Troll. Pours a super dark Amber/brown with Ruby highlights. Aroma of booze, raisin, grass, granola, chewy malts, figs, plums. Super huge head gives way to ample lacing and a half inch left over. Sporadic spots left over. Taste of dark fruits, yet subtle on range. Smacks you once then draws back to allow chewy malts to bump up. Tangy flow, tart going down, and full bodied fun. Nice beer right here.

La Rochefort 8 est une bière trappiste originale et aromatisée. De couleur acajou, elle laisse évaporer des arômes de cacao très délicats et équilibrés. D'abord piquante, puis douce, la dégustation de cette bière se fait avec grand plaisir grâce à la rondeur apportée par le caramel et le chocolat.
Du sucre est ajouté avant l'embouteillage afin de créer une fermentation secondaire. Cette bière se bonifie au fil du temps.

Great trappist beer! Aromas of chocolate, herbs, flowers and honey. In taste dried plums, honey, chocolate and a bit of heavy wine. With every sip you get closer to heaven :-) Perfect for a long time tasting. I havent tried the 10 yet, but my best Belgian beer ever. To the Trappist monks! Buy a bottle to support them. Hopefully thats one of the joys of heaven.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2016 Cloudy brown appearance with some bubbly head. Complex tastes of raisin, brown sugar, nuts and grass. Full body, good carbonation, and a good finish of brown sugar. Really good
330ml bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Pours dark brown with a big beige head. Aroma of wine and spices. Taste is caramel, spices.

A: deep brown, murky, high carbonation, creamy, 2.5 finger head, dense tan colored head that dissipates quickly, natural looking lacing, lots of sediments in the bottom /
S: prune, apricot, persimmon, dark bread, darkfruits, dried fruits, alcohol /
T: date palm, prune, apricot, plums, brown bread, slight nutty flavor, brandy, a little bitterness, long aftertaste /
M: full bodied, creamy, dry, warm /
O: It is a 5 year old bottle, well matured, smooth and well balanced. almost good as its older brother Rochefort 10, similar but not as intense.

Marrón castaño turbia velada. Aromas a pan dulce, azúcar moreno, uvas pasas, alcohólica. Dulce, frisante, un poco ácida y amargor de fondo. Textura suave, cuerpo medio, refrescante primero y después caliente.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2016 From elcervecero. In Wesvleteren glass. Watching "Circuito Cerrado". Great beer but I  have to low its score because I still remember the Westy 12 I took yesterday and this is a step below. It as a bit less body

19 Sep 2016: In La Trappe chalice. Playing Terra Incognita Ch1. At 1? in Hipercors last units section I couldnt resist had to take home the last 4 units

20 Sep 2016: Watching Los Soprano 3x04-05. In La Trappe chalice. Repeating beers so soon can be a pleasure if its with such quality
(bottle) clear, bright, deep amber colour with a tall beige head; aroma of dried fruit, spice; slick palate; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish

I can feel the taste of herbs. The beer has a brown color and a little bit hazy. I can feel a lot of sweet tastes.
Much more than a body of Rochefort 6 has.
I very enjoyed this ale.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2016 Pours a dark brown color, topped with a nice looking beige colored head. Aroma of yeast and cellar at first, some more pleasant notes of dark fruits and some grapes. Taste is better than the aroma. Sweet start with medium bitterness following it. Not my favourite style in general.

It pours cloudy brown with a strong head that lasts a long time. It has a slightly fruity aroma with spices earthly tones and bread. It is highly carbonated with flavors of fruit, spices, earthy yeast, with a dry finish and alcohol warming.
Bottle. Pours ruby with big off white head. Nose is brown sugar and dark fruit. Taste is similar with raisins. Sweet bread. Lots of carbonation.
Pours dark brown beer. Long-lasting head with a light brown-beige colour. Fruity taste with a hint of chocolate, plums and a bit of alcohol taste in the end.

Pours a hazy dark copper-brown color with a creamy ivory head. Rich and malty with fruity esters. Low hop bitterness. Bread, caramel, cherry, and prune notes. The mouthfeel is smooth with high carbonation. There is some alcohol warming. Medium body. The finish is sweet with a prune juice after taste that lingers. Overall this is a wonderfully delicious and complex beer.

Aroma: caramel, coffee, 
Appearance: brown, 
Taste:medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
Palate:medium body,

Très bonne, de qualité, beaucoup de corps et plutôt équilibrée.Après, je trouve qu?on est trois crans en dessous de la 12 : trop sucrée, palette aromatique bien plus réduite, trop d?alcool par rapport à son manque de caractère.Nez léger, léger fond de raisin.En bouche du caramel un peu genre kwak avec plus de noblesse : légèrement fruitée mais trop timide. Longueur légèrement réglisse.

Classic "special" trappist brew, appearance slightly muddy from careless pouring, amber brown. Speckled head atop refreshing dissolved bubbles. Sweet fruity taste, malty bread, less volatile and citrus than many Belgian brews. Liquid Christmas pudding

Espuma beige que permanece como una capa cremosa durante la cata, color marrón con tonos rojizos, rico aroma en nariz con varios matices, sabor con notas amargas y dulces y un regusto sabroso y permanente, chispeante sensación de las burbujas explotando en la lengua al degustarla

Bottle 0.33l at Marimain cafe Gent Belgium.29.07.2015.Pour it hazy brown color with small white head.Aroma liquorice. Taste first too cold serve but when I warmed then perfection.So complexed, plum, dark fruits, raisins, pinch of caramel, Belgian yeast present really nice.

Brunatne, mętne piwo o obfitej pianie, która redukuje się do pierścionka przy brzegu szkła. Aromat wspaniały, owocowy, głównie rodzynki plus lekka nuta alkoholowa. W smaku bardzo owocowe w belgijskim stylu, alkohol rewelacyjnie ukryty, lekko słodkie i kwaskowe jednocześnie. Gryczka średnia, szlachetna, lekko alkoholowa, rozgrzewająca. Ogólnie rewelacyjne belgijskie piwo, cudowny smak i aromat, jedno z lepszych piw jakie piłem.

Bottle. Pours a murky dark brown with a big, fizzy, off white head. Aroma is very fruity, fresh figs, dates, prunes, slight marzipan, belgian yeast notes, alcohol, nutmeg, lavender, spice, lots of caramel. Taste is sweet with caramel and toasted malts, but also a slight fruity acidity. Surprisingly fresh. Medium-high carbonation, medium-full body.
Unfiltered brown color with very strong brownish foam. Aroma of malt and yeast and has some acohol aroma to it. Taste of alcohol and malt, goes down smooth and tastes really good. Overall good one!

Not the first time I had this, but my first attempt to rate it. Dark amber to brown, thin head. Poured it all in, so sediments is floating around, OK to me. Dark fruity aroma, cherry liqueur-ish alcohol notes due to the high ABV. Carbonation, alcohol and more cherries punch you at first, then a pleasant, long lasting caramel aftertaste is smoothing it all out. Fantastic beer, but to be honest its a bit too strong for my likings...

Together with its brother Rochefort 10 these are the two best beers in de world. Great taste, dark look, medium to heavy bitter but also a little sweet. All aromas are coming together when drinking it in the right glass.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy dark amber, creamy, tan, long lasting head. Sweet and spicy aroma, dark sugar, caramel, yeast, herbs, booze and banana. Medium-bodied and high carbonated. The taste is fruity and alcohol strong, fruit cake, bread, figs, raisins, herbs, caramel, red apples. Warming long finish.

Rochefort 8 for 800 rates. This marks two milestones for me. 800 beers and all 3 beers from the Brasserie de Rochefort. Nothing dethrones 10 (not for me, anyway), but 8 makes for an impressive sibling rivalry. Pouring hazy red-brown, 8 is as heady and lovely as the other Rochefort brews. Aroma has caramel, brown sugar, syrup, dark fruit, and bready grains. Flavor has caramel, fig, prune, and raisin - not to the extend of a Quad, but still all things malty, fruity, and rich. Alcohol note is sweet but the burn is expertly hidden. Same can be said for the effervescent carbonation - you see it, but the feel is smooth and slightly creamy. Cant think of a better way to celebrate 800.
Brownish, with a hint of red, nice yellowish foam. Strong alcohol and chemicals in the aroma. Malt, burned sugar, with alcoholic sweet aftertaste. High in carbon.
Served in a La Trappe glass. Dark and fruity beer with a nice strong alcohol level.
A cloudy brown brew with a lite tan head. Aroma and flavor is a slight mixture of malt, nut and fruit. Lots of carbonation. Nice!

Pours dark ruby to brown with white fluffy head lasting long time. Aroma figs, fruity, candy. The aroma is figs, candy, caramel, vanilla, coriander, milk chocolate. Compex had to pinpoint flavors Extremely smooth for the alcohol.  Very enjoyable, beer lovers great, and should try

Adquirida en New Beer Distributors, New York. Casi marrón, espuma blanca y con volumen. Sabor dulce, a malta y caramelo. Cuerpo medio. Excelente Belgian Dark Ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy Amber body, quite cloudy, with a light white head. Aroma is sweet with hints of caramel. Taste is clean and sweet with caramel and sugar notes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Originally rated on 12/21/07. This is a very good beer, Dark brown complexion with a slight tinge of tan in the head, fantastic aroma hints of banana, figs a little choclate.Goes down pretty smooth considering the alcohol content. A nice full bodied brew. I prefer the 10 hands down, but the 8 is very soild definetley worth trying.

Dark brown trappist with a cream head. A superb beer.Light sweetness with herbs, coriander, raisins and dry fruit. Small dry taste.

Every beer lover should try this one

Een mooi donkerbruin bier met mooie cremekleurige schuimkraag die lekker lang blijft liggen. Geuren van mout, gist, gedroogd fruit. De smaak is een stuk complexer: mout, gist, gedroogd fruit, kruiden, noten, chocola, caramel en drop.
Ik ken de Rochefort 10 goed, en had verwacht dat de 8 minder smaakvol zou zijn. Niets is minder waar. Minder alcohol, maar net zoveel smaak. Mooi bier.
Complex aroma with coriander supporting the malt. Wonderful taste of coriander Malty richness toffee licorice. Neutral finish.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2016 04/09/2015 @home 33cl bottle from a gift (3 years old)Dark brown with creamy beige head. Aroma : dark malts, chocolate, light spices. Taste dark malts (light roasted), hidden some caramel, chocolate, earthy.Top beer. 02/11/2016 : above rating was definetly for a fresh one. Tried a 3 year old 75cl one yesterday and I didnt like it. It tasted way older than 3 years. I doesnt age nicely in mt opinion.

330 ml bottle from the LCBO.
Appearance: Pours a
hazy light brown with over a finger of tan head. Shorter retention and very little lacing.
Aroma:
Biscuit and bready malts.
Flavours:
Belgian yeast, dark malts, prunes, walnuts, brown sugar and hints of milk chocolate. 
Mouthfeel:
Average viscosity and higher carbonation. 
Overall: This is a nice Belgian ale but no where near as enjoyable as the Rochfort 10 in my opinion. Lots going on in the aromas and flavours but I dont get the subtle nuances that I got with Rochfort 10.

Bottle at the Green Bud in Atsugi, Japan. Nice balance between malt and Belgian trippel alcohol aftertaste. Fruit blend of raspberry and malt. Tasty!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice dark beer. 
Caramel, black, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, sticky, lively, long finish,

Appearance: mostly clear deep amber with two growing fingers of fluffy light tan head, excellent retention and minimal lacing. (4/5) Aroma: mild, dark fruit, brown sugar, chocolate, bread, honey, spices. (8/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild bitter. (10/10) Palate: medium-full body, lively carbonation, semi-dry medium duration gently warming finish. (4/5)

Not as light and easy-drinking as the 6, not as complex and interesting as the 10. Dont get me wrong - still a pretty darned good beer, but Im not sure Id bother with this particular one again, seeing how it kind of bridges the gap between its two brethren. (17/20)

sampled at 2015 Dayton Alefest = pours dark malt with no head. Delicate hint of sweet spiced caramel but very soft. Creamy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Poured into a tulip glass. The copper body produces a large head with a moderate thickness that dissipates to about an inch high after a few minutes. The beer is very carbonated and yet gentle on the tongue with a short finish. A fruity aroma is coupled with a sour/semisweet flavour.
330ml bottle at home. Purs a dark brown beer with a good head. Very sweet, dried fruits, lots of spices.
Deep, overwhelming taste of bread, amazing smell and a sweet, lovely aftertaste. This is an amazing example of trappist belgian beer.

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours dark reddish brown with an off-white head. Aroma is raisins, prunes, caramel, nutty, yeast and belgian candi sugar. Flavour is medium sweet. Medium bodied, a little lively carbonation. Finish is dark dried fruits and a hint of alcohol. I like the big brother much better.

Pours dark brown with a beautiful, thick, lasting off-white head. Fair amount of sediment in the glass. Aroma of chocolate, yeast, a tad of alcohol, loads of malts and dried fruits, raisins, plums, spices as well... Complex indeed, and almost amazing. Didnt like the alcoholic smell though. Despite being not that strong, it kind of bugs me a bit. Tastewise, Ive got nothing to complain. Beautiful soft, almost creamy-like taste of nuts, chocolate, dark fruits, great yeasty notes, spices, some sweet-breaded notes, cloves, liquorice. Nice smooth bitterness towards the end, soft sweet and spicy in the aftertaste. Truly beautiful. Beautiful creamy texture, full bodied... Smoother than its stronger brother and therefore, the 8 is just one up on the 10. True silk in the glass. Its smoothness accompanied with its great complexity and wonderful balance, makes this brew a masterpiece of craftsmanship. Perfection at its finest.
Strong, strong beer, with dark color, strong body, average carbonized, (bought a 33cl bottle in Gent supermarket).
10/16/2006 12:51:26 PM Bottle at home. Another fantastic Belgian ale. Tall, creamy head. Fruity flavor. Very similar to the 10, bit less alcohol. Tastes spicy and becomes increasingly strong.

Dark brown, hazy, beer with a three finger high, beige head. 

Nose: Brown sugar, caramel, dried fruit, Belgian yeast and banana. Not that strong smell. 
Taste: Ohh... This is pure love! Caramel malt, brown sugar, bread, dried fruit, nuts, honey, malty and grainy notes, chocolate, plum and raisin. 
Body: Medium to full body. High carbonation. Thick texture. A little bitternes that takes over by the sweetness. 

This is so great! This is absolute a favorite! So easy drinking still ABV on 9.2% !
Tawny colored pour. Off white head. Some lacing. Nice malty aroma with hints of dark fruit and sugar. Taste is a nice malt front with a crisp bitterness in the back. Some spicy notes.

Botella. Color café. Muchísima espuma color crema. Aroma complejo pero interesante. Frutal, quizá pera y un poco de cacao. Muy agradable, ningún efluvio alcohólico para su graduación. En boca, espectacular. Muy cremosa. Equilibradisima. No parece que lleve alcohol salvo un poco en el postgusto. Vienen sabores frutales, cereales, caramelo... un gustazo. Muy muy rica. Para tener una bodega llena de Rochefort...
brown, cloudy, minimal head, tan foam, roasty, toast, nuts, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium bitterness,
Dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma of figs, roasted malt, nuts, caramel and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a reddish brown with a tan head. Taste belgian yeast, dark fruit, Carmel. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from brewdog bar, Sheffield. Dark red, small head. Aroma is prunes and raisins, rum and spice. Taste is sweet and bitter, theres a spice that helps keep it very drinkable. Carbonation and body are perfectly balanced. Very very nice beer.
Not a patch on its big brother figs prune stone fruit some tobacco hints nice but a little over carbonated quickly diminishing head.

33 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours cloudy brownish with a big soon to fade off-white head. High carbonation - almost champagne like mouthfeel. Good beer but I was expecting more from this. Aromas of caramel, yeast and fruits. Dry aftertaste.

33 cl bottle from Club de Cervezas, young specimen with best before date June 2019. Pours a beautiful hazy dark orange/tawny color with a massive off-white head with medium retention that leaves a film. Sugary notes and fruity esters dominate a massive malty/yeasty aroma. Heavy-hitting scent of caramel, Christmas cake, beet, molassess, ripe plums, dry figs, raisins, clove and nutmeg. Really great and intense, comparable to the Rochefort 10 and, just like it, even intimidating aroma, suggesting an onslaught of flavors. The promise falls slightly short. The taste is intense and powerful, but undermined a tiny bit by excessive dryness and a lighter than expected mouthfeel. Classic Belgian tartness dominates, its much less sweeter than the 10. Nutty flavors arise after a while, providing another dimension of flavor. I sense a fizzy carbonation and a mouthfeel thats too dry to feel this chewy Belgian bomb I was expecting. I like it a lot anyway. The finish and the aftertaste are a little bit dull. Even though I am slightly dissapointed, I can sense traces of grateness in-between the Champagne-like fizziness and dry character. This one is unripe. I will store another specimen and drink it near the "expiration" date. Its really good, but, as is, I would take a Chimay Bleue or a La Trappe Quadrupel anytime over this one.

After reading some of these reviews my bottle may have been a bad one. Head dissipated quickly, little to no aroma. The taste was very mild, like a thick caramel lager, not much hint of the alcohol but none of the fruit and spice I was expecting. Disappointing but will try again to compare.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 Dark brown with a hint of red. Big off white head with good retention. Aroma of dark fruit, roasted malt and toffee. Sweet taste with round malty body and a nice warm bite from the alcohol. Fantastic beer, however the 10 is even better imo. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown with a tiny bit of red, persistent head. Smells like plastic, soap, wood, chocolate, and fig. Just off-Dry, mild bitterness and astringency, mild sourness, medium-full body. Tastes like chocolate, fig, plastic, wood, vanilla, and cream. Finish is sourish, long, and complex. Remarkably well-hidden alcohol. Delicious. So powerful and complex, but so drinkable. Amazing how well the body, alcohol, and sweetness are kept in check.
33 bottle.Dark brown colour and off white head.Sweet fruits and spices.Warming mouthfeel and semi dry finish.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 Tonaca di frate leggermente chiara con riflessi giallognoli, velata dai lieviti in sospensione, schiuma beige chiara abbastanza persistente visto il grado alcolico.
Aroma di pera e banana, leggero tostato e leggero sentore di fichi, leggero sentore oleoso.
Al palato stesse note fruttate, in prevalenza pera che permane anche nel retrogusto insieme ad una gradevole nota di frutta sotto spirito, zucchero candito, leggero tostato e leggerissimo cacao.
Corpo pieno, oleosa, carbonatazione media, un capolavoro, come la 10 daltronde.

------ cl. Best before end 2019, Cuvée 2014, aperta il 23 aprile 2016, tenuta in cantina per oltre un anno.
Rossa e limpida priva di lieviti, tonaca di frate e velata con laggiunta di questi ultimi; schiuma beige copiosa e di buona persistenza.
Aroma di frumento e cereali, pera, fichi secchi, leggera prugna e leggera albicocca.
Al palato stesse caratteristiche con finale tostato sempre di cereali.
Corpo pieno, mediamente carbonata.

Pours a copper clear color with a thin white head that disappears really quick. Aromas of candied fruits plums, raisins, caramel. Similar taste, sweet and fruity, very balanced. Plums and raisins at first with a caramel note followed by bread and toffee. Medium body with medium carbonation. Very smooth and really nice.

A nice Belgian overall. Pours a great deep red with a tan head. Smells of cherries and strawberries. Taste is very fruity, with Belgian yeast, lots of cherries, as well as some strawberry, and a hint of vanilla and caramel. Had in the bottle.

Cloudy brown with amber edges. Huge beige head with high retention. Hazelnut aroma with notes of malt and pepper. Some alcoholic breeze. Not excessively sweet for the style, with some bittet - that's what I like in this beer. Medium to full body.

Bottle from Spar supermarket, Rochefort, Belgium. This is a very dark brown, hazy beer that pours with a huge rocky head of white foam. It has a very rich plum, currant, burnt toffee and spicy star anise flavour, a luxurious warming mouthfeel followed by boozy sherry, oak and vanilla on the finish. One of the best beers I have ever tasted!

Rödbrun färg med litet skum. Fyllig smak med russin och liknande. Trevlig men inte topp

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a bottle. Slight aroma of Vegemite toast, lasting head, super smooth, no hint of the strength, very tasty drop.

Colore rosso scuro, schiuma cremosa non eccessiva.
Odore fruttato, frutta matura, fichi.
Frizzantezza medio-alta.
Sapore molto frutttato, dolce, leggero caramello, finale piuttosto secco che smorza bene le note dolci. Lacool si fa sentire. Da meditazione.

Pours an effervescent cherry wood color with full finger of loose beige head that diminishes to a thin milky substance that clings to the surface. Musty yeast aroma with notes of cloves, sourdough, and dark fruits. Excellent taste of spiced rum, caramel maltiness, cherries, and marzipan. Creamy texture with dry finish. Nicely balanced.

Copenhagen 30/7 2015. 33 cl bottle from Gunnar Madsens Vingandel. Aggressively foaming upon opening. Pours hazy brown with small white head. Disappears fairly fast. Sweet fruity aroma with some yeast and fermentation in the background. Some tart notes for balance. Fizzy carbonation. Taste is well balanced between sweet fruity fermentation and a little sourness. A fine Belgian Dark Ale. Maybe a bit aggressively carbonated.
Really good beer, with nice color and dense froth (as every trappist beer). However, Id rather drink an Orval or Westmalle because this one is too strong
UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 Brown color big frothy head that stays long. Intensive aroma of spices,dark fruits and belgian yeast. Very similar taste with lots of spices, dark fruits and yeast. Very nice

Очень приятно& насыщен& пиво каштано& цвета с густой, липкой пеной. В аромате четко выделяю& черносл& ноты. Вкус пряный со множест& сухофру& долгое послевк& Но и во вкусе и в аромате мне чего-то не хватило, особенн& если сравнив& с 10-кой.

Meiner Meinung nach sogar etwas besser als das Rochefort 10. Runder, weniger Alkoholgeschmack, dadurch mehr Aroma welches durchkommt.
Super lecker.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 top class belgian. well balanced. hidden abv. taste is strong, but highly drinkable.

Pours similar in color and sediment to it´s big brother.

Aroma is alot more subdued on this one compared to the 10, less of everything is what hits me! Still rich dark fruits, plums, figs.

Taste follows the same road of shadowing it´s big brother in awe i can imagine as it lacks something in all the categories compared to the 10, the difference in price and abv is just not justifiable to me to choose this over the 10 at any time if you can have any of them! If the 10 is not available the 8 suddenly becomes a top class belgian dark strong beer! 
Perfect example of living in the shadow of something better!

Bottle from SB.
Pours big head, fades very quickly and eventually disappears. Murky dark brown. Plum, raisin, fig, musk, cola aroma. All matching flavours. High carbonation.

Valkoinen, kuohuva, iso vaahto. Huumaavan intensiivinen tuoksu. Hapokas alkoholinintensiivinen suutuntuma, kolamainen sihinä? Jälkimaku juuri ja juuri alkoholinpoltteiseksi kutsuttava, makea, täyteläinen. Todella hyvää.

Bottle. Pours dark hazy brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of dark ripe fruits, some vinous notes, caramel, alcohol, raisins, malty notes. Taste is dark dried fruits, some ripe dark fruits aswell, vinous, chocolate, caramel, dark malts.

One of the major Trappists is undoubtedly Rochefort. Its beautiful dark brown with a foam is slight, but persistent. In addition to a malty aroma I can smell both flower and fruit as well as slightly perfumed aroma. It has an extremely complex flavor where both caramel malt and lots of fruit (plum, raisin) mixes with a little flower. It has a bit perfurmed taste. I can usually hate this tasty perfume, but in this splendid beer is so little to the other good flavors overtones it. The alcohol is present in the taste, but is by no means. Palate is huge and I can taste the beer for a very long time. As several other reviewers have already written, I would also strongly recommend that this beer can not be enjoyed too cold. It will simply be devastating for all the good flavors it contains.
Aroma agradável, aparência escura, espuma densa e sabor adocicado deixando um ótimo paladar.

Bottiglia. Colore bruno scuro, poca schiuma bianca. Ed ora inizia il bello. Aroma molto complesso, che ad occhi chiusi fa viaggiare la mente. Frutta matura, lievito, note di cioccolato, malto, minima componente luppolata, spezie. Il sapore è dolce e suadente, nota amara minima per una combinazione aggraziata, riscaldata dalla componente alcolica - che, bisogna dirlo - non è prorompente nonostante i 9,2 gradi. Carbonatazione decisa, corpo medio - pieno, retrogusto duraturo. Fenomenale.

Very carbonated and malty. Strong flavor with a lingering aftertaste, but not in a bad way. Not as dark as I expected and definitely a sipping beer. Great for a night at home and a good movie.

Cerveja maravilhosa, espumação que persiste até o fim, aroma maravilhoso levemente adocicado, sabor incrível e harmônico
Pours brownish purple with a quickly disappearing small white head. Medium carbonation. Some sweetness, possibly toffee, and some fruitiness. Good beer that is obviously strong at 9.2%.
Рошфоры лучшие из бельгий& но восьмер& конечно, уступае& десятке в полноте вкуса. Все то же плотное тело, меньше цветочн& раскрыв& ну и после 0.33 не хочется ничего.
Rated based on notes taken 25 June 2012 -- This is a solid trappist brew. I really need to buy some to age and see how well they do.
