Plums. Figs. Drank warm. Incredibly dry. Much more drinkable than a rochefort 10. Quite complex. Really enjoyable....makes me think Im not sure why people drink crappy beer
33 cl. flaske. 9,2 %. Mørk øl let sødlig smag. Passer meget bedre til min smag end 10ren. Velkomponeret.

Pours a cloudy plum brown color with a huge bubbly white head. Lots of carbonation. Nose is so complex. At first you kind of get a sweet candy. After that you get Dark Fruits, Plum, Spices, Fruits that I cant quite put my finger on. I also get hints of chocolate some toffee. Sweet taste at first that is pretty well balanced with some hops and some alcool to finish. Medium to full body with lively carbonation and a long finish. Probably the best beer I ever tasted.

How can a beer so good? Although there are those who believe that the number 10 as there is nothing, I think that, having his name a few, beer is a brutal, balanced, not so demanding as the number 10 or so blunt. A wonder of which I never tire.
Cloudy amber color with creamy off-white head. Aroma is caramel, fruit. Taste is Strong sweet, with tiny alcohol finish. A good one.
A dark brown beer with a good head. The aroma has fruity and chocolate notes. And the flavor is very complex with notes of fruit and chocolate

DATE TASTED: June 21, 2015... GLASSWARE: Affligem chalice... OCCASION: Father Day celebration, part three--third good beer! APPEARANCE: dense, dark plum-brown body that sports a white, half-finger head; sediment floats in the head;... AROMA: earthy plum early, with leafy, wet cigar hints as well; cherry, port, and berry--complex and promising... PALATE: dry, lively, yet monkish in its assertion; creamy and smooth; warming and tart, with a lengthy yet controlled finish that welcomes the next sip; surely, as drinkable a 9.1 ABV as could be... TASTE: prune, cherry, cranberry, subdued citrus fruit, dry malts--this beer is "special" indeed; pepper, anise and other spices... OVERALL: a fruity, masterful experience; flavorful, full and filling...
Fruity look and velvety colours. Raisen flavours with plum. High ABV is very well disguised with no real alcohol burn. Nice as it warmed.
Good all around brew. Tasty. Does the style well. would recomend to try some time.
Versa scuro.gusto dolce fruttato....le mura del monastero...il Belgio.La SPECIALE

To be upfront: Ive had this beer many times as it is certainly my favorite beer. Poured from a 33cl bottle into a Rochefort chalice.

Aroma: sweet, dark and malty, and yeasty, with toffee and fruit undertones.

Appearance: dark brown and hazy with an off-white head.

Taste: caramel, candy sugar, toffee and dark fruits (raisin). surprisingly subtle alcohol taste despite the ABV. very complex.

Palate: very smooth and warm.

Overall: very good, better, I think, than the Rochefort 10. A joy to drink every time.

Líquido turvo,coloração marrom,espuma mediana com boa durabilidade;aroma com boa complexidade,notando-se notas amadeiradas,frutas vermelhas,caramelo,malte tostado,álcool já notado;sabor encorpado,seguindo o aroma,porem com forte presença do álcool,o que desequilibrou o conjunto,alta carbonação,final seco e duradouro.
thick amber color with a thin off-white head. aroma is malt, yeast, dark fruit, and spice. Flavor is caramel, raisin, wood, and spice. sticky mouth feel and fizzy.
Amber brown color, medium head. Rich fruity and spicy aroma and taste. Long list of notes here, cloves, banana, raisins, nutmeg, black currant, strawberry, plum, to name a few. Absolutely great.

Gran espuma, parda, duradera. Color muy oscuro casi negra. Aroma especiado y chocolate. Muy buena en boca. Al principio entra bien y suave, caramelo o azucar tostado, frutas (cerezas?). Al final surge el regusto alcoholico (9 grados!) pero camuflado con especias, algo picante... Excelente

Pours hazy dark brown with medium and sparkling tan head, that quickly reduces. Nose is caramel, dry fruits and chocolate. Aromas are yeast, spice (pepper), chocolate, dry fruits and alcohol. Thin texture, fizzy carbonation. Long alcoholic finish.
UPDATED: AUG 22, 2016 Perfect as her bigger sister! Dark, smooth, tasty: spices, caramel, toffee. Medium bitter finish.
Dark brown, small head and no lacing. Aroma of dried fruits, spices and alcohol. Tastes dry, caramel and spicy, with a note of dark fruits. Medium bitterness, high carbonation.
Bottiglia. Non così complessa ed equilibrata come la sorella maggiore, ma rimane in ogni caso un prodotto eccellente

S:
-dark fruits,spices,caramel,toffee
T:
-Follows the nose
F:
-slight alcohol warming
-full body,high carbonation
O:
My fave Rochefort
Bottle 33 cl, pours a Brown colour with a beige head, aroma of dark fruits, Sweet taste followed by medium bitterness

Nez: Vineux, datte, sucré
Bouche: Caramel, raisin, chocolat, épicée
Un côté vineux très prononcé avec une touche de sucre
Une des meilleures trappistes sans hésitation.

Light hazy brown, thin ring and no lacing. Initial taste bright brassy sweet, caramelised lemon and throws back crisp brassy malt. Sweeping squeaky mouthfeel. Keen citrus, gummy lime on the backend. A nice stop gap and juicier than I remember. 2010 Vintage.

11.2 oz bottle, poured into an oversized wine glass at ~40 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours an almost opaquely murky red-brown, like a dingy bronze metal. Forms a relatively thin head of almost-white bubbles, which dies fairly quickly into a ring and a patchy cap. Lacing is adequate, somewhat patchy islands which slowly sink back down into the body of the beer.

Smell: Sweet candi sugar entwined with caramel and toffee wells out of the glass, bringing along some very faint hints of what might possibly be fruit - banana, raisin.

Taste: Caramel and toffee swirl to form the core of this beer, with slightly sour cherries filling in the lines where they twist together. Raisin and fig can be found as well, playing along the edges, with occasional cameo appearances by some faint banana notes. There is a sharp edge to the flavors, courtesy of the carbonation levels, but no real alcohol heat involved. The finish leaves behind a lingering ghost of caramel and bread.

Mouthfeel: This beer is loaded with incredibly prickly carbonation, and is quite lively indeed. Beneath the carbonation, theres a creamy, medium-bodied beer.

Overall: A tasty, tasty beer.

Bière brune au-dessus de laquelle flotte une atoll blanc cassé entouré dun mince anneau blanc de la même teinte. Nez très sucré de figues, de dattes marocaines fraîches, de sucre dorge, de fruits confits. Des épices également mais rien dagressif; ces épices sont douces et légères. En bouche jai limpression de manger de la pâte à biscuit aux brisures de chocolat avant la cuisson: cest moelleux, sucré, décadent... Des fruits noirs viennent ponctuer ce mélange sensuel au bonheur de mon palais admiratif. Longue, ronde, fruitée, sucrée et légèrement épicée, cette bière est une parfaite représentante du style! Même si ce style nest pas mon préféré, rendons à César ce qui appartient à César - cette bière est une Grande parmi les Grandes de ce style!

WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemno bursztynowa, klarowne. Piana mydlana, z wysokiej do bardzo niskiej - krótka.
AROMAT: Intensywny. Bardzo kompleksowy. Są charakterystyczne zapachy suszonych owoców (morele), podbudowa słodowo-alkoholowa, nuty korzenne, przyprawowe, kwiatowe oraz ziołowe.
SMAK: Wytrawne. Słodowo-alkoholowe. Posmak korzenno-ziołowy. Goryczka średnia - krótka. Dobrze "ukryty" alkohol.
OGÓLNIE: Świetnie zbalansowane i dostarczające sporych wrażeń smakowych i sensorycznych.

Pours a hazy, orangey dark amber with large, dense tan head that reduces very slowly but eventually leaves skim rather than lacing.
Despite the large head, the aroma is enormous: nuts, figs, rum, malt. You dont have to drink this beer to enjoy it, just drink it in. The taste builds on the nose, with chocolate, chestnuts, dates, pepper, bread, raisins, oak, vanilla.
The carbonation adds a creaminess that serves to clear these various notes, letting them stand out in turn and leads to almost neutral yet warm finish, less dense and sweet than its monumental sibling, number 10.
The 9.2 ABV suggests care should be taken, though it is not debilitating. But this is built to top off a meal, a liquid dessert, and makes a great finish to an evening.
Aroma some caramel eyes dark Brown Nice foam which sticks tot the glass it slowly fades away taste caramel, Spice, bitter not to much alcohol flavor for this % some dark malts a very good beer indeed

330ml bottle, pours a cloudy chestnut brown. Interesting nose; rum, chocolate, figs, dates, chestnut puree. Taste is incredible and difficult to describe without including finish. Briefly sweet and deeply malty but the carbonation lifts this away almost instantly, then a gentle wave of warmth slowly comes in bringing back the flavours of chocolate, mild oak, some nuttiness, sweet sticky fruit- dates, raisins, figs. Superb.

Pours a dark brown color, topped with a nice looking beige colored head. Aroma of yeast and cellar at first, some more pleasant notes of dark fruits and some grapes. Taste is better than the aroma. Sweet start, a bit chocolatey with medium bitterness following it. A bit more creamy. Not my favourite style in general.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruit, liquorice and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque red/brown beer with a medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruits, liquorice and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Rochefort yeast is simply amazing in whatever beer they produce. Slightly lighter in both the abv and the complexity compared to its big brother.
0.33 flaske. Klar mørk med hvit skum som varer. Aroma av gjær malt sitrus. Smak av karamell. Søt og mild. Veldig god
Cloudy amber color with creamy off-white head. Aroma is caramel, fruit. Taste is Strong sweet, with tiny alcohol finish. A good one.
Still not my jam, but much better than 10, dark fruits and a strong malt presence, not bad!

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2015 Amazing. The perfect dessert beer. Sweet candied sugar, dark fruit, creamy malts, maybe peanut butter. Fantastic beer. I might actually like this more than the 10. Sweet yeasty aroma from beautiful cream colored head. A dream.
Tykt skum med lang holdbarhed. Uklar mørkebrun. Sød med eftersmag. Fik 2 indenfor et døgn og den første havde en sur eftersmag men denne er god.
Beautiful. You just cant beat the classics. Caramel, chocolate aroma and taste, sought bubblegum and banana but just amazing.

Aroma: caramel, nuts, roasty, citrus, herbs, basement aromas, alcohol, banana, bubblegum, clove, raisin, vanilla;
Appearance: amber, hazy, vanishing frothy head:
Taste: intense sweetness, medium sourness, slight bitterness:
Palate: medium carbonation, long finish, full body, oily texture

Delicious, rich, luscious, well-rounded, well-hidden alcohol, intense yeast aromas. For slow savouring.

Bottle, pours dark brown, the head quickly drops to a persistent silky sheen. Caramel, raisin, bitter chocolate. For the ABV, very tempered alcohol tones, balanced sweetness, not cloying. A nice fruity after taste.

Bottle 0.33 l, Drink Hala, Wrocław, Poland.
Brązowe, mętnawe piwo o obfitej, puszystej i sztywnej pianie oraz przyjemnym, słodowym, owocowym aromacie. W smaku gęste i bogate, początkowo słodowe i owocowe, lekko słodkawe, przełamane kwaskowatością, następnie wytrawne, palone z biszkoptowymi nutami i rozgrzewającym finiszem.

Foam: two fingers thick pale brown head
Colour: dark brown
Aroma: quite complex, caramel, bread, hay, chocolate, toast, citrus, herbs, earthy, alcohol, banana, raisin
Taste: full complex body, a little oily, liquorice, raisin, caramel, chocolate and dark fruits, medium carbonation, its quite light in the mouth, sweet from the beginning to the end but also bitterness is present, very nice tasty complex beer

Aroma: dried fruits, caramel, citrus, bread, spicy
Taste: caramel, fruity, alcohol, bread

Piana lekko bezowa,sredniopecherzykowa wolno opadajaca,zostawiajaca lekki kozuch oblepiajacy scianki pokala,kolor lekko metny,bursztynowy,a w smaku juz poezja,rozgrzewajace juz od pierwszego lyka,czuc lekko alkohol,drozdze,suszone sliwki,rodzynki,lekko slodowe,goryczka bardzo nienachalna,zapac to suszone sliwki i rodzynki,bardzo dobre piwo
La trappiste quasi parfaite, un équilibre hors du commun. Un peu forte mais vaut vraiment le coups.

Bottle bought at Delhaize. Pours dark brown with a medium beige head.
Tastes cloves, dried fruit, sweet, alcoholic, bit hoppy bitterness,

Havia provado essa cerveja há 1 ano e meio e tinha gostado muito. Era uma das melhores. Provei novamente e achei aguada e com alcool perceptível. Apesar do exemplar vencer apenas em 2017, pode estar comprometido. Provarei novamente para tirar a dúvida.

Donkerder bier dan ik normaal drink maar wel lekker. Toch niet een waar ik er meer van achter elkaar hoef.

Robe ambrée sombre, opaque. Mousse bien.
Saveurs de malt, biscuit, fruits noirs, pruneau.
Texture crémeuse, carbonatation fine.
Très longue en bouche.
Excellente.

Bottle from the LCBO. Murky dark reddish brown body under a huge off white head that hangs around for a while. Leaves lots of spotty lace. Nose has lots of dark fruit, molasses, ginger, light cloves and pepper. Medium sweet fruit and toffee with a light bitterness and a slight red grape tartness with a pervasive balanced spiciness. Medium almost creamy mouth with a fine prickly carbonation and a long complex fruity finish. Great multi-faceted ale.

Bottle from Masuyos. Poured into a snifter. Pours a clear ruby tinged orange brown with a nice soapy two finger head that dissipates fairly quickly. Big aromas of fig, prune, and peach on the nose. Sweet on the palate but not overly cloying by any means. Medium body with an oily mouthfeel. As it warms up the alcohol shows just a bit, but for 9.2% it hides it all fairly well. Soft carbonation with a really nice warming finish. World class strong ale!

Pour two and half fingers of head on a hazy dark brown body.
The aroma candy, caramel and dark fruits. Nice.
The taste is perfect. Balanced fruit sweetness, a touch of brown sugar, some other stuff, amazing.
The texture is light and fizzy.
Outstanding.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2015 Nose: Sweet, alcohol. Taste: Mainly raisins, nuts, caramel, spices and roasted malts in the background. A bit port-ish. Full bodied, medium to full carbo. Nice!

Cloudy brown-amber with creamy fizzy beige head. Smells is malt, spice, fruit (fig, peach, apple), mineral. Taste is even more sweet and spicy but not cloying. Some cloves and grassiness. Almost salty finish. Palate is frothy but fine. High booziness (9.2%) well balanced. Lots of things going on in this beer without getting too big - a refined and complex example of a strong Belgian ale.
Nice typical strong ale aroma with tiny sour notes from the glass. Clear, copper color. Super pleasant taste. Alcohol perfectly covered. Its big and really good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2015 Bottle 330 ml, pours slightly cloudy hazel nut brown with ivory colored stable head. Aroma of nuts, raisins, dried fruits, barnyard, leather and earth. Low sweetness that switches fast earthy tartness with some bitter notes. In the finish there is again some light sweetness. Nice, but a little bit to tart for me. I prefer Rochefort 10.

dark fruits, chocolate, some caramel, spices; dark brown, rather hazy, brown/ruby reflexes, big and strong long-lasting beige foam; medium+ sweetness, medium bitterness; full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long sweetish finish;
Overall: very complex in aroma and taste, great looking, well hidden alcohol

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Dark brown, slightly hazy pour. Roasted malt, caramel, burnt sugar and more than a hint of alcohol. Faint hints of dark, stewed fruit.
Dark fruits in the taste.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2015 Poured from 33cl bottle at Sarpsborg Vinmonopolet in Norway. Slightly red coloured beer with a head that disappears quickly when poured. Nice aroma and fruity taste. Very pleasant to drink.
330 ml bottle. Fantastic trappist beer, personally prefered its brother the 10, but this one is really good has well.

Bottle - hazy chestnut with a large foamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, very nutty with peanuts, a little lavender, chocolate and hints of port. Taste of chocolate, roasted malts, bubblegum, hints of alcohol and some port. Medium body, low carbonation.

Dark amber to brown with a ruby hue, cloudy and floater friendly, beige strong and lasting creamy head. Aroma is sweet malt, toffee, brown sugar, some yeast, lots of dried fruits. Taste is moderate sweet malt, caramel, brown sugar, loads of dried fruits, bit of spices, some toast, bit of yeast and only a pinch of alcohol. Medium to full bodied and slightly creamy with a heavier moderate carbonation.
UPDATED: SEP 27, 2015 Brown, litte murky, with a tan head. Very much on dry fruits, fig, dates. Sweet with a somehow dry finish but no real bitterness. Oily body, quite fizzy. Good.

Unclear brown beer with a good white head.
The taste of this beer is slightly sweet with notes of spice, caramel and sweet chocolate.
Afthertaste is slightly sweet, a little dry and slightly bitter.
Dark Brown color, taste of belgian yeast and malts. Some nites of caramel and alcohol creamy consisten
Color caramelo. Aroma chocolate. Sabor chocolate y caramelo. Alta de alcohol y se nota en la boca.

Bottle. Red-brown color with beautiful steady fluffy beige head. Aroma is very complex and pleasant: belgian yeast, dry fruits, vanilla, apple, spice. Taste is also complex and balanced, light sweet, light tart, light bitter. Nice. 9,2% ABV cant be detected. Finish is mild, long. Brilliant one.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2016 Superlativa trappista, appena meno alcolica della mamma 10 ma non per questo meno goduriosa. Scura, alcolica, dolcezza inebriante, malti e caramello ti avvolgono, chiusura con una punticina di amaro a completare una perfetta compagna per la tarda serata.

De eerste keer dat ik dit biertje dronk was ik gelijk verkocht, zo smaakvol en toch eenvoudig weg te drinken. 

Deze ontploft minder als de 10, de 10 hou ik voor andere gelegenheden.

Deze staat heel hoog bij mijn lievelingen!

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2015 Cloudy brown with amber tones. Thick rocky head.
Intense caramel, banana and other secondary aromas such as bread crust, pie and cookie), accompanied by scents of honey and citrus.
Powerful and slightly sweet. Rotund and long, bitterless ending. Great.
Great beer Ive ever tasted. Ive got 5 month bottle and it was nice, with enough bitterness and really soft taste with some vine aromas and long complex aftertaste..

Classic from the country, still remains a great beer, even if it is a little more difficult to drink more than one with time (or should I say age). Maybe the mix alcohol and sugar. Anyway, still a great reference when in doubt.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2015 Bottle. Caramel color, same goes for the foam head. Aroma: roasted malts, bubblegum, chocolate, stale basement funk. Taste: sweet chocolate and caramel, whole wheat, slightly sour development. Medium to full body. Lacks the boozy sensation of the 10, which is a good thing imho. Slightly sticky aftertaste. Bit tingly mouthfeel, otherwise top notch.

Very dark brown colour with compact head. Aroma of dark malts, caramel, raisins, dark fruits. The same is the taste with little presence of herbs. Alcohol is notable but is also very well hidden. Overall Very good and complex beer, but for me still not in the same rang with Stuisse masterpieces.

Ciekawy aromat, alkoholowy, trochę karmelowy. Ciemne, nieprzejrzyste. Piany praktycznie brak. W smaku trochę wodniste, smak ciekawy. Alkohol w tle, prawie nie wyczuwalny, ale odczuwalny ;) Mocne nasycenie. Ogólnie rzecz biorąc dobre piwo, ale nie rozumiem dlaczego tak wysoko oceniane.
Despite the rave reviews, there was something about it I didnt like; Maybe I should try again.

Bottle, all the time. This is my absoute favorite beer in the world and whats best about it, its easily available where I live.The aroma is great, the appearance is brown, sparkling, the taste is heavy, but without the alcohol taste from the 12. As I stated, this is my absolute number 1.

Bottle. Dark brown color with thick light brown head. Aroma has yeast, raisin, caramel and plums. Taste is first little sweet but ends with a long quite bitter, a bit sour and dry aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, toffee, coffee, spices, plums, ripe fruits and some alcohol warmth.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy, reddish brown with a small beige head. Sweet fruity aroma of berries, plums, dried fruit, spice and yeast. Sweet flavour of dried fruit, plums, liquorice, spice, caramel and yeast with a dry, warming alcohol finish. Quite complex. Full body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Excellent.

Bottle at Brussels Hilton. Slight sour nose. Cloudy dark brown beer with solid off-white head which stays. Really tingly mouthfeel, quite fun. Taste is sour followed by deep dark malts. Alcohol notes all over the palate. Caramel becomes apparent as it warms. Complex sipping material, but not my favourite style.

Degustata da una bottiglia di 33 cl. Schiuma poco persistente colore ambrato scuro, caramelloso. Birra da meditazione più che da pasto, ma non si dice mai di no ad una Rochefort anche se la migliore è la 10.

Bottle. Dark amber, almost brown with medium persistent white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, plum, chocholate, very fruity. Taste is light bitter, with characteristic chocholate notes and moderate fruity sweetnes. Dry, alcohol well hidden. Very well balanced beer, perfect trapist!

Cloudy brown, Amber tint, off white head. Caramel, lite spice, berry, floral, and mild lemon aroma. Full bodied, mild alcohol, mild roast, mild salt, fruity, and lemon notes. Medium bitterness, nice dry notes, and balancing sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Post Office Vaults, Birmingham.

A Belter! Pours chestnut brown in colour, creamy off white single finger head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, toffee, light coffee, chocolate, dates, figs, raisins...exactly the same on the taste with added spices, ginger and some vineous notes. A Brute!

Bottle. Big tan off-white head very persistent. Hazy dark brown with reddish hues colour. Aroma is very ripe fruit, prune, with cocoa an caramel tinge and sligth sour milk hint. Taste is fruity (peach, plum and  prune), caramel, cocoa, somehow spicy with sweet acid finish. Full body, high carbonation, medium oily. Second similar rate tasting two different bottles bougth in two different shops. For me, not as good as most people rate it.

Prezentacja:
czerwień wpadająca w brąz, klarowne, piana średnio obfita, drobna, szybko opada do krążka
;
Aromat: 
miód, toffi, owoce bardzo dojrzałe, śliwki, rodzynki, nuta spirytusu
;
Smak: 
słodki, za aromatem, w finiszu karmel, po głębokim łyku czuć uderzenie czystego alkoholu
;
Odczucie: 
średnio treściwe, bardzo oleiste, mocno nasycone, 
;
Ogólnie:
niezłe, byłoby bardzo dobre, gdyby nie ten przebijający się w aromacie i smaku alkohol
.
Great beer. Malty flavour, a bit fruity, and full bodied sweet beer. it is quite fizzy.

Dampolla comprada al Alcampo. Rica en aromes i sabors maltosos (pa, galeta, briox, caramel...) i també en esters fruitats (plàtan, pera,cirera..) També te un punt dalcohol que la fa una mica escalfadora, per beure mica en mica...

Bottle at home. Beautiful typical hazy Rochefort chestnut brown colour, beige creamy head that nicely laces and lasts. Roasted malty nose and taste with light coffee, light milky chocolate, molasses, dried fruit like dates, figs and raisins, gingerbread, spices, light sweet red wine notes. Soft mouthfeel and carbonation, medium body.

NOTA DE CATA:
- Vista: Color marrón chocolate. Espuma abundante y duradera. 
- Nariz: El aroma es dulce, muy afrutado y con muchas notas de malta. 
- Boca: Afrutado y seco al final

3/15/15 (Bottle) - Very nice dark brown pour, nice tan head, very thick texture. Nice fruit and caramel aroma, intense toasted malt smells . Excellent tasting beer, nice kick while drinking. I still prefer the 10 to this 8, but these are among the top few beers Ive ever had. Highly recommended!!!
Awesome Belgian. Has all the flavours you want. Nice wheat, yeast, spice notes along with a not-too-overpowering alcohol heat.

Poured a dark copper to brown colour with a 1 inch off white head. Had plenty of visible sediment. Aroma is of dried fruits, malt, yeast, and hints of alcohol. Flavor is spice, caramel malt, and dried fruits like raisins or cherries. Progresses fairly well through each element as it flows through the mouth without any disturbance from the alcohol. Medium bodied with lively carbonation and a dry finish.

Bottle .33. Mahogany colored. Low malty aroma with traces of nuts, chocolate and dark fruits. Good light-brown creamy head. Clear medium to full body with some nice sediments and soft carbonation. Warmish body is due to all the alcohol. Sweet from the beginning to the end with barely enough bitterness. Spicy and a tad burnt, with caramel all over. Great beer, just too sweet for me.

Uitgeschonken in Rochefort bokaal, fraaie mysterieuze donkere bruine kleur, beetje mahonie, wat lichter dan de Rochefort 10, wordt troebel als je het gistdepot erbij schenkt, met  kaki beige schuimkraag die terugzakt tot een voortdurend aanwezige wat dunnere schuimlaag. De geur is fruitig, veel rozijnen, pruimen, chocolade en Belgische gist. De smaak volgt de geur, met zoete tonen van karamel, rozijnen, pruimen, vijgen en chocolade, iets zurige en krachtigere koffie, hout en aarde tonen, en fijne specerijen, iets van kruidnagel en zwarte peper voor de droge tonen in het smaakpallet. Ook de bittere hoptoets is aanwezig, zeker bij een jongere batch.Een zeer goed uitgebalanceerd bier met veel complexe tonen, het haalt niet de ongelooflijke complexiteit van de Rochefort 10 die mijn persoonlijke voorkeur heeft, maar is wel weer wat toegankelijker qua smaak. De afdronk is lang, medium droog en kruidig. Dit bier is een klassieke Belgische trappist, Brasserie Rochefort is een perfect voorbeeld van een artisanale bierbrouwerij, en geeft aan waarom Trappistenbieren wereldwijd zo geliefd zijn.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2015 Reddish dark brown with brown head, velvety beige head on a wide Rochefort glass. Aroma has fruits, both fresh and dried, pear, herbs, liquorice. Taste has caramel sweetness, still rather dry, malts, dark fruits and raisin, fig, simpler than nose.
Raisin spice aroma. Intense head to begin with. Orange and amber colored body. Some sediment. Raisin malt flavor. Warming on the palate. Finish is dry.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2016 Visual marrom escuro e floculada. Espuma de boa formação e persistência. Aroma alcoolico, nozes. Cerveja complexa, licorosa, variedade de sabores, toffe, caramelo. Alcóol bastante presente, preenche o paladar completamente. A versão vendida no Brasil não é tão fresca quanto a da Belgica, mas já tras otimas memórias.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2015 Отличны& бельгий& крепкий эль, питкий, приятны& несмотр& на крепось. Один из лучших траппис& элей, постоян& участни& разных рейтинг&
Smakt hjemme i ølglass. Flott balanse mellom fylde og bitterhet. Kamuflerer alkohol styrken godt. Et godt øl.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 18E). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 15:32:21 AROMA: spicy alcohol aroma with notes of dried cherries, supported by a caramelised sweet malt note. APPEARANCE: light brown color and hazy. average moussy, beige head with good retantion and lacing. TASTE: similar to the aromas but less pronunced. spicy notes, some caramel and dried cherries and faint figs. low bitterness with a sweet finish. PALATE: high carbonation with medium-light body. alcohol warmth noticeable. OVERALL: a less intense autentic trappist ale.

bottle at home. light brown cloudy color, big tan head. smells light yeasty, light milky smell, raisins, alcoholic. full body, very nice full mouthfeel, liqueurish / alcoholic, astringent, fruity, citric, bubbly dry astringent finish. actually quite little smell, but overall quite good.

This is a great beer. This one today extra yeast floating. It also had a lot of foam. It was still very tasty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle from Westholme Stores, Goring. A deep copper coloured pour with a thick cream head that falls back to a tight layer; the aroma has vinous fruits, soft brown sugar, and Belgian yeast; its quite light in the mouth with some soft carbonation on the tongue, and some raisins and demerara sugar; a a touch of spicy dryness, before a gentle warmth emerges to give a pleasantly rounded finish. A well balanced, well made, ale.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2015  dunkelbraun mit wenig aber lang anhaltendem hellem Schaum. Tolle Aromen nach getrockneten Früchten, Rosinen, Karamell. Wenig bitter. 
Gutes Bier!

 8	/	8	/	8	/	8	/	5	/	5	/	5	/	5	/	83

One of my favorites! Much more balanced than Rochefort 10.
Subtle yet strong aromas, beautiful dark color with a yellowish foam.
The taste is just perfect with a strong but not overwhelming body.
Bottle. Pours Very hazy light borwn with moderate head. Aroma of ripe fruits, caramel and spices. Taste is more of the same. Complex, adequately carbonated and balanced. Very good.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2015 Botella. Color marrón rojizo. Espuma beige muy claro de baja formación, jabonosa pero q aun persiste algo. Aromas a frutos negros, higos, malta, azúcar, levadura, cola, cereza, alcohol, amaretto...notas picantes y especiados. En boca es aceitosa pero ligera. Carbonatacion tiende a baja. En boca se aprecia los matices del aroma...dulce, algo alcoholica, y en final predomina la levadura "picante". Me parece q se aprecia el alcohol q tiene, no menos. Muy buena Birra...limpia...a ver q tal la 10.

The aroma is very subtle for a strong Belgian ale. Hints of fruityness, but of course caramel and roast. The appearance is neat: dark red, even brown, with a small yellow white foam. The taste is delicious: perfect mouth, with long, very long aftertaste. A strong palate, even with this 9.2 % alcohol version.

Rated from beer log from 2009 Belgian Trip.... 2000 vintage from Kulminator in Belgium... Aroma is phenomenal, dark brown caramel color, foamy tan head that dissipated immediately... Aroma is brown sugar, candi sugar, maple syrup... Flavor is breathtaking, more balanced than the 10, alcohol less prominent... Candi sugar gives it a fruity sweetness that is not cloying, dark fruits... Finish is more gentle, subtle than the 10, but maybe not as good... Very clean, outstanding beer

Bottle. Pours hazy dark orange with off-white head. Aroma is very fruity, lots of grape, prunes, sweet-fruit forward malt. Taste is medium bodied, high carbonation, lightly sweet, malt forward. Overall, very nice.

Bottle. Copper with largish beige head. Aroma malts, dried apricots, banana. Quite full body, taste bananas, cinnamon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Such a great bouquet, notes of yeasts, sugars, bread, plum and figs. The flavour is very well balanced. It starts off with a yeasty breadyness that fades to a fruity character and ends very sweet with a marzipan flavour. Mouthfeel is full with plenty of carbonation. Very complex and extremely tasty.
Very sweet, fruity aroma. Plums, raisins, almonds, figs. Pours hazy deep brown/red with medium but strong head. Taste is sweet with delicate hoppy finish. Extremely good beer!
Jeg elsker trappistøl, men denne er bare ikke lige mig. Dufter for meget af skimmelost

Soon as you pop off the cap the foam starts to rise so I had to pour quickly. The beer pours a hazy dark drown color reminiscent of cola with a medium creamy off white head. The aroma is dark fruits, raisins, dates, figs, alcohol, caramel, and some chocolate. The taste is caramel up front and rather sweet like candy. There is some alcohol presence that can be noticed but it does not take away anything from the beer. I also pick up the fruitiness and some breadiness as well. This is a world class beer that every beer drinker needs to try at least once.
Gelijk verknocht aan dit bier, de volle zoete smaak is heerlijk. de fles heeft een ouderwetse uitstraling die me zeer aanstaat.
Heerlijk sterk bruin bier. Licht zoetig en kruidig van smaak. Mooi bier die ook goed binnenkomt. 9,2%

The second best beer in the world, only number 8 (Rochefort of course) is able to beat this beer, which undoubtedly had been sent from heaven by god himself.
brown, clear, frothy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Pours ruby brown and hazy with a frothy and long-lasting light tan foam. Rich and sweet aroma of caramel, yeast, bread, chocolate and orange. Medium body, creamy feel, medium carbonation. Taste complements the sweet aroma with more citrus, licorice, dried fruits and spices. Medium bitter and dry finish with some alcohol, almost like a full bodied wine.
Very balance Trappist. Strong sweet nose with hint of plum. Tastes about the same. Alcohol is very balance for a 9%.
Best of Rochefort. Not so much alcohol in 10, the taste is softer and balanced to me. Sweet, rich, well

Goldenes rotbraun. Fester, langer Schaum. Pflaumen-Honigsromen, malzig. Malzigsüsslich zu Beginn, weiter Pflaumen und Gewürze. Viel Co2, lebendig. Recht vollmundig-cremig. Kaum Bitter, Slk gut wahrnehmbar. Im Abgang trocken und doch süsslich.

Large ivory head that cozies into a comforting top. Malty smell of the 10 with the dried fruit smell of the 8. An abstract fruit, candy flavor with breadiness. Best of both worlds from the rochefort brand!
Brune, trouble, avec une mousse crème. Nez sucré, caramélisé, dalcool et épicé. Goût caramélisé, de sucre cuit, dalcool, danis, un petit quelque chose de fruits confits... Superbe!

I cant believe Ive not had this before, but Ive now completed the Rochefort set. Deep dark brown, with a small beige head and decorative lacing. Has a similar malt loaf aroma to the 10, just not as pronounced. Medium bodied with a nice bit of tongue tingling carbonation. Taste is malty and a bit boozy, and its the finish that turns it from a good to great beer. Thats when you get the dough, plum, dried fruit and spices like a delicious dessert. Very tasty, but Id still recommend the 10 which takes it to a higher level again.

A dark muddy brown body, crowned by a thick slightly off-white head (oh those Belgian yeasts), that settles down nicely into little more than a film riding on top of the beer.
Aromas are molasses, raisins, fig newtons, and a bit of brown sugar tickling the background.
I let this one warm for a bit from the fridge before opening, to maximize the tastes, which echo the aromas. There is a fairly thick mouthfeel,with a slight viscosity as it glides over the tongue. Its highly complex, and keeps adding to its repertoire with each sip. Definitely some alcohol presence entering the mix. Now getting some sweet nuttiness, and prune juice. I would compare this to the best bread puddings I have had, contained in a glass. A simply wonderful World Class beer.

Very nice pour with creamy, tan foam. Nose of malt and roasted fruit. At first, the taste was a bit underwhelming, more alcohol, but as the beer breathed, a very well-rounded bunch of flavors (malt, herb, fruit). Quite delicious overall. A top-notch beer.

Very good beer. Only rated this low due to aroma, of which I detected little, hence the lower score. Taste, to me, is quite malty but not a heavy bread taste. Nice thick head. Really, really solid beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33 bottle purchased at the Beer Store of Skopje (RIP) and consumed in Kosovo. The bottle is about 2 years aged. Pours a dark amber-brown color, medium beige foamy head which slowly fades away. Nose: perfect toffee candy, caramel, dry figs and chestnut honey. Just amazing and balanced combination of these notes. Mouth: highly carbonated, light and grassy final. The body is not that heavy, the alcohol stays quite hidden although the beer provides the right warmness for which it was meant. The dry fruit is gently softened buy that bitter end in a body which stays warm enough.

Po przelaniu do szkła trunek ma mahoniową mętną barwę, piana beżowa, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, nietrwała. Aromaty delikatne i bardzo zrównoważone, przede wszystkim suszone owoce (figi, daktyle, rodzynki) jak i świeże brzoskwinie, czereśnie, winogrona. Wyczuwalna także nuta domowej nalewki wiśniowej i miodu pitnego, lekka przyprawowość, landrynki a nawet czekolada. W smaku poezja - jest bardzo owocowo, kwiatowo, troszkę karmelu i ciemnego pieczywa, lekka słodycz kontrowana likierowo-korzennym muśnięciem goryczki i ledwo zaznaczonej jeżynowej kwaskowatości na finiszu. Fajnie podkreśla to wszystko dość wysokie, ale przyjemnie orzeźwiające nagazowanie, co nadaje lekkości temu ciężkiemu i pełnemu przecież trunkowi. 
Niesamowite piwo, bardzo dobrze ułożone, zbalansowane, mimo wysokiego woltażu alkohol niewyczuwalny (poza ciepłem w gardle).

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 23.09.2019. Brazowe, z plywajacymi po pokalu (osiadajacymi na dnie) drozdzami - trudno to piwo nazwac pieknym. Bardzo bujna piana (nie bylem w stanie wlac butelki 0.33l do tulipa Duvala, do ktorego bez piany miesci sie 0.5l, a nie wlewalem wcale jakos agresywnie). Piana jest stosunkowo ladna, ale tylko przez chwile, opada dosc szybko i to w niespecjalnie uroczy sposob, w sensie pecherzyki staja sie coraz wieksze. Na szkle zostaje tylko symbolicznie, na piwie cienka warstewka. Zapach niezwykle intensywny i zlozony. Przede wszytkim owoce. Duzo, roznorodnych owocow. Figi, winogrona (tez rodzynki), wisnie, banany, jablka, sliwki... sporo przypraw delikatnych, troche karmelu czy krowek, slad gumy balonowej, niemalo drozdzy, conieco slodow, zboza, chleba. W ustach, smak pasujacy do aromatu, bardzo mila pelnia, gladkie, dosc mocno wysycone - ale nieprzeszkadzajaco. Czuc te wszystkie owoce. Alkohol ladnie ukryty, ale tylko w smaku, bo zarazem pozytywnie rozgrzewajacy. Goryczka niewielka ale obecna w tle. Sumarycznie: najwyzsza pólka. TO bylo bardzo swieze piwo. Jesli ktos w wawie ma w piwniczce takie pod koniec okresu waznosci albo i po, to ja bardzo chetnie jakis deal bym zrobil :)11 marca, pod mosteczkiem. tradycyjnie za zimne - ale po ogrzaniu znow to samo... dzisiaj akurat mialem wrazenie ciut mniej intensywnego aramota, ciut bardziej intensywnego smaku... ale oceny nie zmieniam bo i po co :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Pours brown with beige big head.Aroma is sweet, raisins, almonds,malty, caramel, wood, dark sweet fruits. Taste is medium (or more) sweet, malty, alcohol,yeast, raisins, watery-something really annoying me . Full body. Too sweet for me. But if you like sweet beers, then its for you.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2015 (revisited in March 2015 with a bottle that had a BB date stamp of Sept. 2017 - thanks RAH!).

A - cloudy dark amber. Semi-durable, fizzy tan head.

S - unique; highy complex, fruity, moderately strong and very inviting,  with a clear note of toffee from the malts.

M - effervescent; neither light nor heavy

T - balanced, complex, somewhat sweet. Fruity/malty finish with hints of dark bread, figs, dates, raisins and toffee.

O - Superb!  A revelation (initial tasting). Remains the best bottled Belgian beer Ive had, including the Rochefort 10.

Pours with a red hue and a frothy off-white head. Aroma is syrupy sweet with fruity resin and a noticeable hint of booze with a single note of what I can currently only think to describe as brown. The carbonation gives a dry sense which is an interesting juxtaposition with the impression of sweetness provided by the fruity, fairly complex hop profile. Its big and mouthfilling and it truly is a great beer but its reasonably intense and varied nature makes it necessarily a one-off enjoyment.

Served in a trappist glass. Brown with a medium beige head. Aroma is chocolate, yeast, raisins, cherries, nuts, caramel, molasses and some wood and alcohol. Taste is yeast, vanilla, caramel, molasses, grapes, raspberry, prunes, chocolate, some light bitterness and alcohol. Finish is spicy and sweet. Full bodied. Tasty beer, good trappist!

0.33l bottle. Hazy and very dark orange/brown body, huge off-white head. The aroma is quite sweet and its pretty complex. It reminds me of caramel, figs, orange peel, nuts and it also has a slight boozy character. Taste of caramel, toast, figs, toast, peach and some cocoa. The alcohol is warming but not harsh at all. Its not as good as the 10 for me, but still an awesome beer.

Dark colour. Good carbonation. Very "fresh" feel in the mouth. 
A very good(and strong) beer indeed!

1st: gushing on opening :(
Aroma: chocolate, red fruits (cherry etc), slightly alcohol. In fact it smells like pralines with cherry.
Apearrance: wine ruby, clear, 2 fingers head disappears immediatly.
Taste: sweet, red fruits, reminds me of red dry wine, notes (just minimal) of chocolate/caramel from malts. 
Palate: light body, thin, pretty fizzy.Slightly alcoholic on finish.
Overall: 1st of all, got gushing on opening, so maybe theres something wrong with this bottle. Beer reminds me light, dry red wine. Its good but expected way more in taste and aroma from such a famous beer. And its just good beer.

Somehow Ive never tried this sacred nectar, and lord have I been missing out. Pour is burnt orange with a massive tan cap that roars like a waterfall as it forms. Fifteen minutes later it still sounds like a glass of Coke. Nose is heavy on ripe fruit: figs, prunes, raisins, cherries, with toffee/caramel, hazelnut, yeast, spice and booze. Taste-wise its less sweet than I expected, with bitter/sour notes balancing it out. Finish is dry with lingering alcohol warmth. This stuff is stupid drinkable for a 9.2% abbey beer. Time to buy a bunch more and (try to) cellar them.
Dark pour, caramel and sweet but very yeasty! This beer is delicious! Heavy yet not too heavy
How: Bottle Appearance: hazty brown, white head Aroma: vanilla, chocolate, raisins, plums, Palate: medium to full body, smooth carbonation, long finish

Purchased at Binnys in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home on a frigid evening after work. Appearance is a very murky caramel brown with a huge bubbly and frothy off white head that laces to the glass. Aroma is huge, very yeasty, notes of cherry, caramel, spice, dark fruit, smells great. Taste is huge and boozy, fig notes, whiskey, spice, raisin, definitely complex with a thick body and carbonation. Great stuff, happy to have had this.
It is, without doubt, a 5 stars beer which has a very intense aroma, brown colour and intense taste. An excellent beer from an excellent brewery.
330ml bottle at the Beerstore, Thessaloniki. Dark brown-red color with small frothy beige head. Sweet fruity, wineous aroma. Sweet taste like aroma. Medium oily body with flat to soft carbonation.

It has strong aroma and nice appearance. The color is brown and there are some sediments in the bottom of the bottle, I'm not sure what it is. You can feel strong alcohol when you take a swig and I love the taste very much.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Robe brune. Nez puissant sur des notes épicées, de la banane, une note de caramel, pointe de houblon et de levure. Bouche à lattaque ample, une belle mousse crémeuse, de la rondeur, de la puissance, de la longueur et de la complexité. Une très belle bière, plutôt de repas ou de fin de soirée.

Bottle 0.33l at Oluttupa Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. BBE 08.10.2019. Colour is cloudy light brown with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Spices, hints of anise, perfume, tackiness, hints of chocolate?, Belgian yeast and malts. Not very drinkable.
Bière aux aromes équilibrés, sucre de canne, cereales. Petite carbo . Finale courte ou un arome fruité fait son apparition.
Average joe beer. Something metalic about the beer. Taste is more boozy without the feeling of much to the recipe. Flat flavoe and underwlelming experience.

Robe légèrement ruby carbo moyenne collet persistant. 
Aromes fort de fruits bien mûr.
Bien ronde et chaleureuse aux saveurs encore fruité.
11.2 Fl OZ ($5.59) one of the best without a doubt. flavor is perfect. a great beer for all occasions.

Bottle. Pours a deep amber/brown color with a medium sized off-white head. Sweet aroma of malt, caramel, fruits and yeast. Taste is of malt, caramel, fruits, yeast, hops and alcohol. Body and carbonation above medium. Sweet and sugary with a slightly tart finish. Definitely a great Belgian Strong ale that is "up there" with the best".

Pours a ruby/copper colour with a large foamy natural white head. Aromas of plum, fig, Belgian yeast, and some light cherry are present. It's medium body and fizzy carbonation do give it somewhat of a soda feel, but not in a bad way. Fairly dry in the tongue, some warming alcohol, notes of fruit, bitter cherry. This is a very modest beer, no intense flavours jumping out, everything is very subdued.

good, but this is a big dropoff from the Rochefort 10. aroma had something a bit different, sort of a cola feel to it. raisins, figs and such are touted in the description. i can see that. its a good beer, but considering it was the same price as a Rochefort 10, Ill just go for the 10 next time.

330 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with laying foamy head. Aroma is Belgian yeast, raisin, alcohol, sweet. Taste has hints of fruit, alcohol, raisin, not sweet. Alcohol warmth on the finish. Not sure it?s 100...but very good. I prefer this over the 10.
bottle shared with chad at the dub, brownish hazy pour with thin whitehead, aroma and taste is prune, some raisen, ad alcohol,, good stuffs

Bottle pour. Pours a dark, muddy color with a head that lasts forever. Semi sweet , but overall mild aroma with light fruit. Dusty flavor up front, very light fruit notes hidden in there. Minimum sweetness. Some light fruit, but overall there isnt much going on here. Nothing offensive about it, but it wasnt anything spectacular. Definitely liked it though. Good.

Bottle. Dark color with ruby hints and off-white head with substantial lacing. Fruit aroma with fig notes. Plum with some fig upfront with some cherry notes. Sweet finish with cherry notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tulip. Very dark hazy brown with orange around the edge of the glass. Thick marshmallow head that dissipates reasonably quickly. Smell is fresh hops, yeast, dried spice. Rich fruit, raisin, plums, figs, caramel, cracker/bread, honey, berry, hops. Crisp flavour that keeps developing in your mouth. Good body but overwhelmingly fizzy.

Cloudy brown pour, creamy off white head. Nose is leather and cherries. Bittersweet. Middle wraps your tongue in soft dark fruit, coco nibs and metal. Finish returns to the soft leather and drying yeasts. Wow!

Color is a hazy brown with high carbonation apparent. Smell is malty. Taste is like a christmas cake with a part containing purely sweet icing as well as dried fruits. Quite a bit of different burnt sugars Feel is gentle, old. Yeasty phenolics are pleasant and mild. Aroma is boring but a good beer.
0,33l Flasche. Dunkles Bier mit hellem Schaum. Riecht nach Röstmalzen. Scmeckt nach reifen Früchten und Röstmalz.
33cl @ bottle. Sorellina minore della Rochefort 10. Belgian Strong beverina e fruttata, un classico.

330ml bottle served around 15 degrees in a tulip glass:

Deep brown pour reminding one of prune juice exposing rich cherrywood highlights. The tanned head feels foamy, onctuous and settles down as a porous layer offering great lacing. The nose is nutty and has a lot going on with sugar cane, roasted malts, plums, dattes and even hickory and some smoke way in the back. The taste also has a lot to offer with a sweet attack from the sugar cane paired with the malts, resulting in a nutty chocolate presence with a subtle alcohol backbone. You get a medium lasting finish with a somewhat woody feature. On the tongue, this fine brew feels foamy as it explodes in your mouth and develops a nice oily texture. This is why I love tasting beer because once in a while you put your hands on a brew that just throws you off your chair (and for a good reason). Simply put, this ale is a must.
Malty, very classic aroma with a same malty taste, complex. Good, when youre out on your own and want to enjoy a classic trappist.

Very good tripel. Not nearly as complete in taste and palate feeling as the rochefort 10 which is my favorite beer. Nevertheless the aroma is for me still a wonderfully sweet, fruity, and with a caramel like smell that I cant get enough of. Appearance is similar to the 10; a murky reddish brown with some yeast. Not the most beautiful in appearance, but still very good retention on the head, which i like.

Excellente belge forte des trappistes Rochefort.Très fruitée et moins forte que la 10.Corps de malt moins torréfié et liquoreux mais le restant tout de même beaucoup.Belle complexité de fruits mûrs et liqueur : cerises, fruits rouges.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2015 di sicuro non al livello della suo sorella maggiore (rochefort 10) ma comunque di notevole impatto...il tutto inizia con un aroma di spezie e fico che continua con un sapore deciso e leggermente secco e amarognolo nel complesso molto piacevole.

Clear dark brown with ruby-red tints, a fine off-white head. Lovey malt aroma with fruit (plums), lightly spicy, yeast. The flavour is sweet, malt and caramel, fruits, spices, very little bitterness. Beautiful and a fine younger brother to one of my all-time favourites.
0,33 cl bottle. Cola brown coloured beer with cream head. Taste notes are dark chocolate, light fruity, creamy and coffee. Quite intense with a good glow in taste. Its remarkably easy to drink.
Nice beer... Strong but very pleasant to drink and paired with all types of foods! Cheers
Rusty brown color during the pour. Recommend to drink in a tulip glass which allows the beer to open up. Enjoyed but prefer #10!

Brown with tan head. Aroma is plums, cherry, licorice, spicy Belgian yeast, vanilla and caramel. Slick palate. Aftertaste is rich, fruity, dark chocolate, caramel, cherry, some licorice and lasting spicy finish.
Nice taste, chocolate and a bit of fruits, lasts long. Aroma not noticable yet due to low temperature. Nice brownish colour with a small whitebrown head. Overall a nice trappist.
Beer is decent, fresh or frisky compared to The others! I am happy With it but have had better
Super beer, intense, deep creamy...many many good points and enjoyable, my favourite among the 3 sorts

Bought in le forum, Arlon
Nice deep brown colo with a crisp carbonation. Fruity notes are the dominant aromas with a slight alcohol and yeasty tang. The taste is characterised by malty yeasty fruity altogether wonderful combination. Rochefort, What else ?

Tulip. Very dark hazy brown with orange around the edge of the glass. Thick marshmallowy head that dissipates reasonably quickly. Smell is fresh hops, yeast, dried spice. Rich fruit, raisin, plums, figs, caramel, cracker/bread, honey, berry, hops. Crisp flavor that keeps developing in your mouth. Good body but overwhelmingly fizzy.

Flasche (33 cl) von Getränkefeinkost Berlin. - Tiefes Kastanienbraun, sehr trüb, reichlich Schaum. - Nase unerwartet fruchtig (Birne, weißer Traubensaft), leicht weinige Note, elegant dunkelmalzig. - Antrunk angenehm leicht, vornehm dunkelmalzig aber nicht besonders süß. Marzipan und Nuß sind nur angedeutet. Mild rezent, fein perlend, samtiges Mundgefühl. Nachtrunk leicht erdig bitter mit einem Hauch von Fleischbrühe. Im Abgang macht sich der Alkohol mit einer leichten Weinbrandnote bemerkbar. - Hier ist alles mild, grazil und elegant, mehr Marzipan als Schokolade und mit einer federleichten fruchtig-spritzigen Note abgerundet. Großartig!
Bottle at Den Engel, Leek. Pours brown with a fast diminishing head. Well carbonated for that Rochefort zing, fragrant plums, a little spice. Very nice but not a spot on Rochefort 10.
Flaska från Bishop Örebro. Nötbrun färg med vitt skum. Lagom balans i sötman. Angenäm smak av skum- banan.

Aroma: Malt: Rich, caramel, biscuit, light tobacco. Peach.
Appearance: Hazy brown body. Medium, light-brown head. Good retention. Lacing.
Flavour: Peach Medium-high malt richness, sweetness. Medium bitterness Dry finish with lingering peach and bitterness.
Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. High carbonation. Light warming.
Overall: Well balanced. Great aroma and flavours.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
18E. Belgian Dark Strong Ale
33cl bottle from local beer store. Hazy brown colour with small beige head. Brown sugar, chocolate and dark fruits. Rich carbonation (maybe a bit too much). A nice trappist beer overall.

Hazy brown pour, small tan head. Aroma not very strong, malts, brown sugar, yeast. Bitter taste, some fruity notes towards the end. Nice, soft and tingly mouthfeel. Rich carbonation but pleasantly small bubbles. Decent trappist on the lighter side of the spectrum.

Single small bottle from Julios. Poured into a snifter. A dark purplish-brown color with a frothy tan head. I let this one warm a while in the glass. Very earthy with soft notes of dry plum and figs. Smooth silky texture. Low bitterness. Light earthy sweetness.

Pours dark brown with white lacy head. Lots of foaming and small bubbles. Aromas of brown sugar, cacao and malt. Taste follows the same pattern of full malty body and chocolate sweetness. Great package, only a bit too sugary for my taste in the long run.

Donkerbruin bier met een flinke beige schuimkraag.
Zoetig in de neus met een vijgentoets.
In de mond zoet en schuimig.
Afdronk heeft fruitige toets.
Superbier!
Bottle from Smatch (Grocery) in Brussels. This is like the one level down of Rocherfort 10. Brown ale

Bottle from Belmont Station. Colour...deep, cloudy amber with a massively thick ecru head. Nose...redolent of brown sugar syrup, medjool date paste and crushed figs. Palate....quite frothy and rather sweet, with notes of dark fruits, turbinado and figgy pudding. Theres an ever present date and prune flavour, and plenty of Christmas cake. The finish is long and cloying.
Chocolaty smell and taste. Rather strong carbonation with a sweet oily chocolate taste. A bit overrated, but a very nice beer.
UPDATED: JUL 23, 2015 330cc Bottle. Brown coloured with white non persistent head. Smels chocolate and fruit. Lots of dry fruits. Sweet but really nicely balanced. Outstanding beer.

From bottle in Xiamen, China. Pours a hazy brown with a beige head. Aroma of bananas and fruits. Taste is sweet, bananas, fruits, some figs. Very light hops. Well-carbonated, full mouthfeel. Gentle sweet finish. Lovely.

Aroma: Cherry, raisins, spices, alcohol. App: brown with white head. Taste and Palate: full body, medium to high sweetness combined with a fruity taste with light dry finish bitterness. Lively carbonation. Appearance is not so good, palate is a tad too sweet. A good beer to finish your evening with.
UPDATED: MAR 28, 2017 Uma cerveja equilibrada com bom corpo e aromas e sabores bem marcantes. Retrogosto persistente.
bottle at home, red copper beer with a small head, aroma is malt, fruit. Taste is malt, fruit, caramel, spices. Nice
UPDATED: FEB 27, 2017 330ml bottle from Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours cloudy dark brown with a dissipating off white head. Caramel toffee aroma with raisins and yeast. Medium sweet finish.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 Dark mahogany with brown reflections body with suspended yeast cells; beige with brown trails foam, very tight and even, totally persistent; extra fine bubbles hardly visible. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste of coffee, chocolate, caramel, dried and candied fruit. Very round without being heavy; Very fine, a lot of character, very well balanced. Better not too cold so that aroma may arouse and be well received.
Heavy on the palate, nice carbonation. Looks great when poured correctly. Very good for my first trappiste beer.

Bottle from Maltitude. Pours brown with white head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, malt. Taste of vanilla, spices, and a slight hint of chocolate. A wonderful Trappist beer. Awesome beer and maybe my new favorite Trappist.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Une valeur sûre, on frôle la perfection encore une fois chez Rochefort. Notes de caramel, dépices, alcool bien présent. Equilibre parfait. Génial.

Pours murky brown with abundant head. Minimal aroma, what there i is of honey and brown sugar. Tastes raisin and honey. Somewhat oily mouthfeelm really, the flavours are barely noticeable: weak and disappointingm
Delle tre sorelle rochefort è quella che si distingue per eleganza e misura. Ambrata, con buona schiuma persistente, aromi fruttati e a tratti speziati, con un buon finale aromatico

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2014 Brown color with nice white head. Chocolaty, yeasty aroma, vanilla maybe, woody? Complex taste of vanilla, spices, chocolate, super heavy finish, but not as boozy as it should be. Winey finish. Overwhelming, but super. A classic Trappist beer. Not as overwhelming as the 10 though ;)

0.33l bottle. Hazy brown color with tanned head. Aroma is fruits, raisins, caramel, yeast, alcohol notes and chocolate. Taste is sweet with some alcohol notes and spices. Full body and average to lively carbonation. Overall its nice and tasty beer with great aroma.
Very strong beer with fine aroma and excellent taste. Maybe a little bit to strong for my taste.

A very fruity brew with a balanced sweetness. Lots of figs, raisins and other aged flavors. Fizzy mouthfeel takes away from the total experience. Some alcohol warming but nothing on the tongue. Good but not the masterpiece it is heralded as.

Topped with a thick white head all the way down the glass. Amazingly light & bubbly with trademark burnt raisin taste. 

Rated by BrewTom
330ml bottle. Pours dark brown with tan head. Aromas of vanilla and caramel. Caramel aftertaste with undertones of chocolate. Spicy finish. Great beer.

Un grand classique, mais quand cest si bon, pourquoi se priver !!Surtout quavec les soucis quont les moines avec leur source, elle nexistera peut etre pas trés longtemps, avec cette qualité jveux dire.. Parceque la, on atteint le haut du panier, le nez et la bouche en prennent plein la gueule, mousse magnifique, carbonation fine et équilibrée. Au nez, cest pearl harbour, lattaque en louzedé, tu vois rien venir et ca te pilonne direct, bonbon, banane, raisin, caramel... Mais le meilleur, cest quen bouche,cest en lien direct avec le nez, ça a le gout de lodeur!!cest une pure merveille de douceur et déquilibre, difficile a dire si sa grande soeur est meilleure, cest pas sur, ce qui est sur, cest que les Rochefort nont rien à envier aux Westvleteren, alors comme elles sont beaucoup trouvables, nhésitez pas, allez allez, plonger le nez et vos papilles vous diront merci !!!

Hazy dark brown, with a light tan and creamy head. The nose has aromas of roasted malts, sweet fruits and Belgian yeas. Body is full, texture thick, carbon high.Taste is sweet, bready and nutty. Palate of ripe plums, raisin and figs. Well balanced.
