33cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours brown with nice white head. Sweet aroma with caramell and fudge flavours. Sweet after taste with caramell notes. Great beer!
bread, herbs, alcohol, brown, cloudy, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Dark brown with tan head. Aroma is plums, cherry, licorice, spicy Belgian yeast, vanilla and caramel. Slick palate. Aftertaste is rich, fruity, dark chocolate, caramel, cherry, some licorice and lasting spicy finish. Overall: Awesome! Like its big brother more.

Transparent dark brownish color, sticky off-white head. Aroma of raisins, prunes, dried figs and alcohol. Taste of dried, and some fresh, fruit and berries, alcohol, yeast, sugar. Not as boozy as its big brother the Rochefort 10, which i actually tend to like even though it is not as intense in its flavor palate.
Piękne ciemna barwa. Piana znika dość szybko. Wydał mi się mniej treściwy i pełny w smaku niż 6-stka ale i tak kawał porządnego piwa.

330 ml bottle purchased at Julios Liquors. Hazy ruby color with lasting head, thick fluffy head that was still in the snifter at the end. Aroma has subtle yeast character, dried fruits and slight alcohol. 
The flavor is real complex mix of dried fruits, Belgian yeast, light red grapes, mild figs. Almost a different nuance after each sip. The alcohol is also here with light warming after the sip. Creamy carbonation in a fuller then medium in body. Cant believe it took me this long to try these! I will be buying a few more to cellar for a cold winter night.

La Trappistes Rochefort 8 es de color oscuro, salvaje y con un paladar pronunciado tirando a afrutado con un final seco.

Elaborada a base de dos maltas, azúcar candeal y dos tipos de lúpulo, que se añaden dos veces durante su elaboración, le confiere un cuerpo, con su segunda fermentación, que da una sensación que no tiene descripción.

11.2 oz sloped brown bottle from Wine and Cheese Place, November 2013 vintage, into a tulip glass. It poured a hazy deep reddish amber colour with deep head of spritzy little bubbles, everlasting with lots of fine Belgian lace. Beautiful. Aromas of fruitcake, raisins, sweet bread, cola, freshly cut flowers, rose hips, black pepper, bubble gum, perfumey noble hops and faint alcohol. Grainy and bready flavours, with layers of caramel, toffee, red berries, plums, green grapes, some root beer/kvass traits, somewhat reminiscent of a toasty and chocolatey Scottish ale. Smooth alcohol, no boozy burn whatsoever, difficult to believe its nearly 10% abv. Light body but complex well-rounded mouthfeel, strong carbonation splashes all the flavours around. Faintly fruity and spicy aftertaste. Absolutely classic Trappist ale, more approachable and "beer-flavoured", less profoundly spicy than some others examples, but just as complex. Delicious.

12 oz. bottle from Cash Wise in Williston. Appearance: 2 fingers tan-kahaki head that does not last, head lasts as a film, amber color, light cloudy, no lacing to note. Aroma: light plum/fig, rich malt, biscuits, light floral hops. Palate: medium body, alcohol warming sensation and thinness, average carbonation, finish is dry and alcohol. Taste: sweet plum/fig, into a maltiness that lasts, but is partially masked by the booziness that takes over and rides it through towards the end. Overall, slightly thin texture for me, and the booze is not overly well hidden, but I know it is not meant to be. For the style, a little light, but very good tastes and aromas. My only complaint is that this beer is not as rich in the malt as I like my Belgian strongs personally. Very good beer besides.

"pours a light-medium murky brown. nice aroma of plum fruit and spice. as with the 6 and 10, it hides its 9.3% abv incredibly well. Heavier and fuller than the 6, which was surprisingly light. Medium bodied and smooth as snot on a glass eye. flavor mimicked the aroma once again. Very nice beer."

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 330ml bottle served in its own chalice. 
A: Pours a dark brown color forming a big and soapy persistent beige head. Lots of lingering and soapy lacings are formed and left in the glass. Lots of particles can be seen floating around while its poured. 
S: A little bit less complex than the 10 but still quite fruity, malty and bready. Strong notes of raisins, plums and figs. Candi sugar and licorice. Strong notes of caramel malts and earthy Belgian yeasts. Sweet brown bread. A slightly boozy end. 
T: Sweet and fruity upfront. Notes of chocolate biscuits, candi sugar, caramel malts, Belgian-style yeasts, brown bread. Light hops bitterness. A bit boozy. Warming.
M: Full creamy and molasses body. Medium carbonation. Belgian-style bittersweet balance. Sweet malts in the aftertaste. 
O: Excellent drinkable. Masterpiece.
[ BA Review @ 11/18/2009 ]

a sweet, spicy taste and aroma, and you have to love the way those tiny bubbles just sit on your tongue. Unfortunately it disappeard way too fast and only left me wanting more (too cost prohibitive), we must pay homage to those trappist for continuing to produce such fine quality beer!
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is fruity, malty, taste is toffee, figs, dark fruit.

Double trappist beer, and thus automatically qualified for the "classic" stamp. Powerful and sweet, beautifully red brown with clear hints of strawberries, soy sauce and hints of beechwood, cinnamon and caramel. A joy for both the nose, the mouth roof and the tongue. Nice to be in Belgium!

A fine beer from the good brothers in Rochefort. Just a little too much caramel makes this a slightly too sweet beer for my taste, and the extremely thin head doesnt do its appearance much good, but overall this is a great beer, with a particularly fine nose. A great beer for late afternoons in fall. Classic label with a pretty jumble of lettering styles, quite Belgian, that.
Pours a reddish brown colour. Head is made of rather large bubbles. Doesnt stick around very long. 9,2% goes unnoticed in the aftertaste. Wouldnt mind drinking copious amounts of this beer.

0,33 l bottle (way too expensive at the Bierbörse in Schwelm). Dark ruby colour, clear liquid. Very creamy, off-white stable and thick head. Intense aroma of cherry, plum, dried fruits, raisins, rock sugar and caramel. Taste is a mixture of sweet and bitter. Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel. Crisp bitter finish (in a pleasant way). After having opened the bottle, I was just impressed how good a beer can smell. Drinking it was even better. Love it, just a gorgeous beer!

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours dirty orange brown with a creamy khaki head. Aroma of toast, bready yeast, leather, cherries and toffee. Flavours are very bready, dark fruits, alcohol warmth and basementy/leathery note. Medium body, lingering bready booziness. Prefer the 10 by a long way.

33cl bottle. Effervescent carbonation through a murky burnt orange forms a thin layer of off-white foam. Flavors are burnt caramel, raisins, figs, hazelnuts, bread, spices and alcohol with herbal notes. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, smooth texture.
Bottle at home, 5th October 14. Dark and rich, full fruity aroma, fruit cake. The taste is smooth and deep, dark booze soaked fruit. Liked this one

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle, dark brown pour, minimal tan head, cloudy, light sweetness, medium body, caramel, bread, toast, great beer.
Mikon luona. Really good beer, maybe not as perfectly balanced as the Rochefort 10, still wonderful.
Poured from a 330ml bottle aroma is sweet alcohol and some blackberry aroma. Flavor has some spicy bready malt flavor more sweet blackberry and dried fruit flavor.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy light brown with a lot of sediment and a huge off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are dried fruit, malt, and yeast - with a dry finish.
Dunkelbraun, schaumig. In der Nase dunkle Früchte, belgische Hefe, brauner Zucker, Alkohol, Karamell. Am Gaumen dunkle Früchte, hefig, süß, alkoholisch. Ausfüllend, gute Kohlensäure.

Una birra dal castano scuro, quasi nera, e quasi impenetrabile con una bella schiuma, spugnosa ed abbastanza persistente. Al naso porta il cioccolato, con della frutta nera, tipo prugne ed uva, tenute sotto spirito. Il sapore è abbastanza complesso, ma non mi fa impazzire. Ritrovo un po di cioccolato, ed un po della stessa frutta. Una buona birra, non direi il contrario. Ma, non una birra che mi faccia impazzire.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl, couleur brune, effervescence et mousse marron moyenne. Bière avec une attaque très fort sur le caramel et le grillé, avec larrière goût caractéristique banane de la Rochefort assez bien levurée... Une tuerie
Strong Belgian and bread aroma. Soft brown color with a good head. Weighted palate with a smooth feel. Strong bready malts like a dubbel with a caramel and yeasty finsh. Truly good.

This was my fav of the Rocheforts. Even at 9+ it was so so drinkable almost slmmable, but dont get enough of it to waste on a chug. Dried fruit slight peach, earthy low hops, dry crisp finish. GREAT!
Poured from bottle. Aroma of fruit. Appearance is a very dark brown with significant tan head. Medium bitter taste with a dry finish. A really great Belgian Strong Ale.
Yeasty scent with chocolate and honey notes. Opaque dark brown colour. Flavour of molasses, figs, and milk chocolate. Medium body with high carbonation. A really tasty beer.

Transfer from BA review on 6-28-13-

 Poured from bottle into a chalice glass

 Appearance- Pours as a very hazy mahogany color with a big and billowy off white head. The head has a moderate level of retention, fading over time to leave a decent level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell- Initially when poured the beer has a more brown bread aroma mixed with a more mild dark fruit aroma of cherry and raisin. Mixed with these smells is a lighter yeasty 
smell. As the brew warms the darker fruits become more potent in aroma at the expense of the more bready smell. The cherry in particular begins to shine more with the yeasty aromas intensifying as well. This mixes with a bit of spice and a lighter boozy aroma to produce a rather classic and delicious Belgian strong dark like smell.

 Taste  The taste begins with a bready flavor mixed with a good dark fruit mix of cherry, raisin and plum. As the flavors advance the cherry grows stronger in flavor with more yeasty and spice flavors of coriander and clove coming to the tongue. Along this time a light boozy flavor starts working its way to the taste buds, remaining at a low constant level throughout the remainder of the taste. In the end a little bit of an almost grassy like bitter flavor comes to the tongue to leave a satisfying mix of warming alcohol and dark fruit flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel The body of the beer is on the averages side in terms of creaminess and thickness with a rather high level of carbonation. The higher carbonation mixed with the medium body create a rather crisper feel even for a brew of 9.2 % nicely complimenting the dark fruit flavors of the beer.

 Overall-A quite tasty brew overall. Not quite to the level of the 10 but extremely tasty none the less.

Honestly one of the best beers Ive tasted. Actually prefer this one over Rochefort 10. Rich aroma and taste that changes with the temperature. Out of the 1000+ beers Ive tasted this is still in my top 3.
Dark brown, large head. Fruity aroma (a bit of cheese). Full body, average carbonation. Taste is bitter.
Im with the guys below that said this was reminiscent of wood and/or fruitcake. Both are accurate and in no way demeaning to this brew.
Complex. Well balanced. Taste is slightly sweet. Wood, grapes. Evolvent alcohol. Dry finish.

Deep & dark ruby / reddish brown color with beige, tall and unsustainable head. Aroma of dried fruits, burnt sugar and some malty and woody notes. Taste of toasted bread, spices and candied fruits. Alcoholic aftertaste. Earthy and herbal notes. Really nice.

Cloudy dark mahogany with off-white, big head. Buttery, nutty aromas with lots of dried fruits, sultana raisins and panna cotta. Medium+ bodied palate with emphasis on sweetness. Malty backbone. Medium+, sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 33cl. Brown colour with small creme head. Deep sweet aromas which remind me of sugar and caramel. Taste has sweetness too, but its also a little dry. A lovely bitterness is in the aftertaste.

Con un extraño aroma a madera y humo se presenta esta cerveza de color rojizo muy oscuro, y una maravillosa y casi perfecta espuma cremosa que persiste lo suficiente, dejando a la cerveza con un aspecto bellamente turbio y oscuro.
La primera impresión en boca es nuevamente humo y mucho cuerpo, con sabores a especias picantes, caramelo y un dulzor agradable. El alcohol deja su presencia discretamente para mezclarse en equilibrio con la madurez del sabor. Un final casi imposible de olvidar que se mantiene largo tiempo y deja una sensación de cerveza con mucho carácter.

Bottle. Pours a deep, dark amber with a light beige head, a bit of retention. Definitely closer to the Rochefort 10 than to the 6. Lots of dried and candied fruit notes in the aroma, like a holiday fruitcake. Flavour is less sweet than the aroma, with a touch of bitterness and citrus added to the mix. Fairly full mouthfeel with a dry finish. A beautiful Belgian.

Fresh batch bb07/2019, Colruyt 6-pack + aged versions 2012-2013. Refined, but not overly complex dry suada of candied raisins, dried berry sweetness and earthier dates briefly punctuated by metallic aniseed and fruit pit. Taste when fresh is manageably dry-sweet as well, between older tawny port and on occasion more like roasted bread-dunked hot milk chocolate. More earthy, herbal and nutty flavours (roasted chestnut) take center stage with a few months of age, the yeast breaking through the thick layers of potentially manifold desserts, laying bare a unique and supremely drinkable beer at the top of a recipe for a sipper and Flemish carbonade classic.

11.2 oz bottle. Pours a dirty brown. Head is white and dissipating. Aroma is overripe fruit, cola, toasted grain and molasses. A woody and fruity profile. Really interesting, great depth. Finishes on the roof of the mouth with fig and raisin.
Belle apparence, belle mousse, le gout dépice arrive en tête puis vient la profondeur de lamertume, un palais moins poussé que sur ses grandes soeurs néanmoins...
Pours a deep brown body with a thick and lasting beige head. Faint aroma of malt and some hops. Very well balanced malty taste of toffee and sugar candies.
0,33 pullo@ St.Urho. kauniin syvän tumma suklaanruskea, varsin samea. Tuoksussa hedelmää, makeaa jälkiruokaviiniä. Ehkä hiukan karamellia? Maussa pehmeää mallasta, alkoholia, hieman viinimäisyyttä.

Pours a nice dark brown colors with a thin head that seems to linger. Aroma is of booze, dark fruits, it is very fruity, sweetness, bready, the aroma for me on this one is not as defined as the 6. Tastes of molasses, dark stone fruit, fig, thick cereal malts, caramel. Its a little hot although it is very well rounded. My ability to pick out the notes were a bit better on the 6 but this one is just as good if not better. It is a very layered beer that changes as you drink it.

Pours cloudy caramel or dark reddish brown with a massive white head. Aromas are mostly yeasty esters, but theres also a bit of dark fruit, caramel,  and spice. Upfront flavors are candied fruit and caramel--which arrive soft on the tongue--then cocoa, roasty toasty bready notes, and dark fruits that finish with a lively, peppery mouthfeel. Unbelievably complex. Overall, this is a beautiful brew.
Licht brown with a thick head. Aroma of rasins and caramel. Tastes like chocolate, rasins, pears, caramel and sugar. To sweet for me, but works great with some meat or cheese!

33cl via Jumbo Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 9,2%
Uitgeschonken in La Trappe glas

Uiterlijk: Hazelnoot kleurig met mooie witte schuimkraag die gedurende het drinken constant blijft zitten

Aroma en smaak: caramel, donker fruit, rozijnen, zoet, klein bittertje

Conclusie: wereldberoemd bier, deze trappist. Is ook een klasse bier.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy dark brown colour, large head. Aroma is very complex and pleasant: malt, dark chocolate and light fruit. Lively carbonation. Taste is sweet, with notes of caramel, coffee and some spicy. Extremely well balanced. Long and delicious finish. A classic one.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2015 330ml bottle received as present. Pours a dark brown colour with small tan head that diminish. Aroma of strong plum, banana, and black currant. Taste of brown sugar, alcohol, more banana and stewed fruits.

Pours a cloudy hazy dark brown with a full head, good retention, aroma was fruitier than Rochefort 10 and taste was sweeter than 10, malty nutty toffee, had a lively carbonation defiantly full bodied, excellent drinking, smooth with a nice mild bitter aftertaste, warms the heart.

33cl bottle, poured into a trappist chalice. Dark red brown, almost chocolate in colour when poured. Good off-white head, dissipates quickly. Slightly sweet, fruity plum and dark chocolate taste. Light carbonation. Good light/medium aroma. Short aftertaste on the palate. Easier to drink than I expected for 9.2% ABV.

Botella de 33 cl en la antigua internacional con fecha de cons pref para 15-07-2003. cuerpo medio a intenso con 9.2 vol que se notan en todo momento, un poco mas áspera que la rochefort 10 con sabores maltosos tostados, ligeramente especiados y con una buena sensación alcohólica. Así con todo bastante buena y para repetir.

Redish - dark brown. Very interesting taste with quite a malty taste. White long lasting with some traces of yeast in the head. Medium sweet and quite some body. Lightly bitter. One of the best Trappists arround.

Nel bicchiere arriva di uno splendido color marrone rossastro, con riflessi ambrati, leggermente velato; assolutamente perfetta la schiuma, di colore beige chiaro, molto fine e compatta, cremosa, con buona persistenza. Al naso ci sono sentori di uvetta, banana matura, prugna, frutta secca e leggere note liquorose che ricordano uno sherry. In bocca sorprende per il modo impressionante in cui lalcool è nascosto; corpo medio-pieno e buone bollicine. Oleosa e molto morbida, con note di uvetta, prugna e datteri, caramello, zucchero candito, frutta secca (mandorle, noci). La dolcezza del gusto ė bilanciata da una bella secchezza finale che riesce quasi a ripulire il palato, creando quellistante di attesa necessario per poter ancor meglio assaporare il retrogusto, abboccato, caldo e morbido (ricco di frutta sotto spirito) dove finalmente lalcool fa sentire la sua discreta presenza.
Bottle, a bit ligther than the Rochefort 10, light brown color, still strong though...

Pours a deep amber color with an off white head. Fruit, caramel, yeast, molasses and malt aroma. Plum, sugar, fig, molasses, toast, yeast, apple, banana, spice, caramel and malt flavors. Medium full body with high carbonation. Sweet taste and a fruit and spice finish.

Pours a cloudy light brown brew with a big white head with good retention, aroma is moderate sweet, low bitter and low acidic with plum, fig, caramel, chocolate, banana and spices, medium bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, low bitter and low acidic with a dry and sweet finish and a long aftertaste.

Been excited to try this one for a while. Beautiful nose, I mean I can only smell through one nostril and this beer is very nice. Definitely fig, baking spices, lil bit o banana, some nuttiness. Dried fruit some alcohol. Appearance is cloudy, amber, copper. Taste is rich but more active carbonation than expected. Mouthfeel is good but not as viscous as the 10, perhaps when it warms up. Very tasty overall.

Unfiltered brown-reddish color. Tastes sweet &malty. With a dry bitterness and a little bit alcohol. Full body with a carbonation below average.
Couldnt discover any frutiness.
Dry, with a touch of spiciness. Very nice........................................
Espuma presente e consistente. Aroma frutado com algo apimentado/madeirado. Gosto frutado porém com excelente equilíbrio com álcool. Muito boa!

Really really tasty. Has a very nice and aromatic malty smell. Complimented by a really smooth flavor explosion on the tongue. Overall this is a great beer that I dont really know how to explain accurately. Definitely worth a pick up from your local liquor store.

11.2 oz bottle. Very nice malty aroma. White head lingers for a while, nice Brownish copper color. Malty flavor, with a little raisin. Appropriate body. Very effervescent and bubbly in the mouth. Overall, an awesome beer!

11.2 oz bottle. Poured an unfiltered amber-brown color with a frothy khaki top that dissipated after a couple of minutes. Taste of Belgian yeast, dough, sweet malts, nutty, and caramel. Medium carbonation, medium body.

Couleur noisette foncée, fine pelicule de mousse beige. Nez complexe de gateau, fruits confits, banane, épices, alcool (tout ça lui donne une odeur de plum pudding pour ceux qui connaissent ...). La première bouche est sur les fruits secs et la banane. Ensuite apparaissent les épices et lalcool qui réchauffe un bon coup. Le finale est légèrement amère. Corps puissant, alcool puissant et longueur en bouche exceptionnelle. Superbe !
Bottle. Pours a reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma and taste of raisins, figs, nuts, chocolate, and spices. A great beer.

Una de les cerveses mes equilibrades que he tastat. És una de les millors trapist que he pogut tastar. Escuma amb molt de cos, de color marro clar. La escuma no marxa fins que no sacaba la cervesa. En definitiva una cervesa per tenir en compte. Visca els monjos de la rochefort.
Light beige, foamy head. Cloudy brown. Strong carbonation. Licorice, cellar, sweetness. Light bitterness. average alcohol warmth.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a clear, dark amber colour with a reddish brown pour with large tan head. Aroma of caramel malt, toffee and dark fruits. Taste is vinous, sherry, dark fruits, more caramel and toffee, finishes with strong alcohol presence.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Opaque brownish with a thick beige head. Aroma is complex : Caramel, plums, figs, bread, some roasted notes, belgian yeast spice. Nice battle between the sweetness and bitterness, relaying each other. Medium body with an creamy texture. Carbonation is pretty lively. Finish is a little bit bitter/spiced.
Beautiful brown red colour. Nose does not give away too much, but taste is sweet with hints of dark Belgium chocolate. Finish a little bit more spicy. Good balanced beer.
Very good beer, first as heavy as it is it is very crisp. Slight dark fruit flavor with a large caramel presence.

Aroma: caramel, nuts, grass, earthy, butterscotch.
alcohol, vanilla.
Color: brown, cloudy, brown foam, frothy.
medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, oily feel, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,

11.2 oz. bottle served in a shaker- poured a semi transparent very darkened amber with shades of black and darkened brown when held to a light source, creamy head formed and lasted while I put laundry up, had a smoke, and grabbed something to eat- quite awhile! Aroma of molasses, plum, sun beaten dark grapes, and yeast. Hits the mouth with a wide body, malt is light but is immediately brushed aside by the same aromas described transcribing into the mouth, middle holds up well with the fruit continuing, finish is slightly sweet and some pepper. This could be very dangerous for me- F IT, my middle name is Danger...
33 cl på torget i Bryssel. Kul att dricka denna på plats på riktigt. Lite för mycket alkoholsmak för att ge toppbetyg.

12 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a dark mahogany color, with a massive beige head that persists, leaving excellent lacing. Nose is dark fruit, caramel, and brown sugar. Taste is dark fruit, figs, plums, etc. and a hint of caramel. Finish is long, with a creamy mouth feel and increasing complexity, finally yielding to a pleasant spice note. One of the greatest beers in the world.

Mahogany pour with a large, thick tan head which lasted throughout. Bigger medium body. Hidden abv, but a very pleasant warmth. Yeasty. Modest spice. Caramel. Dried fruit. Dark fruit. Dry chocolate. Complex. Elegant. Superb. Something that can be enjoyed again and again.

Beautiful sweet, strong, fruity beer. Definitely fig, some biscuit or cookie (simply reminds me of a fig newton) dark fruit sweetness, but with just a little bit of lighter fruit mixed in in the aroma. Malt, slight bitterness, just enough to give it a bite and not so fruity.

Bottle thanks to mcbackus...vintage 2006. Mostly clear, dark amber, reddish brown pour with large tan head. Sweet caramel malt aroma, toffee, dark fruits, complex malty goodness. Flavor is vinous, sherry like, some oxidation due to age, dark fruits, more caramel and toffee, finishes with strong alcohol presence.

Bottle @ Bryggeriet, Ystad. Fruity with yeasty and spicy notes, quite sweet with some alcoholic notes, licorice and plums, really complex, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and bitter with sweet and fruity notes.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2015 The green cap, middle Rochefort, and to many the most balanced of the three. Stable, mousse-like, nicely lacing head, colour a deep bronze, misty; powerful, fruity and earthy aroma of caramel, banana, coriander, cinnamon, liquorice, pear, cookie dough, brown rum, figues, chocolate, bramble berries; taste kicks off with a dry fruitiness (dried plums, candied figues), relatively sharp carbonisation with a mineral-like effect, dry spicy hints (coriander) on a deep and beefy, caramel- and lightly chocolate-like maltiness, tingling yeasty spiciness, fairly thick mouthfeel, aftertaste a dry grasy hoppy bitteriness with a warming effect of alcohol (rum, liqueur) but not acerb in any way, some yeastiness and sweetness also lingers, but no cloying so very well-balanced.  Also tasted a few times as "Rochefort 8 Cuvée", the Christmas version in magnum bottles, but found no noticeable difference - although a couple of years of aging will probably lead to a different beer in such a big volume than in the normal 33 cl bottling.

Bottle: Clear, light caramel brown, thick head and good lace. Dried fruit, fig or dates, malt, caramel, ripe not roasted. Dry, not sour but almost acid and low bitterness. Almost phenolic. Super attenuated. Loads of weight and length. Chocolate. Almost like red wine pressings.
Really nice tasting beer. Not quite as strong as the 10 but really refined.

I love this sophisticated Belgian. 
Lightly fruited aroma, sweet initial taste, and then goes fruity before a dry finish with a touch of alcohol
Smoother and less yeasty than many Belgians, it goes down alarmingly easy for a 9.2% beer

11.2 oz bottle - pours a dark amber, lots of dark fruit aromas . Taste is sweet but not over done . Very good . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy dark brown pour with white head. Aroma is very fresh and complex. Taste is very balanced with malty notes, a hint of yeast and underlying warmth from the alcohol. It is still fresh though. Impressive

Poured into a chilled mug.

A: Pours cloudy brown with a monstrous head that took forever to dissipate. Lacing is thick and clings to the side of the mug.

S: Smells... Earthy, musty... Everything else is quite muted. I get hints on banana.

T: WOW. the nose was misleading. This a sweet, complex brew - fruity, earthy, bready, sugary sweet, with blueberries and the right amount of booziness and funk at the back end. One of my new favorites, definitely.

M: Buttery, fizzy, light, moderate carbonation. 

O: Despite the somewhat lackluster smell, this one came through in the taste department. Incredible flavor that begs you to have more!

Cloudy brown color, big off white head that quickly disappeared. Full body, soft carbonation. Aroma of malt, yeast, spices, herbal hops, citrus, lots of fruits, caramel. Medium sweet, light bitter taste. Alcohol is very well hidden. Finish is sweet at first, and than bitter. Robust and complex. Well, this is just wonderful stuff.

Hazy brown with cappuccino head. Malts, caramel light toffee, mature fruit with a hint of alcohol, hazelnuts. Lightly sweet with light Roasted malts, hint i flicorni cè and coffee, dark chocolate,e ai si s and a quickly fading bitter ending.
True trappist, deep, figgy muddy flavors. Kind of fizzy this one. Finish is dry and nice. Bottle from De Zwart in Wilnis
UPDATED: JUL 19, 2014 Bottle 33cl. Francis. Spicy and fruity aroma with red berries. Brown color, light brown creamy head. Very nice belgian strong ale.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2014 Birra spettacolare, dal sapore intenso e deciso, anche se non ai livelli della 10. Laspetto è meraviglioso: il colore è rosso amaranto, torbido se si versa i lieviti presenti nel fondo della bottiglia. La schiuma è spessa e abbastanza persistente. Una volta tolta dal frigo bisogna aspettare prima di berla, altrimenti si sentirà troppo poco laroma e la carbonizzazione sarà eccessiva. Dopo un po, invece, rivelerà tutte le sue meraviglie. Al naso si percepisce il liquoroso di un buon marsala dolce. In bocca non tradisce le aspettative: caramello, prugna, ma soprattutto sentori vinosi, da marsala appunto, che si sposa bene con un buon maltato. Decisamente una birra di gran classe!

330 ml bottle. Pours hazy amber with tall, long-lasting, foamy off-white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of bready malt, caramel, barnyard yeast and fruity esters. Body is full and crisp. Spicy yeast, caramel malt, plums, raisins, brown sugar fill the mouth. Finish is long and spicy. Great brew.

Színe egészen mély, sötétbarna, szinte már fekete, habja pedig sűrű, krémes és az egyik legtartósabb, amivel valaha találkoztam. Masszív testesség és krémes állag, fűszeres, korianderes, karakteres és gömbölyded ízjegyek jellemzik. Nem hétköznapi darab.

Bottle at home that has been standing for a year. Pour absolute dark with a dirty head. Smells of spices, roasted malt and yeast. Full body, a little bit of alcohol taste. Tastes of dried fruit and roasted malt. Not my favorite but well balanced.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2016 Sprankelend krachtig bier qua mondgevoel. Complexe smaak van choco, kruidig, caramel dat wat zachter aandoet dan de 10. Lichte bitter aanwezig in de lichte soepele warme droge afdronk. Pracht bier met een geweldig lang palet in de nasmaak. Een prachtig stukje perfectie vanaf de eerste aanraking met je zintuigen.

very rich aroma: port, apples, toffee, plum, citrus, brandy and spices... the taste of caramel, brandy, chocolate with notes of citrus and port... aftertaste is sweet and dry and, a little bit, warming... wonderful trappist...

Bottle. Ruby red with a cream head that sticks heavily to the glass. Aromas of cherry, rum, candy sugar, Christmas cake and caramel. Heavy malt throughout, intertwined with cherry, bubblegum, candy sugar, cola, rum, biscuit and toffee. Beautifully smooth mouthfeel with perfect carbonation. Magnificent beer.

Pours a medium caramel with somewhat of a rosy hue. Great clarity and a large offwhite head with good retention. Aroma is Belgian yeast, cake and alcohol. Taste is sweet, dark fruit, banana and alcohol. More warming alcohol with yeast and malt. Carbonation works for this style, but could be a little higher. Overall, a very good Belgian ale.

This is another excellent beer tasted at a beer festival last weekend. Although I only had an ounce, or so, it made a big impression on me and my friends. Belgian Ales are not always my beer choice, but where this one is available, I will try a full bottle.

The taste is excellent. It is sweat and yeasty, has a compact flavor. Dark fruity character, with prunes and raisins and licorice. Also there are (the usual suspects) caramel ande brown suger - I almost forgot ;). Carbonation is just right for this beer - not to much, but prominent. Hides the alcohol very well, without an excessive sugarly taste. You drink this beer easy, and because of the compact flavor you might think this it is not very complex. But it is in the way the flavors are bound together that makes this beer so good. As if all the complexity comes together in a point of beer singularity (this is the beer talking) controlled by a yet to be discovered force of the universe. So...
Efímera en el paladar, pobre cuerpo de maltas sabor fresco pero carece de carácter, falta la presciencia de levaduras belgas

Deep golden, mahogany color, big and frothy off-white head. Dried fruit nose, roasted malt, candi sugar, Belgian yeast, hints of nuts and cherry. Sweet taste, fruity, yeasty, hint of alcohol, long lasting. Full to medium body, warming alcohol, soft carbonation.

2 finger head fades typical brown purple dark belgium ale look. smells of grape, plum and cake(iceing & batter) taste is grape, plum, wine like. Later some beer like taste in the troat with a yeasty taste and some warmth. Like alot of the other Belgium beers but a little different. Cheers!!!!!! :)

Bottle 33cl. A dark brown beer with a small white head. At first aroma was of bananas, but then it fade away and it was replace by an alcohol aroma. There are some sediments at the bottom. It has a strong alcohol taste and also is heavy in carbonation.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a deep ruby colour with plenty of sediment and a modest offwhite head. Aroma is of heavy alcohol and dry fruits. Heavy, rich and complex. Plenty of carbonation. Strong, lasting bitter and alcohol finish.

Dark brown color, which produces a layer of good and persistent creamy beige foam. The aroma is sweet and fruity with an alcohol touch. Those same notes also appear on the taste, dried fruit, malt with a nice creamy texture.
Deep dark and rich flavors, lots of depth in the finish. Dyer than I had expected, which added huge complexity.

Bottle alongside 6 and 10. Pours a cloudy brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have big caramel malt, Belgian yeast, dark fruits with fig, dates, raisins and cherry, chocolate, herbal notes, great drinking bigger brother to the 6.
Bottle to a snifter. Tawny brown with quickly dissipating tan head. Aroma of fresh bread with honey and apple butter. Tastes of dried fruit, spices, caramel and roasted nuts... Delicious!

Robe brune assez foncée et trouble. Un nez de céréales, pain et caramel. Des goûts de miel, de fruits (raisin et banane principalement). Juste ce quil faut damertume Des houblons typiques des bières belges mais un ensemble très bien équilibré qui donne un rendu excellent comme dhabitude pour les trappistes de Rochefort...

Aroma of caramel, bread and coffee. It appears dark brown with a short lasting white head. The taste is only medium sweet with hints of caramel and fruits. The finish is long and bitter with a remarkable bready aftertaste. A full, nice mouthfeel, but the carbonation was a bit too lively to keep in your mouth for too long. An excellent beer.

Appearance- murky, dark brown, half a finger beige head which persists throughout. Aroma- sugary fruits, molasses, raisin and banana, dark malts, hint of chocolate, sweet bread. Smells great. Taste- sweet and sugary, lots of fruit- raisin and banana mostly, with cherry, prune and sultana, and a bit of grape juice. A definite maltiness, with hints of cocoa and milk chocolate. The alcohol is barely detectable. Pretty full mouthfeel, and the flavours linger at the end- it finishes with some port and vinous notes. Really good.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2014 Pours medium/large quite frothy head which dissolves to a 1 cm layer, the colour its a beautiful opaque dark leathery brown. Aroma its something very complex: cake, sweet, huge malts toffee, dark fruits, butterscotch, caramel and a bit of alcohol... You can pretty much smell anything in there, spice and chocolate included. And if you think about cognac, it just smells almost that way, barriqued: incredibly complex. In the mouth its pretty much on that way: tastes caramel, honey, cake, toffee, pure belgian ale malt falvours. Then starting from the sweet it finishes with an incredible sour/bitter full rounded but very delicate palate, very long lasting. It just tastes and smells awesome ,in an elegant and royal way. Dark, sweet, strong, full body, creamy, but in the end very well balanced. Very satisfying, awesome beer
Brown, loads of fruits, chocolate and toffee. Full body. Soft. Fruits, chocolate, toffee, alchool
