Small head hazy brown. Dark fruity raisins fig. Dry with a malty caramel sweetness. A little sharp feeling with a medium mouthfeel. Alcoholic.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy copper with a two finger off-white head. Crazy as it sounds, the opening notes on the nose really make me think Campari meets red licorice, and I mean that as a compliment. There are also some light dark bread aromas, mineral notes, and light molasses. Smells great, and really, unlike any other beer Ive tried. The taste has light maple syrup. light brown sugar, raisin, again a little red licorice, and definite booze that leads into nuttiness, dried fruit, bready notes, with caramel, cocoa, and light molasses candy notes in the finish. Very enjoyable stuff.

Molt bona cervesa, al nivell de la 10, però més del dia a dia.
Muy buena cerveza, al nivel de la 10, pero mas del día a día.

Spicebread nose, a bit vineous, touch heavy on alcohol. Flavor follows, kinda in between a dubbel and a quad, fruity and spicy and a bit nutty, very good beer for being something Im not a huge fan of.

Pours much lighter than 10 and with much more foam that needs no agitation to form... reddish clear tan with creamy head that holds well - familiar vinous notes on the nose; creamy and effervescent on the tongue with a carbonated almost tasteless upfront finish that hits the familiar vinous notes that 10 hits at the end.

No, itt is elég közel járunk a tökéletességhez. Már megjelenése és illata is tiszteletet parancsoló. Karamellásan aszalt gyümölcsös, mely az ízében, folyamatosan levegőztetve bomlik ki igazán. Gondolhatunk fügére, datolyára, naspolyárása, dióra, szilvára, erdei gyümülcsökre közben, csak arra nem, hogy ez egy jellegtelen gyenge sör lenne. Valami fenségesen pompás ! Nem lehet betelni vele !

Pours into the glass a dark brown, with a light tan and creamy head. Tan sediment is present in my glass. The nose has aromas of roasted malts, sweet fruits and Belgian yeast fill your nose. Its malty flavor is sweet, bready and nutty. Fruity notes are of plum, golden raisin and fig. The alcohol is well hidden, but still noticeable. Well balanced with a medium body, nice carbonation and a smooth mouth feel. Exceptional Trappist ale.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2014 Bottle, 330ml. Pours a deep cloudy amber with two fingers of soapy light tan head, which dissipates quickly leaving behind only a thin sheen. Significant lacing. Aroma consists almost entirely of bread and honey, and quite potently so. No detecatable hops, but I dont think thats an issue here. Taste also mostly of honey and bread, with again no detectable hops and minimum bitterness, and perhaps hints of a typical sort of cake taste. One of the sweetest beers Ive ever tried, but somehow not in a bad way at all; almost reminiscent of a good mead. Decently smooth mouth feel and very satisfying level of warmth from the alcohol in the back of the throat. Very enjoyable overall.

Bottle. Pours clear red amber with a quickly diminishing frothy white big head. Aroma is raisin, red apple, banana, caramel, clove, dark fruit, spice, bubblegum and candy. Taste is light+ sweet, bitter and very light acidic. Body is is light, texture is slick/thin, carbonation is lively. Finishes balanced, acidic and bitter with fig, clove and a tingling sensation.

Aroma suave que me lembrou nozes e banana. Formou uma boa quantidade de creme, não duradouro. Sabor levemente adocicado, álcool evidente, porém suave no conjunto. Ótima, como se espera de uma trapista.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
U. Grote schuimbellen, niet mooi bruin. G. Kaneel? Nootmuskaat? Rozijnen? Noten? Gerookt? S. Zwaar zoetje. M. Teveel koolzuur. T. Zwaar, Ok.
Flaska från SB. Mörkt kopparfärgad vätska med högt och kraftigt skum. Doft av russin, druvor och fruktkaka. Eldig munkänsla där russin återkommer i smaken.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2014 Couleur sombre, petite mousse beige. Super nez fruité, questche, baies, note de caramel, chocolat doux, malt, fruits secs. Gout bien balancé et doux de fruits(questsche, fruits secs, abricots, etc..), note malté, chocolat doux, note de reglisse. Plus mature que la 6, mais moins complexe et puissante que la 10. Super
Pours dark amber with good tan head. Strong sweet aroma with plum featuring. Medium full mouthfeel with good carbonation. Alcohol comes through but not hot. Sweet upfront balanced off by the hops.
Tåkete brun med tykt lavt beige skum. Malt, karamell og lukt av brunt sukker. Søt alkohol og karamell, bitter og litt salt smak. Oljete, lite kullsyre
Dark brown red color. Thick head. Aroma and taste of yeast. Not that big taste and not so sweet. A little fruity. Dry. Medium to full body.

Bottle from de Bierschuur in Poppel. The beer ruby red color and a nice and large cream colored head, CO2 level is perfect. The aroma is complex of herbs, fruity and even a little bitter. Raisins are giving the sweetness to the aroma. The taste is sweet with hints of herbs. The alcohol and the tones of fruits are well balanced. Light sweet and a little dry. The finish is bitter, complex and long. Wow, what a good beer. Im curious how 10 will taste.

Bottle. Pours a murky reddish brown with a thick off-white head. Fruity, sweet aroma. Tastes of fruits, some caramel, amazingly balanced between sweetness and softness. This is a great beer, one of the very best Belgians.
Pours a hazy brown. Aroma and taste are dark fruits, malts and a slightly bitter finish.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en La Birra. Color marron. Sabor a malta, muy ligeramente a chocolate.
Bottle, 330 ml. Pours brown with nice long lasting beige head. Malty aroma with some fruits and yeast. Malty chocolate flavor with some fruits and caramel.

Toffee, roast, malt, and sweet caramel scent. Opaque reddish/brown hue with a medium sized head. Malt, butterscotch, alcohol, with mild lingering sweet bitterness. Probably my favourite of the Rocheforts.
cereal, caramel, amber, brown, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel, oily feel, average carbonation,

Dégustée au Pub Italia à Ottawa en septembre 2008. Bière brune foncée opaque. Col beige très épais, crémeux et très persistant. Odeur dalcool et de levure. Douce, assez sucrée, assez amère en finale. Goût de café, de chocolat noir bien présent, de malt torréfié. Robuste, a beaucoup de corps, bien consistante.
330 ml bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a high brownish head. Rich roasty aroma with chocolate notes. Wonderful taste. Mild palate.
Huge light-brown head. Caramel-brown colour. Vanilla aroma. Bitter roast taste. Lasting bitter palate. Somehow Ive expected more given its astonishingly high average rating.

Lovely brown colour, more lively than expected with a good foam top. Smells of fruit, Granny Smith even. Taste is not as pronounced as hoped, but the finish is superb. Cognac, apples, red fruits, citrus. Very complex.
Het 'kleine broertje' van de 10. Fruitig aroma, zoete smaak met licht bittere afdronk. Elegante schuimkraag. De Rochefort is en blijft een absolute topper!

Beautiful color but no grain taste. No coocked grain taste ! This beer is made with too much Brown sugar. The taste is the same, this is caramel. Very llow bitterness. The foam is decreasing very fast. The general taste is good but i expect more than Brown sugar taste when i buy a beer.
Donkerbruine kleur, weinig schuim. Fruitig aroma. Smaakt fantastisch, fruitig, zoet met een kleine bittere nasmaak. Goddelijk.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2016 5/31/2016 0,33l bottle from Damian Bottle Shop, Bratislava, BBD: 04/02/2020. Pours cloudy amber liquid, huge frothy tan head, fell down after a while, Aroma: candied fruits, raisins, gingerbread, caramel, malty, clove, Belgian phenols, light banana, Taste: 4/19/2014 10/4/8/4/17 From 0,33l bottle. BBD: 03.08.16. Pours hazy amber brown liquid with dark apricot reflex, medium tan head. Aroma: beautiful deep rich aroma, cognac, red fruits, plum, resin, citrus, summer biscuit fruit cakes, caramel, well hidden alcohol. Taste: medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light to medium sour, biscuit cakes, citrus, fruits, Palate: medium body, oily texture, average to soft carbonation, long bitter sweet and warm (bit alcoholic) aftertaste. Quiet good drinkability because of medium body with watery/oily mouthfeel and good carbonation. Overall: Excellent aroma, taste bit less excellent, than expected (perhaps due to not best storing conditions), would recommend with summer fruits cakes or winter gingerbread.
Lovely beer with a buttered toffee aroma and smooth sweet nutty flavor. Has a dark amber rich color.

High carb. V little aroma. Burnt fruit. Okay but nothing special. Not sure if I get this Belgian beer thing yet...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Maravilhosa cerveja Belga. Em sabor e aroma, só perde da Rochefort 10. Complexa. Malte predominando. Excelente !!

330ml Bottle. This pours a dark brown topped by a light tan head that is thick and creamy (for a bottle). Its aroma is fainter than I had hoped reading the other reviews. However there is traces of sweetness, dark fruits and malts. The taste echos the aroma with dark fruits coming to the fore with dark chocolate and a sweet bitter finish. Thankfully this beer is not as sweet as i thought it would be and is full of complex flavours. A good un.
Bottle @ Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Hazy brown colour with some red coming through, beige head. Smell and taste malts, caramel, some sweet-bitter, some fruits. Medium body.

De color marrón rojizo. Gran cantidad de espuma achampanada de burbuja fina que desaparece rápido dejando el encaje en la copa. Curiosamente más restos de levadura de los esperados (no se si porque la tengo hace años en la bodega)
Aromas a fruta madura, azúcar moreno y algo de licor.
Cuerpo medio y bastante gasificada.
En boca entra sedosa , y de aparecen nuevo la fruta madura y ciruelas pasas, algo de especias. Alcohol bien integrado. Un poquito más de cuerpo no le haría mal.

Bottle. Pours murky brown with a tan head. Aroma: dark fruit, molasses. Taste: blueberries, cherries, raisins, plums, ripe dark and red fruit all over, spices, bit of honey. Full bodied, silky, sweet (but not overly sweet), well balanced with a long finish.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig süß, fruchtig, würzig. Geschmack röstmalzig, hefig, fruchtig, dunkle reife Früchte, Karamell.
Niet zo goed als de rochefort 10 maar komt wel heel aardig in de buurt. Echt een aanrader voor wie van donkere bieren houdt
Brilliant fruity aroma, mostly cherry. Large head disappearing to durable layer. Ruby body. Sweet taste with intensive hoppy-alcoholic bitterness, high carbonation. Rich and very delicious.

Superlekkere trappist. Iets minder uitgesproken van aroma en smaak dan zijn grote broer, de Rochefort 10. Aroma van chocolade, donker fruit, bruine suiker, caramel. Lekkere, volle smaak met licht moutige toets en fluwelen afdronk. Bier van wereldklasse.
Shared 33 cl bottle. Pours amber with a small head that quickly fades away. Aroma is yeasty with some sweet honey. Taste is figs, raisins, some yeast and honey.

Small glass. thanks to k0mpsa, Deep dark brown. Beautiful creamy head. Mouth full of nuts with loads of malts and dried fruits in the delicious and very complex aroma. Palate is everything I hope for beer - full, rich, lively and long, Greatness bottled.

330 ml bottle. Brown with a nice foam. Complex nose of toffee, chocolate, spices, dark fruits, dried fruits. Big body, soft mouthfeel. Complex taste of chocolate, caramel, dried and dark fruits, coriander, alchool.
Wonderful fruity aroma, added to the very well known Belgian abbey style. One of the best Trappist beers tasted to-date.

Poured into a tulip glass. Aromas of fruity yeast and sweet malts. Dark brown with a light, fluffy head. Hard to put the taste into words, but Ill try. Its amazing. Maybe some fruitcake and spices on the front, but it ends with an ethereal brown sugar sweetness. It finishes with the perfect alcohol burn. Really spectacular beer.

Dark hazelnut brown with a bubbly off-white head. Wonderful aromas of candied orange, spice and butterscotch. Finely carbonated, all in all rather crisp. The taste begins overwhelmingly orangey-sweet-sour and moves on to a more malty chocolate finish. Just a slight tinge of alcohol in the aftertaste. A work of art.

50th Belgian beer review. 330ml bottle, poured into Kasteel chalice. A: Very dark amber, hazy, small tanned head which disappeared very quickly, didnt leave much lacing. S: Grape, yeast and unlike the 10 it was boozy. T: Biscuit, grape, plumb, molasses, had a slight burn from the booze.M: Medium body, the booze gave it a coarse edge, went down fairly well for the high ABV. O: Compared to the 10, this is the less sophisticated younger brother. A a very good beer, rather than a world class offering, actually reminded me of St Bernardus abt 12.
Bottle. Very dark amber body with nice tan head. Aroma is malts yeast some dried fruits. Taste is malts herbs some bretts. Aftertaste is perfect malts bretts some hops. Great.

330ml bottle into a chalice. Pours a curious opaque reddish brown with sparse head and a bit of sediment in the bottom of the glass. Rich fruity aroma with a some spicy notes. Sweet, warming fig and date flavour. Long and slightly bitter, dry finish.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Bière brune aux reflets rouge-orangés, totalement opaque avec particules bien visibles, très effervescente, et surmontée dun bon col brunâtre, bien large, très dense, très mousseux, et qui semble éternel. Arômes principalement de fruits foncés bien mûrs voire confits (raisin, cerise, datte, prune/pruneau...) avec beaucoup deffluves sucrés (pâtisserie, caramel, cassonade, cola, érable), dabondantes épices (anis, clou de girofle, poivre, muscade), de la vanille, du malt fumé, du boisé, de la tourbe, du pain grillé, un peu dalcool, notes de levure belge Ce breuvage sent merveilleusement bon, incroyablement complexe et parfaitement intense! En bouche, cest bien pétillant sur la langue avec une onctuosité intéressante au palais. Au goût, abondantes saveurs fruité (raisin, cerise, prune, datte), du pain grillé et des sucres (on est dans le caramel, cassonade, cola avec des notes bien évidente dérable!). Mais cest loin dêtre trop sucré, le malt étant admirablement bien équilibré par les épices, la levure (légère acidité) et les notes de vanille, de malt fumé, de boisé et de tourbe. Il y a également pas mal dalcool en bouche, peut-être un peu trop. Aussi, une amertume plutôt légère mais tout de même bien sentie se pointe en finale, mais cette dernière se veut surtout alcoolisée. Toujours bien intense en bouche, mais peut-être un peu moins complexe quau nez, il sagit dun gros coup de cur pour moi. Je ne me tanne jamais de ce divin nectar brassé par dauthentique moine trappiste!

Nice creamy head. Dark amber color. The smell is malt and dry fruits. The taste is smooth in the mouth but you will feel the alcohol going through your throat and chest. Good but not my type Of beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

BBD 9/27/17. Pours a very hazy dark amber with a slight reddish tint. Massive head and lacing that retains well. The nose is subdued, but of dates/figs, dark malt and Belgian yeast. The body is on the heavy side of medium with a nice slick mouthfeel. Normal carbonation level with a touch of effervescence on the finish. The wonderful flavor profile is quite complex, yet balanced. It begins with a multitude of dark fruit flavors - fig, date, raisin, plum - then flows to a mild malt sweetness over a well subdued alcohol phenolic note. The finish is smooth, yet also almost clean. A slight residual alcohol burn with associated phenolics linger a bit. This is the best Belgian Ive ever had.

Pours a nice deep amber with a thick creamy head. Aroma is spicy and heavy on alcohol. Tons of carbonation. Medium body with a thin texture and tons of fizzy carbonation. The finish is long. Taste is nice yet medium with medium bitterness. Yes, this beer burns all the way down like the Orkney Skullsplitter, but this one tastes way better. Wow...what an interesting beer!

Excellent! This one is just plain excellent. Nice, fresh aroma that leads into an excellent taste. I would definitely consume more of this. The 9.2% ABV in the ale might keep me from drinking too many but it will allow me to savor it longer. Now...the 10!

Drunk from 33cl bottle at da GRONO, Brussels. Pleasant dark treacly like beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Coloração marrom, espuma bege, aroma açucarado mascavo, caramelo e especiarias. Sabor frutado, caramelado e doce. Uma das melhores trapistas, carregada e ao mesmo tempo equilibrada. Chega perto da perfeição.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great beer all around. Nice amber color with a cream colored head. Tastes of caramel and malt.
Soft brown beer with a nice milky head. Pronounced taste with hints of dried figs.

Rather clear, amber colour with a toast coloured frothy head. No visible CO2. Noses of wet grass, moor, toffee, dried fruits, leather with hints of wood and tobacco. Full bodied with malty sweetness and nutty leathery notes. Lightly sweet-bitter long lasting a bit alcoholic finish. Rather complex beer!
Bottle. Pours red brown semi clear beer with a thick beige head. Aroma is alcohol, yeast, raisins and plums. Taste is sweet bitter with alcohol with a smooth fruity aftertaste. A good balanced beer.

0,33L bottle, BB 24.08.2018. Pours dark red-brown with white head. The head stays. Aroma is burnt sugar, dark fruits, alcohol, and plums. Taste is burnt sugar, fruity, very malty, and alcohol. Finish has nice alcohol burn. Overall: very drinkable for the ABV, but this bottle is clearly too fresh. I would like to try aged version; Im sure it would be totally different beer.
Smooth beer (more smooth then 10) smooth flavour. Normal look with rochefort 10. Little explosion of taste in your mouth. Gentle and smooth beer

Pours a semi clear dark brown with large creamy white head that slowly settles and leaves pretty good lace. Aroma is rich sweet dark malts, dark dried fruits, plums, cherries, prunes, perfumy, lightly spicy, dark candied sugar, and bready. Flavour is sweet dark malts, dark, candied sugar, dark fruity esters, plums, raisins, cherries, prunes, alcohol(really smooth though), toast, and spicy phenols. Complex, smooth and damn tasty!
Grandiose !!! Exceptionnel ! Aussi bonne que la rochefort 10, ya. Pas grand chose à dire de plus... Si toutes les bières était de cette qualité, le monde serait meilleur et plus joyeux...
Poured a hazy light brown. Floating yeast. Clean cherry and light malt aroma. Carbonation exploded when it hit the tongue. Absolutely fantastic. Possibly the perfect beer.

Aroma is of dark fruit, belgian yeast, belgian sugar. Taste is a full mouth sweet fruit body with the sugar candy appearance. Some light bitterness and a tad bit of alcohol kick which is very subtle for a 9.2% beer.Appearance is a amber body with a well retained lace head.

Bottle. Pours hazy brown with a big beige frothy head that leaves little lacing. Almost no aroma-a first but a lot of carbonation, light body, thin to creamy texture, medium to heavy sweet, lightly bitter with a brief sweet finish. Hides the alcohol very well.

Near perfect beer. A bit over carbonated. Pours brown with a frothy offwhite head. Smells of wine (dark fruity with a bit of alcohol). Sweet beer, plum or raisin? Smooth, easy drinking even though higher ABV. Leaves warm feeling. Delicious beer

Fruits, dried fruits, nuts, chocolate and a hint of caramel in the aroma. Dark amber with a off white head. Medium to heavy sweet with a light to medium bitterness. Medium body with a lively carbonation. Nice complex and interesting beer but it is way to much carbonated for my taste.

33 cl, flaske, 9,2 % ABV, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse, 7. marts 2014.
Rødbrun ufiltreret Trappistøl med stor offwhite-farvet skumtop, 4-5 cm tykkelse. 
Svag duft af belgisk gær og noget fjernt citrus. 
Men dejlig rund og blød smag med fin balance mellem sødme og bitterhed. Efter første tår er det som om bryggets aroma åbner sig lidt. Duft af tørret frugt kommer frem. Figen.
I eftersmagen fremkommer der varmende alkohol og der er sødme i billedet. 
Forholdsvis højt indhold af kulsyre, som giver meget "skum i mund".
Dette er lillebroderen til den mere berømte Rochefort 10, men "ham hér" gør sig nu ganske fint.

Bottle from Y Delyn Wine Bar, Mold. Pours a deep amber to brown colour with an effervescent off-white head. Aroma is plummy, fig and malt. Taste is dark chocolate and dark forest fruits. A little over carbonated for my taste, not as good as the number 10 but still very very good.

Dark brown with a big layer of creamy foam on top. Plums, raisins, yeast, spices, syrup. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Full and complex. One of the beers that relish the soul and remind what a great invention beer brewing is. Close to perfection.
Dark red/brown pour with thick cream color head that lasts. A sweet taste, dark fruit, that covers the alcohol very well. Very good beer.

Bottle to tulip
Spice, cherry, caramel, and a little yeast.
Dark reddish brown with a 2 cm frothy pinkish tan head. The taste is quite malty, but balanced somewhat by some bitter hops. The fruitiness is there but as a light fresh sweetness on top of the malt.
A delicious and complex malt flavor makes makes this beer pretty special. It has a good balance between hops and malt flavoring, which allows the palate to appreciate the complexity of the malt.

A little sweeter and lighter than 10 but still excellent in its own way. Pours a bit lighter brown with nice head. Taste fig and carmel. Much better as it warms a bit from frig temp.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cerveza trapense oscura de muy buen sabor y menor graduación que su compañera la 10. Buena elección si quieres tomar una buena trapense

Bottle. Pours opaque reddish, dark brown with large offwhite head. Aroma is caramel, sweet malt, ripe fruits (apple, pear, peach, banana, pineapple), yoghurt and soap. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter and light acidic. Body is light oily with crisp carbonation. Finish is long with notes of caramel, malt, ripe fruits, hints of burnt sugar, walnuts and cinnamon cookies.
Botella de 33cl. ...gran cerveza. .no hay cerveza mala en esta Abadía. ...quizás un poco carbonatada de más. ...

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Pours dark amber/mahogany with a decent 1 finger beige head. Smells earthy and of dark fruit. Taste is very complex, nothing sticks out really and its hard to pick out flavours, the more dominant is nutty maltiness and fig prune. Very creamy and alcohol is completely hidden.

Bottle: pours beatifully with a light but longlasting foam ending up as with a hazy orange/brown colour in the glass. Aroma is fruitful with hints of figs and a slight malty undertone. Taste is complex with different dried fruits to it, figs and is there also a touch of raisins there? The taste lasts long and the abv gives a great warm aftertone that brings the whole experince to another level. Great bear!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

Butelka 0.3L. Mętne brązowe z bujną kremową pianą, która szybko znika. W piwie pływają drobiny prawdopodobnie drożdżowe. Aromat: rodzynki, owoce, alkohol, śliwki i karmel. Przypomina owocowy likier.
W smaku podobnie plus sporo alkoholu, który dobrze wkomponowuje się w całość.
Wysycenie średnie do wysokiego.
Bardzo dobre.
A great trappist beer with a characteristic and delightful taste and aroma. The 12 is better, but the 8 is a treat also.

33cl bottle at De Planck Gent.
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, nice stable beige head.
NOSE: caramel, sweet, alcohol, coffee, reminded me of a certain type of coffee/caramel candy - mokatine.
TASTE: sweet, alcohol, caramel, some liquorice even (faint), again the same mokatine candy like taste, coffee.
Very nice!
Prima trappistenbier. Als 8 liefhebber krijgt deze de stempel: gemiddeld goed. Staat deze op de bierkaart? Gewoon doen. :)

This brew poured a very large invigorated head of creamy fine light brown bubbles and a yeasty opaque light brown body. Its aroma was of a medium strength roasted malt. It had a very smooth complex palate with flavours of caramel malt and a very smooth but slightly tingly mouth feel. It had an excellent lacing.

330 ml bottle from the LCBO. Best before date: 14.03.2018, so its been in the bottle about a year.

Appearance: Pours and deep coppery brown with one finger of off white lingering head. Cloudy.

Aroma: Sweet , yeast/bread, plums, raisins, figs, a bit of booze.

Taste: Complex, love the citrus notes, brown sugar. Still, dangerously easy drinking.

Palate: lively carbonation

Overall: Lives up to the hype

Pours a slightly cloudy amber with a huge head of tan foam, mostly lasting. Nose is caramel with some fruitiness. Very light and bubbly on the mouthfeel. Taste is of caramel, fruitiness, medium roasted malt, some bread/yeastiness and a very mild hop note on the finish. A fine sipping beer. Can be paired nicely with fruits, nuts or cheeses.
Bière qui se laisse boire facilement ! Saccorde avec toutes sorte de plats! et reste un plaisir à déguster au soleil et en terrasse!
Wonderful trappist beer. Amazing color and flavor. Pour is brown with a thick off white head.

Bottle at home. Pours a reddish dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma of sweet malts, dark fruits; plum and raisin, caramel, and alcohol. Sweet malty taste, lots of dark fruits, caramelized sugars, and warming alcohol, long lasting, slighty, bitter after taste. Very nice.

Una delle punte di diamante della selezione trappista, anche se non raggiunge la perfezione della sua sorella maggiore. Ugualmente molto complessa, con note di frutta scura, nocciola, caramello, prevalentemente dolce, attraversata da soffuse note alcoliche e calde, stupisce per la sua alta carbonazione. Merita!
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 Dark black pour with a sizeable head and a deep malt aroma. Taste is of deep malt, biscuits and caramel, alcohol, dark fruit and a smooth finish. Wonderful

330 ml bottle, dark brown color with white foam. taste are very good a bit bitterness and some sweetness caramel toffee and coffee, long aftertaste some find like caramel and nuts. one of the best Belgian beers

Poured from bottle in to chalice. Big aroma of alcohol and slight fruitiness. Head is large and persistent. Flavor is excellent, slightly sweet with hints chocolate and fruit. Many have commented that fig is prevalent and I agree. Incredibly carbonated, definitely a "fizzy" mouth feel, but not at all unpleasant. After taste is lingering, but likable. Another excellent brew from trappist monks.
Pours cloudy light amber with good head and debris. Tastes of caramel and fruit. Pretty fizzy, starts bitter the finishes with an alcoholic aftertaste.
Quality classic. Beautiful amber brown pour. Nose of dried fruits and caramel malts. Taste adds just a touch of burn, sweetness, and bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel.
A complex trappist ale from a world class brewery. Dark brown body with medium carbonization. One of the best abbey/trappist brews from Belgium.
Bottle from Galaxy. Pours a dark amber, almost cola like, with a layer of off white head. Aroma of yeast and spice with hints of dark fruit. Taste of raisins and alcohol with strong carbonation.
This beer looks so well done,it smells great but the taste gets dominated with taste of alcohol.. after taste is remarkable still there after 5min and just whant more:)Good beer

Poured from a bottle. Gorgeous appearance in the glass; dark cherry color almost. Sweet aroma that quickly moves to almost a lactic acid smell, like a fine cheese. Silky palate. Overall, a magnificent, complex tripel with immense depth.

Overall, this is my least favorite of the three Rochefort beers. Aroma is sweet caramel, toffee, light fruity notes, aspartame. Pour is nice - a hazy dark brown with a tan head. Flavor is similar to the nose. Belgian yeast notes amongst fruity and fake sweetener. Its good.
Zeer lekker. Aroma is zeer aangenaam. Zeer fijn schuim dat blijft. Heb altijd zin in een tweede.
Really hazy dark amber body with a nice tan lasting head. Caramel, sweet dried fruit aroma. Taste is medium sweet, strong carbonation, slight bitterness. Really nice.

Nice tripel. I look for light fruit notes first and foremost in this style. And this one has them. Hard to go wrong!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very good. Interesting well balanced flavor of caramel marzipan and dried fruit. It is strong but easy to drink. Rightfully a classic.
Poured from bottle. Appears amber, almost cherry colored in glass. Smells sweet, with hints of lactic acid. Taste is fruity (tart) and well balanced.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 Overall I was disappointed. No real flavour. Sweet in a strange way.It looked nice.

Bottled. Pours cloudy brown with a long lasting creamy beige head. Aroma is caramel, raisin, red fruits, alcohol (but not as much as in 10), floral, bready and some licorice. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter. Complex and full bodied. Long fruity finish.

Another good Belgium strong ale that I had to try due to all the hype and accessibility. Like the 10 better, but this is a great way to be introduced to this style of craft beer without paying or trading an arm and a leg.

Bottle 0.33l. Pours dark brown with small beige head. Aroma has dried fruits, molasses, plums, slightly sharp. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter, slightly roasted, dried fruit, plums, figs. Alcohol is well hidden. Strong carbonation. Very good.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2016 Pours a murky copper/dark brown with a frothy white head. Aroma of malts, ripe fruits, caramel, nuts, walnut, yeast, figs, spices. Flavour is malty sweetness, caramel, a bit sugary. Just like the Rochefort 6 this has quite lively carbonation, with a relatively dry finish. Nice, remarkably balanced beer. A bit heavy on the toffee sweetness for my taste though.

Reviewed from notes. She pours a dark brown and leaves the same colored body with some purple edges - interesting. There is a one finger white foamy head - very pillowy looking clings for a good minute and slowly dies leaving adequate lacing but the lacing dies within a good minute. The smell has a lot of booze up front, candied fruits (a combination of cherries and plums) with some figs and clove well presented. The taste has a wholly sweet flavoring all the way through and lots of booze. It has a boozy/slightly candied fruit aftertaste with a thick candied fruit sticky finish. On the palate, she sits about a medium to heavy. The ABV is definitely felt and in no way is remotely sessionable. The carbonation seems good. Overall, wow, what a booze bomb, just wondering how fresh this is, wonder what 290616 means. Im wishing I shouldve let this age for a bit as I think I had this way too early, next time I will definitely let this sit way longer.

33cl in a Trappist glass. Pours a dark amber colour and is highly carbonated with a fair amount of sediment. Taste is quite delicate for such a strong beer and feels very carbonated. Taste is somewhat less than expected for the style. Mounthfeel is quite good with nice lacing around the glass. Aftertaste to me seemed quite medicinal. Certainly no match for Rochefort 10.
The Rochefort 6,8, and 10 are all fairly similar in my opinion. The 8 is medium-bodied and drinkable, which is nice. Flavor has dense, sweet fruits with caramel and toffee notes.
Fantástica cerveja. Equilíbrio entre maltes e álcool. Levemente adocicada, sem ser enjoativa. Top 10!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2016 Bottle. 33cL. A dark brown beer. Shading from brown to dark orange through the light. Large creamy head which lasts a few minutes. Aroma of caramel, fruits (berry), bread, roasty and alcohol. Sweet taste with a dry refreshing bitterness. Medium body, light texture. Warming finish with medium bitterness. A great beer. I appreciate this roasty fruity toffee aroma. Gourmet break during the afternoon.

33cl brown bottle, abv 9.2%.
Huge belgischhhh foam, off-white to apricot beige in colour.
Dark amber hazy body.
Scents of sweet malts, hops, clove, potatoes.
Tastes dark sweet alcoholic malts, figs, syrup, prunes, butter (or soft mild cheese), faint hint of coffee.
Feels smooth and fresh at the same time.
Ending: Roasted malts, mildness, crispiness, alcohol well hidden.
Overall; good.

330ml bottle pours cloudy reddish brown with a finger of thick foam. Nose is musty earthy dark fruits and bread, raisin. Palate is unbelievably silky and creamy smooth. Taste is rich earthy fruit and dark bready biscuit, plum, grape, raisin, almond. Finish is more of the same. Truly a great beer.

A: Dark brown, thick yellow head. S: Very strong malts. T: Sweet, fruit, malt, goes into long soury aftertaste. Some liquorice. M: Thick, smooth, gets around your mouth. Leaves dry feeling everywhere. O: Weird and way to sweet but nice.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 330ml bottle poured into tulip. Appearance is hazy iced tea brown with red highlights. One finger head quickly fades to a ring. Bit of a bubble show with sediment resting on the bottom. Aroma is raisin, vanilla, fig, alcohol, light molasses, and grains. Taste is sweet malt and yeast with mild clove phenol, pumpernickel bread, brown sugar, and fig. Alcohol is prominent with fruit and spice notes. Medium-plus body, creamy texture, fizzy carbonation, spicy and sweet finish.

A very cloudy, dark beer, with a fluffy layer of foam. It has a sweet/sour aroma like forest fruits or an orange. This moves on into a complex taste, but a subtile bitterness is also found. Sadly enough, not much of an aftertaste.

Een enorm troebel, donker bier met een vrij luchtige kraag. Het aroma is iets zoetzurig als bosvruchten of sinaasappels. Dit gaat over in een complexe smaak, maar hier komt ook een subtiele bitterheid bij kijken. Helaas weinig nasmaak.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 This is fantastic. Rich with various fruit flavours, dates, figs and raisins and it is spicey. The taste develops continuously with yeast and bitterness along with a slightly sour sweetness. I think it is amongst the best beers I have ever tasted and something I always buy when I want to treat myself to a beer that is a little bit special.

0.33l bottle. 9.2%. Dark brown color. Bitter and highly carbonated. Caramel taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark, forcefull. Almost brown. Chocolate foam. Sweet, mild smell. Coffe. Humble. Very slow. High bitterness from the start. Powerfull. Actually pretty great. Soothing finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Bottle): Pours a murky deep brown with a tan head. Aroma of dark fruits - raisins, cherries, grapes. Notes of yeast, bread, spices and malt too. Similar notes in tasting. Smooth and well carbonated. Very nice.
Pours a light brown copper colour. Smell is with figs, raisins caramel. Taste is again figs ,caramel, raisins and belgian yeast. Absolutely love this rochefort. One of my favorites
This ale come with a lot of hype but is a little more average than I anticipated. I will try the 10 next time.

Pours a hazy brown with a medium offwhite head that leaves nice lacing. Aroma is of raisin bread, lightly spicy. Taste is sweet and full of dark fruit flavors. Finishes on bitter but clean notes. Body is medium-full, carbonation of an higher order. Mouthfeel is slightly creamy but mostly lacking when compared with its bigger sibling. Great beer but still worlds away from its bigger brother!
Lekker makkelijk drinkbaar biertje , nadronk is klein bittertje . Is lekker met een verjaardagen . Om effe wat anders als pils te drinken . Is lekker met borrelsnacks .

Pours dark brown and cloudy; almost opaque. Thick pillowy latte-looking head that stays forever. Nose is rich apple pie a la mode with hints off raisin. Flavor is a delicate blend a sweet malty goodness and gentle hoppy nip. Full body, lively carbonation, toffee finish. Excellent!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 33 cl.
Big, nice frothy, almost creamy, head. Black, a slight amber against bright light, with some particles. Grainy, roasted malt, some chocolate and earthy leather. Fruit, plums or dried. Long acidic, sweet, but nicely bitter taste. Some seawater or minerals. Lively. And a slight metallic finish.

Music:Radka Toneff  Love Comes Quietly
Drank after finishing the first draft of my Bachelors Thesis, at home, 05/01/2014. Good beer. Just like the 10, bbut then a little less good. Hints of salmiac. Okay beer.

Pours a sienna chestnut color with a finger of tight eggshell foam. Lots of spicy earth on the nose, pepper, cinnamon, nutmeg, dates and burnt sugar. The palate follows with great rich flavors or burnt caramelized sugar with lots balanced spice and a lingering dark fruits. Mouthfeel is perfect with fizzy bubbles and a mouthcoating palate.

Im a bit a sea with this and wanted it to be more. More caramel, more sweet, less alcohol, and I wasnt sure why everyone loved this so much. But when you take this for what it is and not compared to what you had last this is ok. The astringent alcohol os there, the bitterness and the carry. I dont not like it, I might not buy another though

Poured from bottle to glass. Deep dark amber with fizzy off white head. Aroma is esters, sugar, light roast malt, caramel, cloves, cola, floral. Mouthfeel is fantastic with medium body and high carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a slight astringent following with CO2 bite and slight ethanol in the finish. Overall this is a great brew and more balanced than Rochefort 6.

Brown unclear with beige/white head.
Aroma is caramel, dark fruits, nuts, sweet, yeast.
Taste is a strong sweetness, but still not overwhelming. With a nice warm, round boozy finish. Very light bitterness. 
Great beer!

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of chocolate malts, dark fruit, citrus and moderate yeast. Citrus and fruity flavors up front followed by some darker fruits, chocolate malt and moderate yeast. Fruity but malty finish.

Pours a very nice hazelnut brown and bubbly with a large foamy light tan head. That fades slowly and with character. Mild wet lacing. Aroma is earthy caramel malts, plums, raisins and wood-tinged booze. Taste is malt, wood, darkfruit. Dry, earthy, warming alcohol finish. Moderately carbonated. Alcohol is pretty well-disguised. Significantly less complex or memorable than T10. Pleasant to quaff, by there are better Belgians for the money. Maybe this bottle was simply too young. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Dark orangey-brown with a slight haze (despite not pouring the yeast.) a very lively light brown head that was soon gone. Spice, cloves, bubblegum, and dried fruit aromas. Thick and malty in the mouth, with spice, warming alcohol, and a dry bubblegum finish. Very good.

Rochefort Trappistes 8
Duft: karamel. krydderier 
Smag: sødme. karamel. svisker, 
denne øl siger mig ikke det store fatter ikke den er på rate 100

.33l bottle @ Harrys Pours cloudy dark orange/apricot with medium offwhite head. Aroma is floral, yeast, malts, caramel, fruits and banana notes. Flavor is mostly same. Well balanced, sparkling palate. Swell!
had Trappistes Rochefort 10 last week,so decided to try the 8..not as good as 10..but didnt expect it to be..but still good.

Have been drinking this since the early 80s, but this was the first time in my RB life. From bottle. Deep brown color. Big, off white to beige head. Aromas: sweet malts, herbs/spices, yeast. Sweet retronasal. Flavor is sweet, yeasty, fruity. Medium bodied (actually a bit thin). Long finish, slightly dry, but no new flavors. I find this actually a bit too sweet, or too thin. Still OK though.

This is a pretty interesting beverage. I think it is kind of malty for my taste but I dont mind too much. I put beer in glass. It looked very nice in glass. Because of nice appearance, I decide to drink. It had notes of cooked vegetables and smoke. Very woody, but not the good kind. Overall, it was OK. Not bad at all. I think I got drunk before drinking this though. So i couldnt smell too much. I am depressed.

Finalement entrée et cette fois, un magnum 1.5L de Tderoeck pour le nouvel an 2014. Cuvée 2010.
Brune foncée, col épais beige.
Arôme offre un bouquet au caractère malté, très belge, léger sur fruité noir pointe de sucre caramélisé.
Palais ets malté, caramel, levure avec un palais réchauffant pour ses 9%. Fruité noir sur note de raisin sec, touche de date. Pointe damertume en arrière-bouche adouci par un léger sucre candy.

This is really something else. Pours effortlessly into the glass with a small but present head (maintains well), smelling of rich malt with a deep and lasting sweetness. Slightly cloudy in the glass.

Never have I had the pleasure of tasting a beer with such impeccable balance as this, every mouthful was an absolute joy and consistently offered new flavours. A medium bodied, lively and somewhat creamy texture. The rather heavy carbonation of the beer really helps to make this beer quite playful.

Absolutely wonderful, cannot fault it. Its a testament to the skill of the brewers to be able to serve up a 9.2% alcohol beer and barely be able to notice it at all while drinking. Really superb, thoroughly recommend.
Mørk, uklar. Krydret sødme, malt og mørk karamel. God fylde. Medium carb, som harmonerer godt. God eftersmag, balanceret alkohol. Mums.

Thick ivory head with sweet caramel and spices aromas. Dense body with chocolate taste. Excellent balance despite little less density and aroma than the 10 bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bottle.

A- Molasses, brown sugar, dark fruit, plum, raisins.

A- Dark color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Brown sugar, caramel, bread, plums, raisins, balanced.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, full rich finish.

O- One of the best beers out there. I enjoy this more than the 10. A very smooth and solid ale.

28/12/2013 330ml bottle (aged). Bruna intensa con riflessi miele di castagno, lievemente torbida, schiuma color beige, media, poco persistente. Al naso sentori di zucchero di canna, spezie, fichi secchi, frutta rossa sotto spirito, molto complessa. In bocca è straordinaria, attacco dolciastro, caramello, toffee, miele di castagno con nota amarognola finale a bilanciare il tutto. Corpo pieno, carbonazione media. Eccellente come sempre.

Poured into Trappist glass. Wonderful malty aroma with some yeast.. not very strong but pleasant. Poured dark brown with a massive creamy head. Lots of carbonation and lacing in the glass. Hazy but no floaters. Consistently wonderful taste every time Ive had it. Barely any alcohol and easy to drink. Light, malty and maybe sweet flavors improve in the glass. Love to drink this beer when I can get it. Definitely my favorite BSA.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2015 bouteille de 330ml de brune. belle mousse crémeuse. arome de raisin floral d?herbe et de cassonade. gout de sucre d?orge bien équilibré et tres agréable soyeux en bouche avec gout fruité de raisins et de porto. pas trop puissant en bouche juste bien équilibré

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Nose: Cola, treacle, cellar, malt, figs, stewed plums. Taste is caramel, brown sugar, raisin, plums, prices, leading to licorice with slight sour cherry in the dry spicy finish. Mouthfeel is a little thinner than you would expect.A delicious beer, but I?ll always want the 10.

Vorweg: Für mich eines der besten Biere, die ich getrunken habe. Dunkele Haselnuss in der Farbe, schöner Schaum, der etwas grobporig ist, dafür aber auch nach längerer Zeit (wenn auch dünn) bleibt. Unglaublich blumige Aromen mit etwas Frucht. Im Geschmack etwas süß, nicht zu süß. Ebenfalls blumig und fruchtig. Pflaume. Flieder. Etwas Karamell, der Alkohol ist auch herauszuschmecken. Für mich ein rundum tolles Bier, das mich ein klein wenig an Cornish Coaster erinnert.
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2014 33 cl bottle. Aroma: alcohol, liccorice. Appearance: dark, thick white head. Tasteah sweet. light body, creamy, soft carbonation. Overall: good, N

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2014 This beer has become a staple of my recent. To lose 10 in both aroma, taste, alcohol, but it is an honor student who to satisfy his tongue also, very easy to drink. The chemistry is so good at cooking, around here that are also favorite.

murky copper color with huge small bubbled bottle conditioned cream head. aroma of tobacco, bourbon, tart fruit, dark fruit. Some EtOH and phenolics in nose unfortunately. This bottle is about 2 years old. Mouth-feel is medium full, the sweet up front and then tartness superceeds, very small showing on the bitter buds. this bottle not great

Aroma: sweet caramel malts. Appearance: hazy dark brown , big light head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweet, fruits, caramel, all sorts of sweet things. Overall: massive Belgium Strong Ale, high alcohol hardly noticeable (which is a big positive). Bottle from Wittich Weine, Switzerland.

Best before March 21, 2017.
Appearance: The body is a muddy brown to garnet in hue, with a towering, absolutely towering, foamy light tan head. The head has excellent retention, forming uneven craters as it slowly dissipates.
Aroma: The aroma is strong of carbonic acid, along with figs and caramel. The aroma leans sweet with brown sugar in addition to the figs and caramel, perhaps a touch of floral hops.
Taste: Big caramel throughout, becoming dark caramel by the finish with brown sugar lingering. Fruity notes are throughout, apple and fig come to mind. This is malty and fruity in all the right ways.
Palate: Big carbonation turns the thick body into a bready foamy body.
Overall: I might get flack for this, but this reminds me of a doppebock in many ways. Big maltiness of caramel and brown sugar with a big fruitiness. I enjoy this, its a great beer, but damn its pricey! Its better than Chimay Red, but loses on the value points. Shame!

Bottle
Aroma-fruits,raisin, 
Appearance-amber, cloudy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, lively, long finish, 
Overall-perfect
Very nice beer. Nice 1 finger head dark red brown colour. Immediate taste is of vanilla and plum. Aroma is floral. Great beer
Murky brown, no head. Boozy plum nose. Dark fruit flavors, plum. Big yeasty flavor with weird dark fruit after taste, hard to describe but amazing.

Opaque redbrown color, tiny off-white head, dissipates quickly; at first sweet malty roasty nose, followed by a complex mixture of dark fruits, figs, dates, black currants, raspberries, syrup, caramel, coffee, cinnamon, cloves, ginger; taste is sweetbitter with a bit acidity and spicy; full body. creamy texture; finish sweetbitter, with spicy , fruity and grassy tones

Brown beer with durable big fluffy head. Aroma has ripe fruits, sweet and sour berries and some hops. Taste has ripe fruits, resin, tannin, berries and grape hop flavors as well. Full texture but still not that great. 10 is still better even I didnt like the after taste in it. Complex beer.

Spiced rum, plums, figs and even bits of bourbon on the nose. Tastes of big, dark, spiced fruits with peppery cloves, bitter skins, malted breads and all kinds of glorious things they currently serve in heaven. A truly blessed beast.

Pours a reddish brown with an off white head that dissipates quickly. Lots going on here. Some spice(like a rum like spice youd find in spiced rum), dark fruits (plums, raisins, prunes, figs), caramel, light cocoa. Taste is very much the same as the nose. A little sweet but thats to be expected with the higher alcohol content. Finish is spice and some grassy notes. Very well done.

1.5 year old bottle. Dark copper with light beige head that disappears very fast and leaves a nice little island. Incridibly complex: theres red fruits, dried fruits, rum, spices, milk chocolate, icecream, it just keeps on going. Taste is a great balance: medium sweet, sour touch and bitter cocoa and grassy notes in the aftertaste. Medium mouth, slightly prickly carbonation. My favorite beer so far. Every bottle is slightly different, I prefer the ones that have a bit more chocolate, but this is very, very close to perfection.

12 oz bottle shared pours murky red color with off white head. The aroma is odd dark fruits like plums or maybe figs also get lots of sweet malts. The flavor is incredible. Sweet malt backed by the dark fruit base. Medium body so full of flavors. No alcohol burn to speak of. Sensational beer.

Couleur très spéciale orangés avec des reflets rouge avec un col moyennement mousseux mais résistant. Nez intense et complexes de fruits rouges. En bouche le mélange est complexes tout comme le nez: Cerises,framboises,fraises et plus encore. Une bière très bien construite mais il faut aimer ce genre de bière pour lapprécier a 100% !
Cloudy mahogany body with a frothy cream head. Caramel and red fruit flavours. Nice full mouthfeel. Very nice.
33 cl bottle. Aroma: alcohol, liccorice. Appearance: dark, thick white head. Tasteah sweet. light body, creamy, soft carbonation. Overall: good for a strong beer,

33cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy reddish-brown, massive off-white head. Smells sweet-sour. Aroma caramel, chocolate, fruit, herbs, all moderated. Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, salty notes. Fizzy carbon, alcohol is quite well hidden, light bitter finish. Easy to drink, lighter taste than I expected, there for its not that unique experience, but still an amazing beer.

In bottiglia. Colore ramato carico, schiuma fine persistente ed in gran quantità. Aroma di caramello, frutta secca, frutta rossa, alcoolico, terroso. Al palato corpo intenso, gasatura evidente che non disturba, nota alcoolica presente, birra rotonda, appagante con sentori di frutta sotto spirito, terroso. Ottima

Rochefort 8 has a thin, cream-colored, fizzy, root beer-like head, and an initially clear (it seriously clouds up when one swishes and pours in the heavily caked bottom contents), extremely bubbly appearance, with film of lacing left behind. The aroma is of sweetness, fig, prune, bread crust, and malt. Taste is similar with a background of grain husky and brandy wine. Mouthfeel is medium and quite prickly, and Rochefort 8 finishes mostly dry, relatively easy drinking, and rich. This is one of the worlds classic beers, and I strongly advise trying it. RJT

Bottle. Cola colored with a thick fluffy off white head. Aroma is bready and nutty with dark fruit notes. Taste mostly follows suit while adding a big alcohol punch and some subtle vanilla notes. Medium fizzy palate and slightly oily and chewy. Very good.

Bottle at home. Bottle pulled from the cellar has over four years on it. Colour is clear rich rub red caramel with a fine persistent cream / grey head. Aroma is rich raisin, rum dried fruit. Some age im the nose, slaty, alcohol, wood. Flavour is woody, raisin, candy sugar sweet, booze presence, and some salt. Palate is smooth velvety, effervesent. Very tasty

Color castaño claro, preciosa capa de espuma beige que perdura, aromas muy marcados a malta tostada, caramelo y frutos secos, en boca es armoniosa desplegando notas a fruta, cointreau y levadura; alcohol bien integrado, carbónico medio y amargor casi nulo, trago corto; se disfruta desde la primera a la última gota, pos gusto largo y agradable, a wonderful beer.

Bière brune, trouble et mousseuse, aux reflets rougeâtres. Le nez offre du sucre dorge, beaucoup de fraîcheur malgré les apparences, du caramel, de lalcool et quelques vapeurs épicées. En bouche, lintensité se confirme, mais sans démesure. Tout est dans le dosage. Lacidité frappe en entrée, mais elle satténue rapidement au profit dun sucre résiduel qui nous enrobe les papilles. Des notes anisées flirtent avec lalcool, du palais à la langue, alors quun lit de sucre cuit sétale sur laxe horizontal (je suis très cartésien dans la dégustation, si si). La rondeur du produit est indéniable. Quelque chose de plus sec vient toutefois clore le débat avec des arguments clés comme «ouais, ça finit sec!». Cette bière est un bijou pour quiconque... mais surtout pour les amateurs de bijoux.

330ml bottle from Ibis Grimbergen. Liquorice immediately jumps out the glass with figs, raisins, dark malts & herbs all rising through at some point or other. Dark, thick and smooth texture. A great beer but not among the best Trappists for me.
Gedronken bij de 3 dorstige herten in Utrecht. Heerlijk biertje. Mooi donkere schuimlaag, caramel, fris, licht fruitig.
Krachtig maar subtiele smaak. Vleugje Caramel, bittertje en hop komen subtiel door en zijn goed op elkaar afgestemd.

Slightly cloudy light brown pour with large beige head. Raisins and dark malts and a little alcoholic and burnt sugar for aroma. Boozy sweetness with dried fruits like plums and raisins in the taste. The booze seems to overwhelm a bit compared to big brother 10. Medium to full body with somewhat dry finish. Lovely carbonation that tickles the tongue. Very nice trappist but I like the 10 a whole lot more.

330 ml bottle poured into my Funkwerks glass. Deep reddish brown and hazy with a big off-white head that lasts. The aroma is dark fruit, Belgian yeast, fruity esters. Similar flavor with bready malts, sugar, light spice/herbs and other complexities. Medium body with a nice soft feel. Very smooth and drinkable, top notch.

Pleasant fruity aroma. Appearance is deep red, somewhat cloudy. I detect figs, caramel and a touch of vanilla. A subtle, full bodied and creamy beer, yet with an elderly gentleman-like frail dryness to it. Alcohol, barely noticeable.

Donker bier met volle schuimkraag, bier is verrassend fris met een licht fruitige smaak

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great Trappist beer. Purchased at LCBO in a 330ml bottle for $3.30. Top notch, and I find the high alcohol 9.2% well hidden which is great!
Has a dark reddish brown color, with a white head. Has a malty, fruity and fresh aroma. Tastes of caramel, chocolate, prunes, yeast and a little hint of coffee.

Fruity nose, first taste melon de cavaillon, going over into a strong malty taste.
An alltime classic I first drank some 20 years ago. So nice to "rediscover" it now:-)
creamy smell, dark, thick roast nose. Right amount of head, Pours overcarbonated, but settles. Light, high ABV taste. Strong chocolatey smoothness.
Hazy dark brown to orange. Sparkling. Pours with a jolly fizz. Malty aroma with hints of raisin. Slightly sour.
Smells like belgian beer. Very nice finish when tasting. Strong and a little sour taste.
The powerfull fantastic belgian beer in the world. God save the trappistes of abbaye of st.remy!!!

330 mL bottle. Pours hazy mahogany with a murky off white cap, leaves no lacing surprisingly. Rich aromas of bready malt, a hint of cocoa, dried fig, raisin. Slightly sweet balanced by moderate to high carbonation and a hint of alcohol. Luxurious texture, but not heavy at all. Do let this warm up before enjoying.
Makes an excellent contrast to Imperial IPAs. Rich, full bodied, and deceptively strong. Which is the problem - albeit the only one. An absolutely superb beer...
Aroma diferente con toque de uva, apariencia oscura excelente, sabor amargo para mi gusto, tiene una consistencia cremosa
Amarga y de aroma no muy agradable. Se deja beber y tiene un sabor a fruta seca. Buena al paladar
Hazy orange brown. Aroma is same as Rochester extrapolated 6 but mellowed. Taste follows nose with nice carbonation and a creamy feel.

Bottle @ home. Pours with a brown hazy colour, large, long-lasting off-white frothy head. Aroma is medium malty, with notes of bread and chocolate, little hoppy, with notes of herbs, and medium yeasty, with notes of basement aromas and earth; additional notes of fruit, wood and alcohol (even though it is well hidden). Taste is medium sweet, little bitter, little sour, little salty. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Huge sediment!
Finally picked up this one, love the raisin, date, almost whiskey rich aroma, sweet rich body with a nice balanced finish, a bit high carb for me, but awesome!

This doesnt taste over 9 per cent! Id have guessed at 7.5. Lovely bready, malty aroma, taste similar. I know this is an all time classic but it doesnt really do it for me. Dark dried fruit, sherry vibe.

Bottle pour dark copper. Nose sweet malt and hint of fruit. Taste similar. Slight alcohol boozy, but balanced by the sweet. Booziness wears off as it warms up in the glass then flavors come through. Tasted side by side with 6, 8, and 10.

33 cl bottle. Mostly clear dark copper, creamy lasting tan head slowly settles. Fruity spicy yeastiness, sweet chocolate aroma. Luscious dark fruits, sweet light chocolate malt taste, toffee and spice, vinous and sherry-like. Well carbonated, medium-full bodied, moderately hopped. Warming, subdued ABV, definitely one to savor, and DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys), though every beer enthusiast should sample this elite brew at some point on their journey.

Excellente bière trappiste, excellente bière tout court.
Rien à redire, une de mes bières favorites.

Over 9000.

não dou mais pontuação por vergonha. porque pode aparecer uma ainda melhor. O que posso dizer desta cerveja? é do c%ra&?/o.
Fez uma gravata que fiquei maravilhado! Sabe a TUDO o que é bom.. é docinha o suficiente para eu ficar a olhar para o copo e pensar... "porra, mas que espectáculo de bujeca!!!" Sente-se aquele primeio Kick do alcool que te faz pensar "é lá bicho mau!!!!!" Foram quase 4 euros muito bem empregues!
Great dark belgian ale, the only problem is that if it is young the alchool is really noticeable. But amazing!
