Absolutely Fantastic! Great Aroma Appearance and awsome labeling too lol...thanks for the bottles Rochefort...will be using them in my next batch!

New review 10AUG13: 4/3/3.25/3.5/3.25-
Best by: 24JAN18
The usual look of dark caramel with a solid quilt of creamy tan foam. Smells of co2, buttered graham crackers, some bits of resin and almost mint, some grass and nuts as it warms. Flavor is malty, some nice nougat and sweet notes. Theres still a bit of the resiny, almost skunky character that is a little overpowering. Honestly the beer seems a little medicinal at this point. Medium bodied with moderate carb and an off dry finish. Having had this beer multiple times, and at different ages, it appears I most like this one around the two year mark. Considering buying a couple bottles to test this theory....

Last review: 15DEC12: 3.5/3/3/3.5/3 - 3.08
Bb: 01FEB17
Pours toasted caramel with plenty of light toasted cream foam (I spent a few minutes just killing foam so I could get beer). Smells of co2, light toasted nuts, some yeast and a little bit of malt - but really not appealing this fresh at all.... Taste is sweet with banana, alcohol, some sugar, some hints of toasted malts; again, really surprised how little I respect this today. Feels really thin and lacks the body Id expect from the beer, the carb is hi initially, but Ive mechanically removed much of it. Really disappointed in this right now. Maybe too young...

01APR11 Review: 4/5/5/4/4.5-4.75
Bb: 2/11/14
A: Pours a dark mahogany ale, murky (due to yeast). Three finger head of light latte falls to sheet of the same. Good, coarse lacing. S: Malt, Brown sugar, raisins, dark fruits, figs, molasses. Dark, intriguing. Very nice and complex. Malts are excellent here.T: Above, then add graham and beautiful, bready yeast into the mix. Outstanding flavor. M: Full body and high carbonation. Wish the carb was a little high on this one. Too bad. O: Absolutely gorgeous beer. No question Rochefort is among the top five Trappist breweries.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2016 Avec maintenant quelques années dexpérience derrière la cravate en dégustation de bière, je revisite certaines dentres elles que javais notées au tout début de mon périple! Javais donné 3.7 à la Rochefort 8. Aujourdhui, ma appréciation a évoluée. Ce nest toujours pas mon style de bière préféré, ce genre de brune belge plutôt sucrée, mais je men rends compte : cest très réussie. On goûte les dattes, les figues et raisons secs. Lalcool est présent mais tellement bien intégré quil est agréable et non envahissant. Une bière à 9.2% qui se boit facilement, le corps étant très vivant. Good stuff!

Fles gedeeld met rikstar. Robijnrood bier troebel vd gist. Aroma is fruitig, vanille. Smaak is vol, prikkelend. Licht zoet, beetje wrang. In de afdronk een bittertje waarbij het zuur ook iets meer naar voren komt.

All the taste from 10 but a bit easier to distinguish. Notes of all things fruity. Fig grape brown sugar raisin some rubbing alcohol. Reminds me of my dads first home made wine. Just straight up good!

(bottle from LCBO) Pours a clouded reddish brown, orange around the edges, head of big white bubbles is short-lived without lace. Aroma is rich and complex as anything: fruit and some spice, makes me thing of cooked plums, maraschino cherry, spiced apple sauce, marzipan, vanilla, burnt sugar/toffee, sometimes seems like just a hint of cocoa/roast. On the palate it initially has a little sweetness, black cherry with a bit of caramel, light spice. In the middle it dries out and becomes a little vinous, earthy, a bit more spice. Finishes quite dry, persisting alcohol, somewhat bitter, noble-type hops and a sweet/tart fruit core, really mineral aftertaste. Body medium, carb is effervescent, not hard but palate-scrubbing, bit of alcohol from mid-palate on. This is good stuff, no doubt. In the mouth it seems to be cleared up by the bitter/mineral/carb nature of the finish. Maybe its that Rochefort water? Love the nose, wish the palate had more concentration later on. Need to try the 10.

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours clear reddish brown with a pillowy white head, quite high carbonation keeps it there. Aromas of plum pudding, apple sauce, spice, toffee. Sweet aftertaste, light bitter. Full bodied and rich, creamy, long elegant finish.

Pours murky brown, finger light tan head, lively.

Smell coco, spices, bit roasty, sweet belgian yeast. 

Taste vibrant chocolate, belgian sugar, red fruit, plum and date.

Complex, med to full body.

Great
If I go to heaven when I die I hope this will be in abundance up there. Too advanced for me to rate, but I feel Im in heaven when I drink it.

Bottle pour. A dark orange color with a thick dark cream head. A very sweet aroma, fruity. The taste is bitter and smooth; with a fruity end that is consistent with the aroma. Overall a very dry beer.

Murky brown color with average off-white head. Aroma of fruits , caramel, vanilla, raisons. Taste is light sweet on start , than light bitter. Have fruity and bread taste .very good!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellent brew, a bit lighter than the 10, but still very nice. 
Bottle from Geers.

Bottle. Murky amber color. Aroma and flavor have elements of toast and jam, figs, and currants. Flavor is very rich and complex. Quite strong and a decent amount of carbonation. A very nice beer and a great representation of the style!

Bottle. Pours murky brown with a prominent, bubbly tan head. Aroma of caramel, noble hops, vanilla, very clean. Taste is truly excellent: caramel-sweet up front, balanced by slightly noticeable alcohol, and a deep, slightly bitter finish. Certainly easier to drink than the 10!

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2013 Bottle: deep, murky brown; highly opaque with lots of floating sediment. Off-white head that dissipates much quicker than expected. Aroma is very complex; dark fruits, burnt brown sugar, light vanilla, caramel, toffee, and even a touch of some cocoa powder on the back-end. Taste is even more complex with lots of nuances; black cherry, plum, brown sugar coated figs & dates, faint rubbing alcohol, vinous grapes, earthy esters, raisins, ripe banana, toffee, mild clove, and some finishing black licorice & dark cocoa. Definitely my favorite of the Rochefort trio - yes, even better than 10. Very good beer with a huge flavor profile to offer.

First of all, let me say I think the heat might have got to this in storage (brought in Japan) as it doesnt taste quite as I remember it from Belgium, but still good. Very effervescent with only a little on the nose, head soon dissipating. A distinct almond taste that I hadnt noticed before joining the alcohol. Ill re-review before long, but have to say, this is a little disappointing, and I cant get excited about it.

A: Brown/Reddish Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head, Some Lcing

S: Sweet Bread, Raisins, Rum, Mild Plum

T: Sweet Bread, Banana, Raisins, Plum, Mildly Boozy

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Boozy

Overall, a pretty solid Belgian Dark with lots of full fruit flavor and little booziness

Bottle 0,33L. Murky, mahagony brown colour with nice creamy, light brown head. Aroma of nuts, caramel and dark fruits. Taste starts light sweet with very dense mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Aftertaste became moderate bitter and long lasting. Very good, full bodied creamy beer.
A lot of different dark flavors in the smell and taste in this one. Just under being too strong I think. One I would like again.
Pours a hazy dark brown with a huge head. Aroma is malty and slightly fruity. Taste is similar with a fairly boozy aftertaste.

This is how you spell almost perfect trappist beer, not too soft not too strong, with a good and lasting aftertaste, gets better every time you try it, more complex than other trappist and thick without being sticky.
Brown turbid ale with strong aroma as for a malty beer. I liked this beer for its spicy-n-fruity aftertaste and thick foam. Really good as for 9.2%

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2013 So, I finally got around writ the review for this, after few years of "tasting". Well the body is murky dirty brown with medium weak just slightly of white head. The aroma is pretty complex with array of different flavors, berries, malts, strawberries and oranges. Palate is medium full-bodied, carbonated and somewhat crispy but also flat on finish. Taste is sweet , dry, winy with ABV kicking in in the middle. All in all decent Trappist, but slightly unbalanced and rather rough-edged, also not so complex. Still very good.
One of my absolute favorites, probably the best beer I know ... And Ive had hundreds.
Brown color with beige head. Malt caramel aroma and candi sugar, some spicy. At taste is sweet and smooth, great.

Bottle. Brown, figgy with a big light brown head. Aroma has cocoa, yeast and chocolate. 

Taste has yeast, wood and nut. Some fruit. Smooth mouthfeel. Alcohol is well balanced. Lingering eoody aftertaste. Easy to drink yet tasty and complex enough.
Poured a deep amber with head that persisted for a bit. Smells of cherries and caramel. Tasted of cherries. Strong carbonation cleansed the palate. Lingering bitterness

This beer pours a light hazy brown with a small tan head that dissipates pretty quickly.

Smell is of raisins, bread and plums.

Taste is similar. Very much raisin/plum taste comes out with a little bit of malt. Finishes very dry with just a touch of alcohol.

Mouthfeel is light for what I was expecting. Lots of carbonation and not very sticky.

Not a huge fan of this one as there are better options for this style out there. Its a bit too sweet although the high alcohol content is hidden well.
Muito complexa, com aromas e sabores repletos de notas de malte, lupulo modetado, condimentos, certa picancia, e tudo muito equilibrado. Perfeita!

Still an IPA drinker struggling to get into trappist beers. I get lots of honeyed sweetness like dried fruit. But I guess thats what is intended. So this is more a review of my taste than of the beer. Its an intense taste. Ill give it that. And pretty smooth. I just miss those fresh hops.

Aroma with some fruits, malts and something roasty. Overall appearance is okay, nice dark brown color and nice foamy off-white head. Taste is something special to me: without being overwhelming, or something really special it is still amazing. Little (dark) fruit, raisins, chocolate, pretty much what you expect from a double, and perfectly balanced like no other.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 Flaske 0,33 l hjemme fra polet. Dette er en røver med 9,2 %. Mye skum ved helling, som ligger lenge. Nydelig og innbydende mørk brunt utseende. Deilig aroma. Smak av frukt og karamell. Ganske søt og mektig. Man merker ikke alk% nevneverdig før i den litt bitre avslutningen, noe som vel tyder på at den er meget godt balansert.

33cl bottle into Tulip Expiraton date Aug 2018

Lille, France

Appearance: A mountain of tan sustaining head. Lots of lacing on my glass. Deep brown. A fair amount of sediment in the bottom of my glass. 

Aroma: Roasted barley sweet bread, dark fruits, maple?

Taste: Sweeter than its Trappist counterparts. 

Palate: Full bodied for its class. thick texture, Good carbonation. Longer finish. 

Overall: I really enjoyed this beer. I took and sip and thought "yes!" The palate really exceeded my expectations, the beer feels great on my tongue. The flavor isnt overly complex, but not disappointing either. Perfect appearance. A well made beer. Next up tonight, Rochefort 10.

Dark brown pour with lots of sediment. Aromas of dark fruit, brown sugar, and yeast. Flavor is rich malt with plums and molasses. Smooth finish, abv is very well hidden. Very complex. Not as good as the 10, but still very tasty.

Mooi donker honing kleurig biertje. Zacht van smaak met een lichte dropsmaak. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2013.09 - fles 33cl - bruin bier met een rode glans, beige kraag - neus : rozijntjes, beetje azijn, fruitig - mond : fruit, rozijntjes, alcohol, een zuurtje, chocolade
From bottle. Dark amber with lots of bubbles. Aroma is dark caramel malt, cola, and port. Taste is plums, caramel, bourbon, and some yeast. Nice effervescence and pitted fruit aftertaste.

Bottle from vintage estates. Pours a cloudy copper brown color with a tan foamy head. Leaves a blotchy lacing down the glass. The aroma is of dark fruits, some caramel, and alcohol. The taste follows with some roasty character to it. Medium carbonation with a smooth finish.

Tuoksussa luumua. Maku vielä Rochefort 6:tta asteen monimuotoisempi: luumua, humalaa, mallasta muutamia mainitakseni. Jälkimaussa humalaa, luumua, hedelmäisyyttä ja mieto alkoholin polte. Tämä maistettu myös Pater Marcuksessa (Budapest). Rochefort 6 ja 8:n juominen perätysten antoi mielenkiintoisen pohjan tarkastella niiden keskinäisiä eroavaisuuksia. Näistä kahdesta 6 oli arkisempi ja enemmän omaan makuuni, vaikka 8 kruunakin illan makumaailmallaan.
33cl. Dark brown with a big long lasting head. Aroma is dark fruits, light malty, sweet, perfectly balanced. Flavor is sweet, caramel, alchool, perfectly balanced.
33cl bottle at Lobbes. Hazy amber/brown with a small quickly disappearing head. Full body with medium carbonation. Caramel, fruits, malts and some notes. A decent, complex, sweet full flavoured beer.

Dark amber color, huge white creamy head. Light aroma of caramel, malt, yeast, spices and alcohol. Taste is dry sweet with lightly bitter finish. Medium body and fizzy carbonation. Good one, but expected much more.

0,33 l bottle. Pours dark redbrown, creamy light tanned head. Toffee and fruits on the nose. Starts very fresh, full bodied sweet malt and fruity, caramell und some hints of nuts. Little bit alcoholic but easy to drink. Great stuff!
Pours cloudy brown, light brown head. Nutty, dried fruit, malty aroma. Earthy, malty caramell, vinious taste. Varming finish.

A marvelous beer. Great and full body with a solid and flowery flavour. One of the all time trappist greats and a must drink for any type of beer fan. A lighter variant of the stronger brother the Trappistes Rochefort 10 but by no means the lesser one.

Botella de 330ml. Copa Cáliz de Westmalle. Marrón oscuro con tintes rubi profundo a contraluz y apariencia velada. La espuma beige crea un corona algodonosa y persistente y deja copiosos anillos de encajes en las paredes. Aromas de levadura Belga, maltas tostadas y frutos oscuros maduros - ciruelas pasas, pasas y trazos de cerezas. Los sabores repiten el perfil aromático y se completan con notas de madera y una gentil y azucarada calidez. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación suave. Paladar voluptuoso y sabroso. Las frutas y el agradable alcohol se entremezclan con un muy bajo amargor y permanecen el el largo final. Una de mis Trapenses favorita. Compleja y extraordinaria !!
330ml bottle. Westmalle Chalice glass. Dark brown, deep ruby tints to the light. Hazy appearance. Beige foam creates a cottony & lasting crown. Copious lacing rings on sides. Belgian yeast & toasted malts to the nose as well as dark fruits-prune, raisin & cherry hues. Flavors as expected from aroma profile completed by woody notes & kind sugary warm sensation. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Voluptuous & flavorful palate. Fruits & gentle heat mixed with a very low bitterness linger into a long finish. One of my favourite Trappists. Complex & Great !!!
A nice fruity flavor with slight yeasty notes though. Color is brown woth a white head.

Snowman cap edition. Pours into duvel glass. Medium light brown head. Dissipated quickly. Nose is much richer dried fruits but like the 6. Hints of maple syrup. Figs. Sugary. Taste is much sweeter than 6. Taste falls a little less than aroma would indicate. Definitely some alcohol boost in this one. Slightly warming. 

---Rated via intercellular device

Pours a brown, slightly cloudy. Off white head. Aromas of fig, spice. Nutty. Taste is pretty high boost sweet - real similar to a bad malt liquor. This is garbage. Finishes with a mouthful of dumpster juice and some buzzed quick. No.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2013 Bottle @ Bedford Arms, Bedford. Mid to dark brown. A tiny bit of light manages to get through... lovely dark brown sediment. Lush aroma Roast dark malt. Burnt Demerara sugar. Caramelised vanilla. Taste: less full than I would have expected but wonderful all the same. Bubbles playfully on the lips and tongue, creating a fugu-like numbness. Outstanding Trappist. Not my favourite (sorry!) but does ok against stiff competiton.
Bottle. Thanks mark. Dark almost plum like appearance. Taste is tough to describe but very smooth. Maybe dark fruit flavor? burnt sugar. Good stuff
Bottle. Deep garnet with a big off white head. Lots of fruit and bread aromas. Sweet dark fruits and grain. Really good.

Extremely complex, very long and slow sipper. I think all has been said about this beer already. From my perspective the best is how it beautifully changes in both aroma and flavor from cool to room temperatures. The last sip I always like most. The most sophisticated and I will not compare it to wine as the latter one is just boring comparing to rochefort 6. I strongly recommend this one if one is looking for something lighter than amazing rochefort 10.

Poured from a 375 mL bottle. Pours copper brown. Off-white head that lingers with nice lacing. Nose is subtle hickory and spice with notes of sweet dark malts. Flavour is sweet malt with a nice long finish well-balanced with hops with notes of caramel, vanilla, and molasses. Awesome Belgian strong ale.
Lovely beer with good complexity. Very glad to have this in Ontario finally.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle.
Pours a glowing amber with a big, foamy white head and visible carbonation. Aroma of dark fruit, caramel, yeast and spice. Mouth feel is velvety with lots of fine carbonation. Flavours of sweet grainy malt, toffee, bread, ripe berries and a little grassy hop. Warming port and dates on the palate with some bitter earthy notes. Always a favourite.

Bottle. Pours mahogany with off-white head, great retention. Malt-heavy aroma, dark fruit, grape, chocolate and toffee. Lively carbonation, sweet taste with a light bitterness at the end. Toasty, almost spicy finish. Smooth texture, full body. Overall: Enough about the beer. Im a doctor now.
A really good beer. But if you can, try the 10! It´s the difference between good and incredible.
One of my favorite beers, this Trappist brew has a very complex flavor. Hints of fruits/rasins are to be found throughou

It pours hazy mahogany coloured with copper highlights; the head is beige and foamy. The aroma has notes of: roasted hazelnuts, charcoal, oatmeal, roasted grains, brown-sugar, and raisins. The taste is medium sweet that finishes slightly drier; there are notes of: all of the notes mentioned in aroma, plus alcohol. The palate is full-bodied, slightly sticky, has low carbonation, and a long finish. Overall, its good - not 4 good.

A distinctive beer in every category. A nice dark copper appearance with a solid head. Creamy yet also a soft texture reminiscent of a wine due to its acidity. Very complex but not an overwhelming taste that features malty and nutty flavors. Concludes with a dark chocolate aftertaste. Oakiness is noticeable throughout. This beer can go for $13 a bottle at a bar but is worth every penny. It's an authentic traditional beer style worth trying, and at 9%+ it's a hefty double the average alcohol content. It goes without saying this is a beer to be savored and not swilled.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

330 ml bottle. BB 23/06/15. From bierzwerg.de.
Dark brown colour with a small dense tan head. 
Dark fruits, caramel sweetness and malt in the aroma. 
The flavour is dark fruits, caramel sweetness, raisins, malt and... pure tastiness. Very balanced brew. Complex enough. Nice. Tasty. What else? Maybe a bit intoxicating...
330ml bottle from the LCBO. Deep amber colour with a hearty, lasting head. Aroma was slightly boozy, but fragrant. Taste had hints of nut and spice. Overall very nice brew.
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2013 Hazy dark red brown appearance with medium head. Malty with dark fruit aromas. Medium sweet. Good Trappist Strong Ale style.

Bottle, 03.01.2018. Pours hazy dark reddish brown with a finger thick creamy head. Aroma is roasted malts, nuts and chocolate. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet with roasted malts, nuts and chocolate, as well as coffee and leather. Velvety, balanced and very nice.

Had much higher expectations for this beer. It pours beautifully, has lots of sediment, the aroma is very interesting, but the flavour profile is a bit "off" it lacks serious depth. There is a very strong spice to it, which I love, but the aftertaste is kind of gross, I cant quite put my finger on it. Perhaps the grossness is an acquired taste that I have yet to appreciate? Its possible, but I very much doubt it. I think the most plausible explanation is that I stumbled upon a bad bottle, so hopefully the other 2 I purchased come through better, but Brasserie des Rocs is a much better and similar beer that I would recommend over this.
Opaque brown with a frothy head. Unexpectedly fizzy. Pleasant tasting, but not extraordinary.

Pours an opaque, brown with a half finger of white head that dissipates very quickly to a cap. Small amount of sticky lacing with some carbonation and a lot of sediment. Aroma is very sweet and malty up front. A lot of dark fruits (plum and raisin) and malted barley. There is a very interesting alcohol presence. Very dry and wine like. Mouth is very complex. A lot of dark fruits-black cherry, plum, raisin. Some chocolate and butterscotch with a slight espresso note. A lot of yeast, very breadlike. The very dry wine/sherry like alcohol note is once again present, but much stronger and finishes great.

Colour: Toffee-brown with a small head.
Nose: Espresso, malted barley, wine-like fruitiness, chocolate, cereal.
Flavours: Candy sugar, coffee again, butterscotch, apricot, licorice. Slight hint of alcoholic strength. Dark chocolate.
Finish: Long, warming and sweet with an alcoholic finish.
Verdict: Extremely good Trappist, only less complex than the Rochefort 10.
Not as complex as Rochefort 10, but incredibly bursting with flavors and fruity malt sweetness. Awfully good Belgian.

Pours beautiful 1 finger tan head. Sweet aroma of plums and raisins. Taste follows nose. Soft creamy body with smooth finish. On its own this is a wonderful beer but compared to big brother 10 this beer left me wanting more.
God öl med stora bubblor och väldigt krispig. Tyvärr inte så mycket doft och smak som jag trodde! Sämre än omdömena!

Pour from 11.2 oz bottle (dated 6/17/2013). Thick off-white head, which quickly and audibly subsides into a thin layer of bubbles. Relatively subtle aroma - light breadiness, indistinct sweet malt, and a slight skunkyness. A nice medium brownish-copper color. Taste is predominantly sweet golden raisin, with a firm but balanced hop bitterness. Finish has a bit of numbing cherry lozenge character.
This is the best of the three Rocheforts. Plums and really smooth. Rated with another app.

Beautiful. It may be just my personal preference and nothing else, but I have yet to come across another Trappist or belgian in general that can beat this, excepting its superior 10. The carbo is high, even for a Trappist, but I cant get enough. Poured a nice 1.5-2 finger light tannish very tight head into a Trappist glass. I leave room for improvement mainly because the 10 takes tops, but I truly believe this is at the top of the pack for all things considered, an very hard to beat.
Lune de mes favorites depuis toujours. Dans mon top 5 certainement. A essayer et à apprécier!
Floral, citrus, bread, herbs. Mooie donkere kleur. Minder bitter dan Rochefort 6. Drinkt makkelijker en lekkerder weg.

De Rochefort 8 is een heerlijkke trappist die totaal niet zwaar aanvoelt. Het is een donkere trappist met en bronzen schijn. Het schuim is fijn bruisend en mokka kleurig. Het aroma heeft zowel iets fris als donker en doet denken aan pruimen, dadels met een vleugje amandel. Toch is het aroma ook fris en uitnodigend.
De smaak ligt ook hier in het verlengde van het aroma. Deze is aangenaam licht doch rijk genoeg om met fijne accenten het geurrijk pallet in smaak om te zetten. En subtiele gebrande mout smaak maakt het helemaal af.
Het mondgevoel is aangenaam en spontaan en vooral lichter verteerbaar dan de Rochefort 10, dewelke overigens tot 1 van mijn absolute favorieten behoort.
En waanzinnig bier dat zich in elk seizoen kan laten serveren en mogelijk een goed alternatief voor wie de Rochefort 10 te vol en zwaar vind.

Jedno z najwspanialszych piwnych doświadczeń w życiu! Potężna dawka niczym nie skrępowanego alkoholu dopełniona całą gamą przypraw, karmelu i suszonych owoców w tym czarnym jak diabeł piwie od świętych Trapistów. Aż strach pomyśleć co mogłoby się dziać w 10!

Coffeeish. No long after taste, but one of my long time favourites, when not knowing what to order, definitely better than 10.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle into a goblet.

Pours a hazy dark brown with a pillowy soft looking tan head. Absolutely world class head retention and lacing. It just never seems to go away!

Wonderful aroma of raisins, prunes, and other dark fruits. Some pipe tobacco and grape juice, cherries. There is a definite sherry note that reminds me of some single malt scotches.

Huge sherry character up front in the taste that is very scotch-like. Quickly followed by cherry and grape must. Light pipe tobacco with raisins. Woody notes with a whiff of alcohol towards the finish. Extremely light bitterness with a slightly sticky mouthfeel.

Overall, what an amazing beer. So much depth to the flavor and aroma and nothing off-putting whatsoever. So smooth to drink and a pleasure. One of the best beers I have ever had.
Chocolate, raisin, roasted malt, coffee, all of this rolled together in a delicious beer. Ive enjoyded it many times and it still manages to amaze me.

Bière de couleur ambrée, rousse. Mousse très généreuse, blanche. Nez de sucre brun, de levure. En bouche, cest sucré et le haut taux dalcool est très bien camouflé. Cest parfaitement balancé. Petit goût rôti, sucré à la fois, avec une finale chaleureuse et rafraîchissante à la fois. Recommandé! Cheers!
Sharp tangy beer. Good looking dark with large foam head. Bitter finish. Not bad Belgian.

Bottle in snifter. Lots of foamy white head which lasts a long time. Aroma is honestly not a plesant beer. Taste is belgian banana no sweetness, some other darker fruit maybe fig. Lots of booze. Champagne levels of carbonation, yet a thick creamy mouthfeel.
"the beer!!!" perfect as it was a time. beer for relaxing moments. nothing to say or correct this delicacy!

Very good beer, has the full body and sweetness typical of a Belgian strong, ester alcohols, some malt, banana, crystal and caramel malts here, Belgian candy sugar, very low aroma hopping, low bitterness as well, the 9.2 degrees of alcohol are noticeable but well hidden behind the sweetness of this beer. As a beer maker I recognize the accomplishment of making a beer this alcoholic and this smooth,

Weak odor. The taste is good. The aftertaste is left for a while and is quite okay. Severe beer to judge but I would probably be able to take such a beer again. Perfectly okay then. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours dark brown with a beige head. Dried fruits on the nose, raisins. Aroma likewise, sweet malts, some bread. Hints of alcohol. Good!

Bottle at home in London. Dipping into the cellar this evening. I reckon I picked this bottle up somewhere in Belgium. Aged between one to two years, most likely. Pours deep, red-brown with a large, lively beige head that quickly calms down into a more compact crown. The nose gives off all kinds of ripe and lightly dried berries, some bready semi-dark malts, grapes, cherries, plums. Medium to big sweet flavor with tons more ripe, semi-dark fruits, lots of plums, berries, prunes, grapes, hints of alcohol, lightly toasted bread, very mild cocoa. Medium to full bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Sweet finish with decent boozy warmth, plenty more ripe, semi-dark fruits, dark sugars, overripe plums, subtle figs, grapes, raisins, fruitcake, bread, light vanilla. Very drinkable stuff. I think it could even improve with another year or two in the cellar. Wonderful.
A very traditional Trappist in all ways. Well done, but didnt grab my attention as much as the 10. It lacked slightly in aroma and taste for the style, but still quite good.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2013 Tap pour at Sauce. BaBoom -- this one clocks a punch. Not so detectable on the nose or tongue but that booze is in there & will sneak up on you like family get together you forgot about. Well balanced & tasty for such a high octane brew.

aroma from caramel, port. dark amber cloudy with creamy head. taste: yeasty, hops, round but still nice dry bitterness. complex: with every sip another flavour; caramel, brown sugar, cherry, roasted chicory. Looking forward to the rochefort 10.

11.2 fl oz / 330ml bottle into a trappist glass. Served cold.

Aroma: Pretty mild. Hints of caramel sweetness. Gentle yeast.

Appearance: Near opaque dark brown and hazy amber body with a large, creamy tan head.

Taste: Yeasty and very sweet. Lots of caramel. Like fresh pastries or danishes. Really tasty stuff.

Palate: Full body, incredibly rich. Long, sweet finish, and a nice warmer.

Overall: Quite a nice beer. I think I prefer 10 over 8, but just because I like how 10 smells more than 8. Theyre pretty even though.

330ml bottle. Pours a brownish red with the customary giant head. Aroma is quite similar to like malt loaf. Very bready with dried fruit. Hint of red wine too. Chewy, malty taste with more hints of currants, grape and orange peel. Perfectly fine, but missing the wonderful complexity of the 10.

Aroma exquisito. Malta intensa, caramelo suave que impregna todo el olfato. Notas dulces y a la vez delicadas, en virtud del azúcar agregado en botella para obligar una fermentación adicional y su mejora con el tiempo a través de la guarda.

Sedimentación propia del estilo, color café obscuro y profundo, turbiedad importante. Cuerpo redondo, carbonatación prácticamente nula. Corona de espuma media de corta duración.

Suave, ligeramente picante, dulce y con ciertas notas a levadura.

Al paladar es una cerveza compleja, aun que no tanto como su hermana mayor Rochefort 10. Es suave y sedosa. Se percibe cierto picor en boca por su contenido alcohólico. Tiene un buen equilibrio entre el característico dulzor y cierto amargor y sabor a levadura que deja una sensación particular. El final es largo y las notas que perciben en boca son ligeramente acidas por la levadura y no tan caramelizadas o dulces como suelen ser las cervezas de este estilo.

En general es una cerveza arriba del promedio. Bastante agradable y deliciosa. Ideal para degustar en un momento de soledad y de meditación. Sin embargo ciertamente un peldaño abajo de las mejores cervezas que he probado.
Aun así cien por ciento recomendable.
Bottle. Pours hazy brownish orange colour, huge foamy head. Aroma of red berries, malty, chocolate, hints of alcohol. Taste of fruit, hops, caramel.

Pours caramel and hazy with negligible head. Aroma is caramel and yeast. Flavor is very smooth with hints of malt and subtle dark fruits. For a 9.2% beer there is virtually no presence of alcohol in the flavor.

Bottle. Hazy hazelnut brown with a huge frothy off white head. Dark dried fruits, rum soaked raisins, figs, prunes, fruity hops, cocoa. Taste is medium sweet and bitter. Full body, oily texture, medium carbonation.
full body beer. aroma of port, chocolate. taste of hops en yeast. verry dry aftertaste, quit complex beer

Deep in color with a thick head. I always hear the 8 vs the 10 story but I think this stands on its own easy. Wonderful nutty roasted taste. Aroma is earthy and roasty. You can see, smell and taste the attention to detail .
Pours a color like liquid brown sugar. Slight gauze aroma followed by funky cheese. Crisp taste of creamy cheese and a spicy fruity aftertaste. Overall, not as great as expected but very drinkable.

Bottle - Dark fruity sweetness, raisins and molasses. Clear dark mahogany with a rich velvety brown head. Sweet dark fruit, sugary malt and a bit of booze that dissipates quickly. Wonderfully rich and complex, an absolute winner.

From 330ml-Maroon, brown pour with a large, tan, frothy head. Similar aroma to 6 with raisin, prune, fig and yeast. Great medium-full body with dark fruit sweetness and slight acohol at the end. Carbonation is high and it all blends together very nicely.
33cl bottle. cloudy brown with medium head. fruity alcoholic aroma. taste likewise. balanced and one of the best belgian ales money can buy.

Dark, cloudy brown... Fruits, sweet, dark fruits... Dry, fruity, malt - strong alcohol taste, slight sour... highly carbonated, thin... disappointing, could be so much nicer. Too thin and fizzy, and rather dry. Having said that it is still very good, a very respectable.

Smells very interesting, light sweetness, slight tartness, light maltiness and some dark fruit. Very hazy dark brown with tons of carbonation streaming on the side and a thick long lasting head. Beautiful. Taste reflects its nose, showing caramel and toffee, a great dryness and a medium body. Although the complexity is slightly muted here, this tastes delicious and is almost refreshing. A bit of alcohol showing through also prevents this from being amazing. Many of the belgian qualities that I like and none that I dont. Very good.
roasted and citrus aromas, appear clear brown with a frothy head. taste sweet, a heavy palate with light carbonation
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2016 Mooi robijnrood bier, in de geur caramel en rijpe mango. smaak met gebrande mout, walnoot en amandel alcohol en suiker Is wel iets te veel aanwezig. Biertje om rustig te drinken.

The aroma is fairly subtle with hints of caramel malts and sour fruit, and the appearance features an opaque dark brown color with a large foamy white head with great retention. The taste is mildly sour, mildly sweet, and a touch umami, and the palate nicely rounded out the flavors with its boozy finish, medium body, lively carbonation, and slick texture.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a mostly opaque dark brown with a lot of foamy fine off-white head, and a bit of visible carbonation. Smell is lots of dark fruit, plums, raisins, some caramel sweetness, and a bit of doughy yeast smell, could stand to be just a bit more intense though. Palate is on the heavier side of medium bodied with maybe a bit too much carbonation. Taste is real nice, some earthy sweetness with a bit of bitterness coming in and out, and a bit of alcohol heat in the aftertaste, though much like the smell could stand to be a bit more intense. Really nice beer, but the 10 is better in every possible way.

11.2oz served in an Orval Chalice.

A - Pours a dark reddish brown with an active off-white head.

S - Bready malts, alcohol soaked dates, very spicy, sweet malts, dark candy sugar.

T - Spicy fruit upfront, dried dates and red figs, nutty, deep caramel malts, dark candy sugar, alcohol seems to stimulate the tongue with a tingling sensation. The finish is dry, earthy, and woody.

M - Aggressive carbonation creates a very airy feel, after the beer sits the carbonation mellows out and becomes more creamy but its still on the thin side.

Not your typical Dubbel here. Lots of earthy mysterious flavors in this one. Drinks way better with the yeast sediment poured in. The thin component threw me off a bit.

Serving type: bottle

10-07-2012

330mL Bottle 9.25%. Have had this once before, but revisited as I lost tasting notes from my beer market trips in Toronto. Dark brown pour with a bubbly tan head, decent retention.heavy on carbonation Aroma is quite fruity. Full bodied. Creamy, buttery mouthfeel. Taste is ripe blueberry, black currant, raisin, toffee, spiciness. Extremely smooth finish and a lingering taste of sweet malt. Superb.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2014 Pours a hazy, dark caramel colour with thin, cream head that quickly thins. Smells slightly of ripe fruit and spice. Taste is of spice, with alcohol undertones. Had a slightly thicker texture but with good carbonation.  A complex beer for sure. Great beer!

Appearance: Chestnut brown/red. Initial billowing ivory head which quickly reduced down to a thin bubble layer.
Aroma: Fruit cake, vinous, banana, bubblegum, hint of pepper, citric tang and plaster.
Taste: Medium sweetness, low bitterness, slight maltyness and alcohol.
Palate: Light body, smooth texture, slightly prickly carbonation, a quick finish but lingering alcohol warmth on tongue.
Comments: Wonderful beer. Served in snifter and left a lace.

The head was pretty foamy no matter how I tried to pour it, but died down fast. Its pretty sweet, malty, and despite the high alcohol there is no harshness to this at all, you could drink the stuff all day. It didnt have any crazy weird funky flavors like other Belgian ales. I think pretty much anyone would enjoy this beer. I picked it up because its near the top on every beer rating list Ive ever seen, and it didnt disappoint.

Rating: 3/5 = World Class:  Deep red color liquid, perhaps brown.  Head is 2.5 fingers with a light pour straight down the middle. Super tight bubbles  Gorgeous lacing and alcohol legs.  Head is between a strawberry blonde and a light brown.  Tons of fig characters as well as plum/prune and malt on the nose initially.  Also notes of dark brown sugar.  Moderate alcohol also on the nose, but nicely complemented by the other aromas.  

Instantly hit with a creaminess sensation on the first sip with some carbonation which quickly dissipates revealing a a wonderful characteristic of fig, malt, and turbinado sugar.  Mid sip contains notes of plum and a nice warming which lingers into the finish and lasts nicely before the next sip where the carbonation cleanses the palate.  Finish continues with tastes of dark fruit with a sensation of port wine barrel.  Wouldja - Yes
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 Roodbruine kleur met een volle crème kraag. Ruikt herfstfruit iets caramel, kruiden, beetje zoetig. Smaakt zoetig, kruiden, caramel.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Bottle, gift from Andrew. Mahogany body with a medium beige head. Light lacing. Aroma of port, vanilla, milky coffee, leather, raisins and yeast. Flavour of fig, stewed apple, spices, coffee and milk chocolate. Sweet but with a slightly bitter, spicy finish. Medium body with a foamy mouthfeel. Fizzy carbonation. A classy beer, but lacks the depth and length of the Rochefort 10.
330ml bottle. supreme amounts of head and pours a caramel colour. aroma is of yeast, coffee and malts. tastes great. full mouth feel, not at all oily. after taste is slightly bitter.

This is beautiful. Unique, balanced, complex, and yet somehow completely easy on the senses. The aroma is wonderful, very natural and appealing. The head is VERY foamy and disappears in seconds, I quite like that. What you get on the taste is an unmatched combination of dried, dark fruits, yeast and a mildly sour tinge on the finish. Its remarkably uncomplicated and yet perfectly balanced and brewed - theres nothing quite like this, except 10 of course, but I prefer 8.
Smells like fresh hops - floral. Opaque brown almost black. Sweet dark malt taste with toffee tones and a touch of cinnamon-like spices. Full body and fizzy. Alcohol boosts the taste.

Bottle from drink shop Tallinn. Dark brown with tall light brown head. Unfiltered yeasty. 
Sweat some roasted malty aroma. Round Chocolate taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Eigenlijk overdag drinken om in het volle licht de mooie kleur te zien. Nu (s avonds) moeilijk te zien , tegen een peertje gehouden. Roodbruin donker van kleur. Schuimkraag verdwijnt langzaam. Hele hele fijne bubbeltjes nog wel koolzuur aanwezig. Misschien is overdag nuttigen sowieso een goed idee. Je hebt er een stevige boterham aan. Je weet wel zo een met roomboter en belegd met ontbijtkoek. Stevig aangestampt met krentjes en een hele zachte borrel ernaast. Misschien wat voor vaderdag..Ik slaap er altijd lekker op. Behalve de alcohol (weinig merkbaar - in de avond) hebben de brouwers er misschien stiekem kruiden toegevoegd , valeriaan bijvoorbeeld. Standaard in huis hebben en koesteren dit heerlijke bier. Chapeau

Riktigt fin, karamell, krämig ett uns lakrits tycker jag mig känna och ett riktigt bett.......................................

- via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Café Viking. Too cold from the fridge so had to warm it for 10 min. After that, the dried fruits aroma appeared, caramel, round and spicy yeast. Light brown with white/beige head. Taste of dried fruits, alcohol, sweet. Medium body with lively carbonation. alcohol in the finish. An excellent classic!

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2014 Re-rate 2014-03-21 BBE 27.3.2018
Colour is deep dark orange all the way to dark brown with a nice big blonde head leaving lacing. Aromas and flavors are sweet toffee, anise, pear kind of Belgian yeast and raisiny dark fruits. Mouthfeel is thicker than medium with a heavy carbonation. Finish is long with a fair amount of bitterness, pepper, raisin and anise. Has a feel of alcohol but not the taste. Not quite complex. The bottle has aged for a year. The anise is much stronger than the last time, I dont like it. 
Original Rating from 2013
Colour is reddish brown with some nice foamy head and lively carbonation. There is lots of sweetness and dark fruits typical to a dark Trappist beer and also a fair amount of hopping in the finish. Is a bit lighter and less complex than the Rochefort 10. 7+4+8+4+15=38

Brune foncée, pétillance fine et abondante, mousse fine et crémeuse. Nez fruité et caramélisé, tout comme le goût avec des notes rôties. Petite sécheresse en fin de bouche. Alcool plus présent que chez sa grande sur, la 10.

great beer. one of my best. i dronk after st bernardus 8, and this beer is much better, for long. 
aroma: caramel. little alcohol but so nice, some ester.
flavor: similar to alcohol. grear, so integred
feel: impecable
overalla: una de las mejores cervezas q probe. quiza sea pq la botella tenia unos 8 meses. muy repetible

Nice aroma of spice, roasted caramel, candies, and faint alcohol.  Beautiful dark amber color with rich tan head.   Rich caramel malt, spicy fruit, smokey toffee, and a nice alcohol burn on the finish.  Smooth and lives up to reputation

That this is my favourite beer that I have tasted is honestly probably a combination of when I drank it the first time and the wonderful smell and taste of it. 

What I think makes this the best for me is the combination of freshness and dark flavours.

Bottle from Voldby Koebmandsgaard. Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Sweet roasted malts, slight chocolate, some toffee, dark fruits, nutty, icing sugar, nice mouthfeel just like the 10. Sweet finish with a touch of alcohol. Very good beer.
Very nice palate, raisins, plums, sweet. Nice alcohol balance. Better tasting than rochefort 6. Definitely worth a try.

Light bodied and dry, but quite flavorful.  Has a really nice spice, citrus, bubblegum, and slight yellow raisin flavor.

Brady aroma pours a dark cloudy brown. A sweet and bitter taste with hints cherry. An oily sweetness palate

This is my favourite Trappist. Sweet and slightly carbonated with a surprising bloom of flavour on the palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I am lucky. I live in Slovakia and this absolutely perfect beer is commonly available here in Bratislava, capital city of Slovakia, in a Belgian beer specialty store. Of course, among other Belgian beer delicacies. I bought two bottles today, one for me and one for my wife. Overall, this beer is absolutely amazing!

330 ml bottle @ home,May 20,2013
Beer from "Vinmonopolet Oslo City"
Beer from a tulip glass
Brown in color with a creamy white head
Medium carbonation
Aroma is caramel,dark fruits,malt,yeast and alcohol
A bit sweet and a a touch of alcohol in my mouth.
A nice Trappiste beer in my opinion.

Bottle, 330 ml at home. Poured into a trappist glass. ABV 9.2%
Amber caramel brown colour on the body, almost two fingers of off-white soapy head, with good retention. Continuous activity in the glass.
Light fruity aroma, caramel, some hints of the alcohol.
Taste is sweet, but not that much. Lots of ripe fruits in there. The alcohol very well hidden and only traceable as a warm feeling on the body. It gets much more flavourful once it starts to warm up a bit, for example now I am getting a vanilla flavour.
Medium thickness on the body, good amount of carbonation.
Very good beer.
Fantastic aroma of caramel, café latte, hops, cola, and fresh fruit. Sweet taste of caramelized pears, maple syrup and jelly cola candy. Acidity in the palate, especially in the aftertaste.

Caramel, chocolate, grass, earthy, woody, red, brown, hazy, rocky head, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter
Like 6, pours a frothy tan head (had to be quick as the bottle surged as soon as the cap popped).  More of a dark reddish amber. Initial aroma surprisingly mild - subtle dark caramel with a bit of grass/wood. Poured into goblet and with warming, cocoa, and earthy aromas arise. Maybe some hints of dark fruit as well. Alcohol rises up as well. Carbonation falls quickly leaving a nice lacing.  Taste is mildly sweet with some raisin and dark chocolate. Sourness noted with slight astringency. Bitterness is lingering and is light as well. Definitely more alcohol heat than in the 6. Mouthfeel is creamy and creaminess lingers in the finish.  Personally, I preferred the Rochefort 6 (my rating below). 

caramel,alcohol, resin, earthy, bubblegum, amber, hazy, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, lively, bitter Pour is a dark amber with tall tan foam. Head of tightly packed tiny bubbles falls quickly. Aromas released are intense at beginning - dark sweet raisins or dates along with earthy bubble gum and resin. Alcohol is felt in the nose. Taste is slightly sweet with a bit of dark cocoa and again a reminder of dark fruit. Alcohol heat with each sip noted. Mouthfeel is quite thin with an oily feel remaining. A lightly bitter and boozy (pleasant like dark rum) aftertaste remains on between sips. A nice dubbel at a decent price. Will get again, but will also want to try their 8 and 10 versions.

Color rubí oscuro. Espuma marfil. Aromas principalmente dulces con tonos de caramelo, azúcar tostado,  pasas y ligera acidez afrutada. En boca, con una densidad media, presenta esas mismas cualidades con final ligeramente ácido. Sus alta graduación pasa totalmente desapercibida. Muy rica.

Dark brown, full bodied with a nice creamy head. Roasted caramel and ripe, stewed fruits in the nose. A light acidity makes a perfect balance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very good beer with character, fruity and spicy, with a dry finish. For me it was a great discovery.

beige, big, creamy, good retention. Colour: dark red, clear. 

Aroma: flowers, dried fruit, wine, some alcohol. Taste: some fruit, very bitter, some alcohol?

Bottle from Voldby Koebmandsgaard, DK - fuzzy brown with a beige head. Sweet roasted malts, slight chocolate, some toffee, dark dried fruits, nutty, icing sugar, lovely mouthfeel just like the 10. Beautiful.
Great aroma with deep chocolate and caramel. Smooth and refined. Great with a fine steak.

Belgian yeast, overripe plums, and sweet raisins dominate. Some of the bread and spice in the nose comes through in the finish. Carbonation is strong, but not overly sharp. Alcohol definitely comes through in the flavor. Delicious.

Bottle from cotteridge wines. Reddish brown ale with small head. Aroma of caramel, malts and dark fruits. Taste is malts, dark fruits, sweet dark toffee and an alcohol kick. Medium carbonation that bounces the flavours around, medium bodied. This is world class, the best beer I have tasted so far. Wow.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Aroma :  Plums, yeast  Appearance: Much carbonation, brown red, cloudy  Taste: Fizzy, light bitterness, raisins

Slightly darker and just as inviting as the 6, with a beautiful head and flaky yeast bits. All sorts of sweet dark fruits entering the nose; plums and blackcurrant. Taste is complex and heavy and slightly sweeter than the 6. Some alcohol noticeable and finishes with a less subtle bitterness than the 6, which made the beer a bit less impeccably balanced.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 Svår att ratea. Spritsig och mycket kolsyra. Bubblar fett i munnen. Både gillar och känner viss avsmak. Svårt att bestämma mig här.

Rerate: känner precis samma sak nu. Sjukt livligt skum. lagrad ca 2 år. Svag nyans av något jag får lätt avsmak av. Tjock, nästan lite Orvalsk jobbigt. Bortser man från det så finns det härliga belgiska dubbeldrag.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy brown color with big off white head. Brown sugar, malty, dark fruit aromas. Sweet, brown sugar, belgian yeast flavors. Not quite Rochefort 10, but damn good.

Dufter ikke af så meget, nøddebrun, lys tæt skum, maltet, let syrlig, let bitter eftersmag. Ikke min type med udemærket
