Poured from bottle. Plum colored with a light bubbly foam. Smells of sugar and raisins. Tastes of sugarplum and raisin with alcohol in the background. Awesome beer.
Koyu kahve.. Komplex, 10dan daha iyi ilk icim gazlı, sonra acilik, bitiris meyveli. Koku koyu meyveler ve topraksi...

medium dark murky brown, small to medium head in trappist glass. Smells..cooked dark fruits..plums, raisins, roasty sugars, candy, caramel and malts. Tastes..cooked dark fruit, sweet candy sugars, malt and a little alcohol in the finish. so good.
Bottle. Nice colour. Malts aroma. Fizzy. Complex taste, caramel, raisins, bit of chocolate. Nice beer
270413. Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with a nice head. Aroma licorice, Belgian yeast. The house taste is just awesome. Medium full bodied. Not Bad.
Pours dark ruby red with off white creamy head. In the nose I get sweetness, dark fruits, raisins. Taste is sweet, malty, bread. The alcohol is well hidden and gives a nice warmth. Very nice.

Pours deep ruby color. The smell is yeasty, sweat and fruity. Pancakes? Complex taste of fruit, chocolate, raisins. Well-masked alcohol. Close to the 10, but not as good. Pay the extra $1 and buy the $10

Cerveza tostada de color marrón oscuro. Espuma volátil que queda en una fina cremita em la superficie. Olor cítrico, floral, a azahar. Sabor muy complejo, potente y especiado. Gran cuerpp y gas vivo en la boca. Mejor no muy fría.

Pours a hazy amber with a small off White head. Nose is roast chestnut, stewed fruit and warm woody notes. Taste is round and smooth with an earthy character. Caramel, honeysuckle are balanced by a pleasant bitterness.

Bottle at Monks. Rochefort goblet. Disappeared for a while. Glad it is back. Cloudy brown pour with a huge frothy tan head. A pleasant step between the 6 and 10. Full but less syrupy than the 10 so this may be the best of the three. Rochefort is a bit different from the other Trappists in that instead of dubbels/trippels, etc. - the variation in steps appears to be intensity and not style. Such that the 8 feels just as a balanced style and not a dubbel. Rich caramel with dark fruits. Wonderful.

330ml bottle from Drinkswell, Ripon. Brown-golden colour, foamy tan head that dissipates away and aroma of malt, fruity orange & some peach. Taste is sweetish caramel malt, spice, dried fruit, raisins with lingering alcohol & light bitterness. Slick smooth rounded mouth feel, medium bodied, high carbonation. Well balanced, very drinkable.

0,33 l bottle BB 22. Nov 2017  
alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, woody, caramel, roasty, floral, spruce, herbs, chocolate, earthy, brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

Serious beer. Chocolate, smoke, autumn leaves, cigarres. A beer to chew on!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Again a superb achievement from Rochefort! Strong aroma leads with convincing strength and balance with the taste. Appearance is clear and stylish with dark red/copper tones. Taste is well balanced and clear. Alcohol comes trough a bit but it doesnt damp other flavors like fruits, figs and syrup. Some sourness. As in other Rochefort products, this also is a bit too sterile: there is no basement aromas or other so organic flavors. Palate is somewhat perfect with a right amount of carbonation.

I dont think the fruits are that fresh on the basket. Perhaps decayed, perhaps dried, but the aroma is strongly sweet and sour. I love the sensation of the old barn, the cellar, dusty and mouldy. The earthy colour is not too attractive, but it does come across as very BIO and the head is not too persistent. Flavours are sour and fruity, within oak barrels, with some forest fruit honey, allspice and great Belgian chocolate. Alcoholic, no doubt about it and it is not well hidden, but never on your face. The palate is slick, vinous and the satisfaction is absurdly great.
Excellent beer, quite limited aroma but am fantastic taste and palate. Perhaps better in smaller doses though.

Can you think pancakes with maple syrup? Yeasty candied sugar with all sorts of dark fruit raisins, figs, prunes. Big Vermont maple syrup. liqueur. Woody cork. Dusty yeast. Bready. Beer for billionaires. Ooh so good!

Hazy golden orange with a large top that dissipates in a few. Aroma is raisins and peach, sweeter then taste, but although on the tongue it is similarly slight honey raisins it is a bit dissapointing. The alcohol is not overly powerful, but the taste itself is too subtle (background) and a bit watery. I wanted to like this a bit more. The 10 is definitely more comprehensive.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Pours a amber color beer with a big white frothy head. It was hard to define aroma. It smelled watery. The tast is medium sweet. Something I don't always like but it fits just fine in this beer. Complex taste. Really astringent. It has a lively carbo. Medium body and a sticky and dry texture. Good one.

Mellow aroma of alcohol, caramel, some raisins/fruit.  Appealing amber colour with a long-lasting white head.

Taste similar to aroma but surprisingly thin, though well balanced.  Feels like something is missing for 9.2% alcohol.
Aroma is sweet caramel, dried fruit, spices, licorice. Taste is very crisp caramel, very smooth once it has been warmed up
July 2010. From a 12 oz. bottle. Pours redbrown with a nice tan head. Spice, dark fruits and brown sugar notes are very present. A bit of alcohol burn, but absolutely a masterpiece of a beer.
Nice aromas of Fruit, both dark and light. grapes, white wine. Flavors of mild fruit, oranges, candi sugar, lemon and lime, zesty finish. perfect mouthfeel.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2013 (Re-rated) 
Bottle from Systembolaget, 4 month old. Pours hazy brown with a huge off-white head which dissolves very slowly. Aroma is sweet caramel, dried fruit, spices, licorice. Taste is very crisp caramel (croquante) that increases, round bitterness, very smooth once it has been warmed up and the initial amount of carbonation has decreased.

First rating
(8-3-8-4-16=3,9)
Warm creamy with a nice round aftertaste. Delicious mouth feel. The Trappists in Rochefort know what theyre doing. Delicious.
Wonderful brew a taste of the best in the world. notes of dark fruit fantastic.
Has a little more alcohol taste than 10 to me. Is an enjoyable drink.  Would lie to try it with some age on it.

Smak och doft av torkad frukt, russin, madeira. Lagom söt, fruktig och alkoholen kommer till sin rätt för att ta fram alla smaker. Lätt beska. Flaskan har 3-4 år på nacken vilket kanske gjorde sitt till. Gott.

Flaska från SB. Vintage från 2009. Bärnstensfärgad, lågt skum, en del jästpartiklar och några klumpar. Fantastisk doft av torkad frukt, russin och madeira. Söt fruktig smak men stramare efter en stund i munnen. Lite vass kolsyra och alkoholvärme skapare tillsammans med jästen och den lilla beskan en bra balans. Ganska färdiglagrad och fantastisk god.
UPDATED: JUN 3, 2017 330ml bottle. Yellowbrown cloudy body with a hint of red. Large white crown. Notes of roasted malt, dates, spices and orange. Heavily carbonated.
Cloudy ruby red color with heavy collar. Hoppy smell. Slight sweet creamy taste with strong after-taste.

Pours a translucent, dark cider-amber color with a big, foamy, long-lasting light tan head. Bubbles migrate from the bottom, perpetually feeding the immortal head. Mild spiciness on the nose. A little metal soup can, date and brown sugar aromas as well. Mouthfeel is such that the beer slides. Just enough of a carbonation burn gradually appears to balance the slickness of the beer. Mild tartness in the beginning. Brown sugar appears just before the finish. A lot of balance in the beers flavors and mouthfeel. A very good Belgian by comparison. No alcohol warmth at all.
This beer definatly has to be stored 6 - 12 months to be at its best. In contrast to the RF10 and RF6 which are drinkable at 2 - 4 months or even at 2 or less months.
UPDATED: MAY 31, 2013 Everything just right (aroma, color, complex sweet smooth bitter taste, right alcohol & viscosity), except a bit overly carbonated
Very carbonated.  The head is huge kinda fizzy like a coke.  Tastes of Raisin, Plum, Caramel, Roasted Malt.  There is no mistaking that this is 9%, but the alcohol taste isnt overpowering.
June 2012 highly carbonated, slightly sour, not as strongly or as interestingly flavoured as some, but still a good beer in its own right.

Bottle pours a hazy brown with a retentive tan head, good lacing. Sweet, thick aroma. Tastes of sweet Belgian yeast, toasted caramel malts, a bit of butterscotch on the finish. Perfectly carbonated, smooth even at 9.2% ABV.
bottle. Light hazy brown with one finger head. Big carbonation, a bit too much. Awesome flavor, fruity and sweet. Complex and interesting.
Lots of caramel flavour. Great look, smell and taste. Smooth texture goes down easy!

Its a toss up over which I prefer, the 10 or the 8, a couple of bottles of 8 makes for a perfect evening in. Pours cloudy and dark with a rich aroma of molasses balanced by a roasted hoppy scent. Really tasty. Moreish i the extreme,  Iomly buy two at time as if I bought more Id just keep knocking them back.  A truely great Belgian dark ale.
Masse sødme masse karbonering. Dyp mørk farve og masse skum som gradvis forsvinner. God ettersmak av frukt.
Null lukt.  Ikke den store smaksfølelsen.  Mye kullsyre.  Frister ikke til å prøve igjen.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur brune et voilée. Nez malté de caramel toffee légèrement rôti et terreux, de fruits (prunes, raisin aux notes vineuses, léger de cerises noires et de figues), moyen dépices (poivre, léger de clou de girofle) avec des notes dalcool, de sucre brun et de houblon herbeux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût assez fruité (prunes, raisins,léger de figues, notes de cerises) et épicées (poivre, léger de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de sucre brun, léger de caramel toffee avec des notes de mélasse terreuse et aux petites notes rôties rôti. Parallèlement, lon retrouve un léger goût dalcool réchauffant avec une légère amertume de houblon herbeux qui sinstalle progressivement en finale avec quelques notes de chocolat. Post-goût long et aux petites notes sèches, composé dun goût de levures fruitées avec une légère amertume dalcool et de houblon herbeux  avec des traces rôties. (2006)
I think I prefer Trappistes 8 to Trappistes 10, but its a toss up. Definitely worth trying if you havent yet.

11.2 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured a cloudy brown with a decent off white head. Aroma of dried fruits, raisins and malts. Taste quite consistent sweet malts, fruits, caramel and some alcohol wit a little (and nice) bitterness to it. Very complex, all I can say is that when you know what you are doing it shows; very nice beer.
Bottle.  Pours a cloudy medium amber with a huge, dense off-white head.  Aroma and flavor is malt, dark fruit, soy sauce, richly yeasty.  Almost salty.  Quite complex.
Bought at Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Pours a dark caramel-color body with a thin-thin head. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel and resins. Quite carbonated, but very tasty!
I actually like this one better than the 10 for some reason.  Awesome complexity that I think is more pronounced with the lower gravity.

Pours an average rocky off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is red brown and sparkling. Aroma contains forest fruits, caramel, cookie, dough, alcohol, raisin, grape, plum, cassis, spices, cola, lemon and orange.
Flavor starts off light acidic and a bit bitter, to go to sweet and to finish sweet and light bitter. Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation. Complex, subtle, very good, just a bit less then Rochefort 10.
Brown, thin layer of foam. Good balanced beer. Aroma of chocolat and caramel with herbs and spices. Sweet and bitter aftertaste.

Bottle 0.33 L.
Dark brown body with a large, creamy, tan head, fully lasting with a good lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (caramel, bread) aroma with moderate notes of fruits (prunes, raisins, cherries) and licorice; alcohol-related spicey notes are also evident. 
Moderate bitter flavour with a light-to-moderate sweet character; the finish is bitter and somehow dry.
Medium body with an creamy; soft carbonation; some alcoholic warming in the finish.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2013 0,33 Bottle. Hazy brown pour, big off white head, Aroma is grape, fig, licorice, chocolate, fruity esters. Taste is great: grape drink, licorice, light chocolate, molasses, lightly tart yeast. Palate is bone dry, soft, slick, dry grape finish. Drinks like a 5% beer. Awesome.
Usually I got for the 10, but this one is a lot more smooth and the alcohol does not come through as much. This is truly a benchmark beer. Well balanced and smooth. Top rated beer.

These are personal notes - Im new to this and not familiar with the style. I rolled this beer before tasColor is a rich chocolate brown with a fair amount of cloudiness, quick to a large short-lived head. . Flavor is what really packs a punch, as you would expect from its appearance. This bottle has an overpowering medicinal taste as it first hits the mouth - too much so for me (I know this is a characteristic of this style). Later the mouth is left with a rich taste and clean palate.

Bottle (notes from tasting session. Aromas of pears, candi sugar, spice, perfume. Very aromatic. Little discoveries to be made with each approach.
Wondefully balanced sweet flavors. Also, some Coke and root beer, too. Overall, sweetness is the main characteristic. Very little tail

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dirty brown with a frith head that settles to a thin vail over the surface. Its not a looker, more like dirty laundry water. The aroma is of burnt sugars and some nougat. The taste is predominantly sweet, brown sugar, mint, nice. Not much hoppy bitterness to divert the sweetness, but its not really needed. The yeast of Rochefort is part of the spectre too. The bubblyness of the beer fills up mouth giving it a more full mouthfeel than it really has and as the bubbles fade away you can feel a more thin beer. It is lovely, though. Excellent.

330ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. Liquor, grapy and caramel aromas. Pours light brown, hazy, with nice tan head, vanishing, good lacing. Medium body, average carbonation, slightly crispy texture. Taste is some sweet, nuts, floral, caramel, with some bitter notes. Well balanced and enjoyable.
Grass, grass, grass, grass, grass, grass, coffee, coffee, coffee, coffee, coffee, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel, caramel

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2013 Una delle migliori birre mai bevute. Aroma di malto e caramello. Schiuma abbondante. Sapore di malto. Corposa, aromatica, complessa, una birra da. Retrogusto intenso tendente all?amarognolo, sicuramente piacevole. Carbonazione media ma perfetta. Birra estremamente equilibrata e armoniosa non dimostra al palato i suoi gradi. Forse prefetita alla 10. Ottima.

Got my man pants on tonight so this is what Im drinking. Pours a deep reddish brown with a HUGE, billowing head that slowly dissipates. Aromas of berries and yeast. Flavor is down right damn delicious. Up front you get hit with some dark fruity sweetness and faint hints of chocolate with uber carbonation fizzling all the way down to a nice, dry finish. Belly is getting warmed up from this one, me likey. I wish I could live at Brasserie Rochefort, and enjoy this and the 10 all the time.
One of the best beer there is in Belgium. absolute top quality belgian style

Bouteille 330ml. Couleur acajou foncé, mousse beige abondante laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme fruité, sucre dorge, pain aux bananes, girofle?, alcool, chocolat léger. Goût de caramel, alcool, malt, épices. Carbonation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen dense.

Bronze color, small off-white head. Fruity aroma. Figs, plums, raisins. Also caramel and spicy notes. Alcohol isnt hidden that well at all. Some nice bitterness in the aftertaste. Its not that smooth since theres too much carbonation.
The only thing better than this one is the 10. But that is my opinion. The profile in this one seems complex but very tasty.

10 is awesome... this is a distant cousin in my book.  It comes through with a banana flavor, sweet banana bread flavor.  Aroma is nicer... just a hint of banana.  Wow I was very disappointed in this one. Way way way over carbonated.
330 ml bottle. Pours hazy brown with white head. Aroma of caramel, apple, dark fruits and sugar. Taste caramel sweet and little bitter. Very nice

0,33 l bottle shared with friends. Hazy deep hazelnut colored body with a large fluffy beige head. Candy, rock sugar, figs marmelade on the nose. Wonderfully complex. Sweet flavor, toasted notes, figs, alco warm, full bodied. Rich carbonation. Smooth. Fantastic lasting malty finish.
Tasted separately from the 10 and I did like this the most. The alcohol is well disguised and the beer is lively, with a good carbonation. A treat for the senses.

~Sweet slightly sour raisin and prune aroma with bread
~Pours brownish amber color with small disappearing off white head.
~Raisin and prune like bready flavor, slight sourness.
~Medium full bodied with high CO2, soft bubbles. Sweet lasting bready finish.
~Enjoyable.  I think that the 6 is my favorite of the series.

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 2017. Pours light brown in color with foamy off-
white head. Ripe, darker fruits such as plums and dadels in aroma, 
just that lovely dark fruityness and hints of yeasty spicyness mixed 
with some light bready malts in aroma. Quite dry and nutty in taste 
at first, a bit of that dark fruit sweetness is present but it 
doesnt feel that overwhelming. The dry nuttyness was a bit 
unexpected as it stayed there through out the whole time. Liked the 
aroma a lot, but the taste didnt really meet up with the 
expectations as it seemed to lack a bit of that complexity that 
usually can be found in this type of beer. Just a bit of brown sugar 
and a bit of mild peppery spices are there in finish.

The inital aroma is very clean; however, I didnt feel that the color quite complemented its aroma.  The taste is great considering its alcohol volume.  Overall, I thought it was a great beer and Id definately drink a six pack down!

Looks beautiful - a clear reddish brown, minimal head; aroma of yeast and fresh fruits: apples and oranges; full deep citrus flavour - burnt orange and ripe raisins, sweet, soft toasty malts; a spicy edge and a little salty too; well carbonated; good, complex and very orangey; Ive searched hard for the chocolate character that everyone is banging on about, but found none!; good, but not a patch on the 10.

2013/01/14 - Pours a typical Trappist hazy brown/orange. Good off white head that disappears but leaves a thin lacing. Smells of dark fruits, yeast and vanilla. Taste of dark fruits, yeast, toffee. Creamy texture with nice carbonation and a boozy, warming finish. Must taste with the 10 to decide which is better.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, from Hogsback store, at JFs Calcutta Cup mini tasting - 02/02/13. 
Hazed chestnut brown with a big frothy beige head.
Nose is dark fruits, dates, raisens, toffee, yeast esters, spice.
Taste comprises dark fruits, toffee, spice, dates, prunes, yeast esters, touch of booze.
Full end of medium bodied with a touch too much in the carbonation stakes. Having left the beer alone for a while this flattened out and I raised the palate score from a 3 to a 4.
Good tackle and it definately improved over time as it warmed a little and the carbonation flattened out, the alcohol is well disguised.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy brown with white head. 
Aroma caramel, apple, dark fruits, candi sugar. 
Taste caramel sweet, little bitter some sours. 
Mouth-feel creamy, good carbo. 
Awesome trappist.
Brown cloudy appearance.  Slight green tint.  Banana, pumpkin, cloves, apple, bready aroma and taste.  Palate is a bit "sticky", but the beer is lively.

This and its cousin, Trappistes 10, super good. Now why O why cant any USA major brewer, brew a beer like this? I like to buy products made in the USA, but unless you buy a micro-brewed beer in the USA, like Dogfish, Flying Dog, Three Floyds, or Goose Island, or any certian other micro-brews, you just cant  find great taste.

Bottle. Pours slightly cloudy dark amber with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of malt, raisins and caramel. Sweet flavour of malt with distict caramel and fruity notes. Well-balanced. Perfectly carbonated. Very good.

Murky amber with a rocky light beige head.  Big rich nose of dates and figs and raisins and candi sugar. Wonderful flavor of the same, but very complex. Lovely raisin and almond tones mix with dark toffee and candi sugar, plums and raisins, a faint touch of cherry, and yeasty smoothness.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2013 Aaaaah...the good old Rochefort...Dark brown in color...Aroma is dried fruits, caramel and some chocolate. Alcoholic in a nice way. Drink the sediment please :-) Ooooh so nice that i can buy this in almost any liquor store in Tilburg.

Superbe équilibre entre la douceur tout dabord, et la force subtile qui reste quand on vient la première gorgée.
Très belle mousse dense et qui se maintient par la suite.

Slightly hazy dark brown colour, hazy beige head. Aroma of liquorice, red fruit, malts, chocolate, caramel, liquorice roods, light sour touch. Malty sweet flavour, candy sugar, light bitter, liquorice. Finish cacao, liquorice, molasses and liquorice root.
Very drinkable, always a nice beer to enjoy.
(From 33cL bottle @ Het Brouwershuis, Baarle-Hertog)
Well balanced full bodied Belgium ale.  I can see why this beer rates so well.

Une superbe brune belge, fière représentante parmi les Trappistes. Superbement balancée, onctueuse et juste assez pétillante, avec des goûts de sucre cuit, de boisé, de noisettes, de vanille et un subtil arrière-goût de pêche. Belle robe brune cuivrée. Une merveille.
Bottle. Hazy reddish brown color with a creamy beige head. Balanced aroma of nuts, cream and butter. Bitter and sour taste. Medium bitter finish.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2013 Deep dark hazy brown colour, with beige thick head, not long lasting. Aroma of chocolate, toffee, dry fruit, and some alcohol. Rich taste of chocolate, raisins other spices, and alcohol well balaced.
Very complex beer, amazing.
Celkem dobré trapistické pivko, patří k těm lepím belgickým. Lahváč v Ibis hotelu Brusel.

We are doing Rochefort 8 vs Chimay Blue. Both looks the same - cloudy, dark orange-brown with half finger off white head. Aroma of the Chimay is dark fruits, yeast, orange, booze, brown sugar, rasins, bananas. Rochefort aroma is vanilla, wood, dark fruits, a little booze, brown sugar. Taste of Chimay is light sweet, warm alcohol feeling and great balance. Rochefort is not that sweet, also great balance but it has nice fruitiness all the way. The palate of both are quite similar - medium body, creamy texture and soft carbonation. May be Rochefort is a bit more watery, but not in a bad way and Chimay has a bit more carbonation. Both are great , me and my girlfriend prefer Rochefort 8.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2013 I like trappist beer, and the most strong product of St Remy abbey (Rochefort 10) but the 8 for me is ever one personal competition, the first bottle maturated in bottled for one, two years the aroma and taste are very strong, heavy, with coffee and licorice notes, no sweet sensation. but the last bottle, very young, has sweet, fruity, with plum notes, this beer is much complex for me.

Bottle poured into a snifter. Upon first crack, there is a sweet, yeasty and boozy nose. Pours a cloudy, almost iced tea like color with a minimal white head. Smooth brew with the ABV very well masked. Notes of mint. Solid BSA, but not worth the $5 a bottle. I absolutely love Trappistes Rochefort 10, but their 8 is alright.
Cerveza cremosa que se deshace en la boca, prácticamente al nivel de su hermana mayor. Entre mis preferidas.

d une couleur brun  en peu terreux avec un leger col de mousse mais qui dure pas. j ai pris cette car j ai tres bien aimer ca soeur la 10 mais c est autre chose.je trouve qu elle un gout de leger petit fruits mais leger c est sur se point elle moins profonde et moins liquoreuse mais ellle vient de rochefort alors la compexite et au rendez vous de fruit  avec un soupcon l alcool (rate 38)

Bottle from a local corner shop (Brussels, Belgium)
Aroma: Caramel, butterscotch, dried fruits, and some nuts.
Appearance: A hazy brown with a medium off-white head.
Taste: Medium sweetness, and a little bit dry.
Palate: Full bodied, soft carbonation, and a slightly bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Coats the tongue.  Malty, slight yeasty, caramel taste.  Very good. ::::::::::::::::::::::::;;;

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellent color, good lacing.  Bread and caramel smell.  Warm bread and caramel taste with some toffee.  Great mouth feel.  Excellent beer.  Top notch and one of my all time favorites. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at work , best before next year . Pours brown , small foam wich is goimg away fast. Smell reminds of the 10 , taste is also very comparable . Lighter maybe , very nice taste for this abv !

Kaatuu lasiin hyvin tummanruskeana ja niukalla vaahdolla. Haju on rusinaisen maltainen, kuivatun hedelmäinen, mausteinen, omenainen, pähkinäinen ja vanilijainen. Maku on pähkinäinen, kuivatun hedelmäinen, rusinainen ja hieman alkoholinen. Belgihiiva tuntuu jälkimaussa selvästi. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen ja hieman pirskahteleva, juuri sellainen, joka saa vaatimaan lisää. Kokonaisuutena hieman Chimay bluen kaltainen täyteläinen, monimuotoinen ja valloittava tapaus.

11.2oz Bottle A - Pours a murky brownish amber with off white head that dissipates slowly. Lots of floaters. S - A sutle nose. Yeast, dried fruit, & faint booze. T - Dried fruit, raisins, figs. M - Medium bodied. Love thoughts champagne bubbles. Dry finish. O - Quality is undeniable. Can anyone say vertical tasting 6, 8, 10

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 Le couleur est très foncé rouge/ambrée avec une mousse moyenne marron pale. Arôme de levure belge, un peu dalchool, et de quelque chose sucré je dirais peut-être des fruit sec, mais cest pas claire. Le goût est très complexe, initialement un peu de caramel, ensuite des fruits sec (comme des raisins), et dalchool. Cest très terreux, même ligneux.
Bouteille de 330ml, robe brune aux reflets acajou, arôme de levure , goût de levure belge et de fruits.
Heavy/strong trappist beer. Excellent trappist. Tastes of esters, fruits and lots of alcohol. The head went down quickly. Nearly no scent. Smooth aftertaste.

Bottle at Cafe De La Gare, Den Haag. Poured a murky brown colour with a thin broken tan head. The aroma is Belgian yeast. The  flavour is bitter with liqourice and an alcoholic medicinal palate.  The alcoholic bitterness is very tasty and refreshing. A great beer, but I much prefer the 10.

A - pours dark coppery brown with 1 finger off white. Some lacing. S - dark dried fruit, bready and strong Belgian yeast aromas. Musty with over ripe apples. Hints of banana bread. Caramel and toffee notes. M - surprisingly light bodied. A little thicker end. Alcohol warmed. Average carb. Lingering end. T - astringent, bread and musty apples up front. Medicinal, earthy caramel malts and toffee in the palate. Lingering Alcohol warmed end with a very astringent tint. O - astringent bready over ripe apples. 6+/7-

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: similar to the 6 but darker, with a thicker almost pink head and tons of lacing.   Aroma: prunes, wet cardboard, leather, caramel, drambuie, and, as it warms, tart green apple.   Taste: 	caramel-malty sweetness, with some raisins, booze, tobacco, and a hint of cherries in dark syrup.   Finish:	yeasty, and slightly floral bitterness as it warms.   Notes: Exactly a mid-point between the 6 and the 10; nearly every aspect of this beer is like the 6 turned up a notch and/or the 10 turned down a notch.  Very nice.  Part of a vertical tasting.

Rich dark brown colour, with small golden head.  Aroma is rich maltiness, sweet caramel, bit of booze, dark fruit. Taste is nice, smooth, roasty malt, bit beefy, not so much floral herby as with the 10. Touch of creaminess. Very nice and smooth, and easy drinking. I love the 10 but the 8 is still pretty damn good.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2013 Appearance: thick darker head, super dark brown color, Aroma: fruity, sweet, Taste: reminds me a lot of the 10, sweet and malty initially, less alcohol taste than the 10 but can still taste it Palate: a bit of c02 burn, not much aftertaste, Overall: I prefer this over the 10, good beer, I did try this a bit tipsy ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle into Trappist glass.  Dark brown color with half-finger of off-white head.  Aroma of sweet caramel, roasted malt, light chocolate, dark fruit (prunes, figs), nuts and fruity tart Belgian yeast.  Taste is much the same as aroma, adding some biscuit and wood notes.  Heavy body, complex flavors balancing nicely, dry finish.  Good stuff.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2013 Rijke, zoete smaak en vooral rijk aroma van caramel en vijgen, licht gebrand. Kleine schuimkraag op een troebel amberbruin bier met bezinksel. Voldoende film en body, wel iets teveel co2.
Brun, grumlig öl med ett lätt ljusbeige skum. Doft av jäst, fikon, bröd och lätt rostade toner. Smaken är nästan övermogen frukt, mandelmassa med viss bitterhet, jäst och en lätt kryddighet.
Mellow nose, sweet fizzy beer. Malty and so good.  Very enjoyable.  A bit yeasty.
Dark brown liquid with a thick offwhite head that lasts. Sweet aroma of bisquits, caramel and some alcohol. Taste of bisquits and bread. Sweeet!

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2013 Bottle 33cl. Dark reddish golden color. Not a hoppy beer, much of the crispness is from the carbonation, perhaps a bit too much CO2? I find that the liveliness kills a bit of the sensation of the aroma. Sweet malty taste. Chocolate and coffee aromas. Less complex and interesting than Rochefort 10 but also cheaper and easier to drink. Overall a very good trappiste brew.

#186
Mittel- bis dunkelbraun mit reichlich Schaum; einen Rot-Ton kann ich nicht feststellen. Das Aroma ist sehr gelungen. Zuerst eine weinigartige Note wie griech. Mavrodaphne, auf jeden Fall einem mediterranem Likörwein ähnlich. Dann auch eine schöne beerige Fruchtigkeit und darüber hinaus auch veritabler Aromahopfen, einfach geil! Der Antrunk ist voll, aber nicht scharf nach Alkohol. Die Hefe zwar zu erschmecken, aber nicht dominant. Vielmehr ist der Geschmack einem Früchtekuchen ähnlich, getreidig und gegen Ende auch herber nach Hopfen. Die 9,2% drücken zwar auf die Süffigkeit, sind aber nie penetrant oder gar scharf. Etwas mehr Geduld und ich hätte bestimmt ein noch besseres Trappisten-Bier vor mir! Fazit: Genießer-Stoff!
	
Test vom 18.11.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,15,11,12,10,12 - 12,00

Bottle.  Pours hazy brown with thick, frothy off-white head; good retention and lacing.  Aroma is caramel and toasted malts, figs, belgian yeast, brown sugar, floral hops, and light woody notes.  Flavor is sweet malts forward with good supporting dark fruit esters, light hops, and belgian yeast; dries out at the end with a lightly sweet finish.  Medium body and carbonation.
UPDATED: SEP 21, 2014 Dark chestnut colour medium head, sweet caramel raisons malty smell,  medium carbonation caramel taste, carrmel taste sweet warm toffee ice cream nuts taste

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2016 (Re-rated on 27/1/2016)

Rationale: I was not experienced in Strong Belgian / Trappist Beer back then. I have always thought the 8 was too boozy and not much else. Now that I am more into the style, I should it one more rate to see if its as good as everyone think!

330ml bottle bought at CitySuper in Habour City Tsim Sha Tsui.
Preparation: fridged bottle maintained at 4°C; Set aside for 10 minutes until room temperature of 13.6°C (within recommended temperature range of 12°C -14°C) onto the Westmalle chalice.
Looks: Cloudy, hazy ruby red colour with a crust of chocolate-like yeast sedimentsHalf finger head with beige foam which fades in 40 seconds; Very good sticky lacing and fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragment and sweet dark malt, with strong caramel, strong toffee, strong plums, figs, vanilla, light liquor, strong sugar, strong Bel yeast, faint lemon and light grass.

Taste: Strong sweet dark malt, with caramel, sticky toffee, burnt toast, strong dark chocolates, plums, Sherry, strong alcohol, strong liquorices, strong sugar, strong yeast, lemon, quite strong bitter hops and grass.

Body: Full body. Thick and slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Very good dark maltyness in a very stout background. Good caramel, toffee, burnt toast and plums with strong shaves of dark chocolate. Quite a joy! Yeastyness is somehow not as powerful as other BSA or Trappists. Nice treat overall. 

Booze: Very strong liquor with flashes of Sherry. Lots of liquorices for to beef up the bitterness and balance the sugary palate. A bit too strong, though, a fast hitter!

Hoppiness: Faint lemon and light grass in nose, and stronger in taste. Bitterness is mostly liquorices-induced for an abrupt, strong astringent sweet malty finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Very boozy and strong sweet-bitter to mouth.

Comments: With Rochefort 10s strong whiskyness, this 8 falls into the strong boozy BSA category with some good Sherry and dark chocolate tastes, but its overtly boozy without the creaminess of Chimay Blue. Its hard hitting for sure, but also a bit overboard without the sophistication. Very good but not great.

-------- />(Originally rated on 25/12/2012)

Dark ale brown colour; Medium head and frothy, cappuccino colour foam with very good carbonation (still bubbling while in the glass for a long time); Fine smell of caramel, orange peel, vanilla, yeast, malt with trace of alcohol; hops taste minimal; Smooth to mouth with medium body; Sweet taste throughout, with lingering taste of toffee; lacing is minimal compare to Chimays; Hop taste is minimally subtle, which quickly give way to strong alcohol feel to the mouth. At abv 9.2%, its strong and explicit, but it doesnt have the kind of sudden rush Chimay Blue has until after 10 minutes or so.

Comment: the 8 has all the making of a stylish Trappist beer - good colour and body, suitable lacing, pleasant strong ale taste, and boozy. Compare to Chimay Blue, however, its sweeter, less smooth in body, and a stronger alcohol character, Its very decent by all means, but Chimay Blues palatable smoothness won my heart. Will see whats like in the ultimate 10.

Aroma: 8/10; Looks: 4/5; Taste: 8/10; Palate: 3/5; Overall: 15/20 (3.8/5.0)
Aroma sweet, caramell. A small hint of chocolate and coffe?! Taste same as aroma but with alcohol. Way to sweet for my taste.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2013 The rocheforts really are on a sliding continuum are far as their aroma and flavor go. This one has the orangey smells and taste of the six, but they both quickly give way to strong caramel malts and biscuity flavours here of the quad. Still not the ten, but more intriguing and complex than the six.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2013 0.33 bottle. Pours a cloudy liquid of a brown-red-violet color with a medium off-white head. Aroma is composed of a little licorice with fruity elements, definitely sweet with a malty backbone featuring nuts, caramel, and some alcohol. Malty yet bitter in taste just some hidden sweetness, easily comparable to the scent but it loses some of the characteristic fruitiness. Really elaborate, burnt sugar, wood, delicate plums hard to describe everything with all that stuff coming at you at once. Medium body, fine slick and thick texture, carbonation is really lively thus inhibiting the taste perception and overall impression. Overall the beer is really good although I dont find it as splendid as expected.

This pours a medium brown color with a foamy light brown head. The scent has elements of nuts, yeast, and malts. Im definitely getting the Belgian Strong Ale scent from this one. The taste is bold and heavy. There are a lot of complex flavors including caramel malts, toasted malts, yeast, and burnt sugars. Great texture and volume adds great depth to make this another fantastic brew from Rochefort.

Bottle. Hazy brown pour, big off white head, excellent retention/lace. Aroma is grape, fig, licorice, chocolate, fruity esters, molasses. Taste is great: grape drink, licorice, light chocolate, molasses, lightly tart yeast. Palate is bone dry, soft, slick, dry grape finish. Drinks like a 5% beer. Awesome.
Very fruity heavy beer with a lot of complexity. The sweetness is very prominent which takes away a bit from the complexity in my opinion. A very good beer but for my taste not a great one.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2013 Pours a reddish brown with a small off white head.Very sweet aroma. banana, toffee, caramel, vanilla, with a backbone of booze.Tastes similar to the smell, but add in some malt and roast. Very balanced. Very good.I?d drink this every day if I could.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2013 33 cl bottle. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, raisin, licorice, bread. The taste is just sensational, so balanced and enticing. Sweet with a light spicy touch. Full body and medium carbonation, with a long and round finish. This beer is just so good, one of my favourites alongside the 10. This one is more balanced and equally satisfying, although I prefer the 10, which is over the top. Conclusion: delicious.

Bevuta in versione natalizia ma nn cambia di una virgola! Al naso un po' mielosa e caramellata con punte di caffè al gusto frutti rossi e di un equilibrio perfetto. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Troebel, donkerbruin met offwhite schuimkraag die snel verdwijnt. Geur van rozijnen, pruimen en toffee. Smaak is erg prettig met wederom pruim en rozijn, hinten van zoet brooddeeg en vanille, toffee en banaan. Eindigt met wat appel. Koolzuur merkbaar aanwezig, maar m.i. niet te veel. Een van de betere trappisten bieren.

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2013 Lovely, had to drink it out of a champagne glass but it showed off the beauty. Easy drinking and fun with my lady. Made the Dos Equis I was forced to drink next totally unfulfilling.

330ml bottle. Hazy chestnut brown color. Small off-white head, stays. Raisins, sweet, yeast, toffee in aroma. Very rich aroma. Crisp texture. Malty, sweet, some yeasty notes, raisins, toffee, a little bit of alcohol in flavor. Very nice beer.

Aroma is chocolaty brown sugar, a little alcohol, a little green apple.
Dark brown color nice beige head.
Taste--a little more sour than i remember, creamy on the finish.  Sweet, but not cloying brown sugar, fruity, winey, plums, maybe a little vanilla, just a touch earthy.  Light in body for a strong ale. Gets better with additional sips.  Almost tastes more like wine than beer.  Would probably be great with fruitcake.

Brown, hazy, full and stable head. Complex maltiness, berries, maybe melon. Very spicy when i had it in my mouth for a longer time (a bit like italien style spices..!). Full body. Long (and fruity) aftertaste.
Dark beer with full taste, which invites you toake another one. Fruity taste.

Let this into my life last Saturday as a bit of extravagance at a ridiculous price, but what a beer, and how merry it made me. Fizzy at the top with every dark fruit ever grown from a tree packed inside. I shared it with my grandma. She really liked it but said it wasnt as good as Gold Label.

Aroma is fairly banana, apple, only a little bit of toffee. Appearance is brown, slightly red, beautiful tan head with nice lace. Taste is good. I get grape, nice touch of orange with toffee, caramel, apple, touch of banana, but predominantly just toffee, apple and banana. Palate is a nice round bitterness with spice notes. Overall, really good!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.  Not my favorite Trappist beer-but that still puts it in the upper echelon
Pours a very dark cloudy amber with large tan head that lasts forever. Bitter fruit but still has a mild taste. One of my new favorites for sure.

Look: Classic dirty iced tea brown, off white 1/2 finger head. Smell: Spiced apple cider, dark fruits, earthiness, toast, Belgian yeast. Taste: Starts off with medium apple/ citrus tart, some berries, toasted malts, toasted oats, spices, little touch of brown sugar, some earthy funk, dry finish. Feel: Medium-light body, nice carbonation. Overall: This is in a class all its own. This taste like if a Dubbel and Tripel had offspring, this would be it. This is a keeper IMO. Recommended.
beautiful, long lasting creamy head, marvellous taste with dark-chocolate and alcoholic sweetness, perfect trappistes ale
Bottle->stem.  Amber with frothy carbonated head.  Aroma of yeast, grains, dark fruit.  Taste has malt and figs.  Excellent.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown with a thick and fizzy brown head. Lots of particulates in the head. Nose has some sweet and fruity notes in it. Taste starts sweet and fruity, but finishes sour. Feels very carbonated. Not my style.

pours cloudy amaretto brown with a large lasting creamy/foamy head, sticky lacing and a plethora of active streams. Malts and light cola on the nose. A burst of 8/10-sweetness up front, creamy, tastes of cocoa, cola, malts, and slight sarsaparilla. Better carry and longer length than the 6. Medium complexity, med-high depth, good carry, good transitions, great drinkability.
Surprising chocolate with this one. Or maybe my taste buds are off after two nights without beer. So this was a reward. Not as good as 10 for me but still a cracker. I blame the lower gravity.

BB 22 02 17

Fruity nose. Pour almost pure foam even when poured super slowly. Bit of prune.fig on the nose. Deep reddish brown. Quite smooth with a very low acidity.Soft. Crazy rushing beading everywhere. Vinous quality too. Perhaps just a very tad on the thin side for me but still very fine.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Light brown color, white head. Sweet, malty taste with earthy aroma, barnyard, bread, hay, fruits, wood and some alcohol. Earthy, malty finish with alcohol. Excellent trappist brew.
Poured a dark reddish brown with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt a berry fruits. Lively medium body, flavour of bitter sweet malt, vinous with dark fruit, dry lingering aftertaste.

Thanks to Kristīne who brought it from origin.
More coplex flavor than 6th one. Yes its alco but it comes with all other aspects of flavor through high carbonation, so tones of alco to nose isnt unpleasant. This one has a character - brilliant! Aroma - malty, yeasty plus candy. Lively aley. Wow - there is dozen of yeast in my glass! Pours deep muddy brown, lively foam - transforms in to kind white layer. Taste - sweet (with so many yeast left), light spicy, yeasty. No dry and bitter finish - hmm, in this one like it as is! Must re-rate, I mean it also would be nice!
Nice medium brown color, with foamy and fast disappearing head. Aroma is of dried fruits. Taste is more of the same and some sweetness. Very drinkable and delicious.
Bottle shared with McTapps. I expected a lot but it turned out to be 50 / 50. Quality beer with the usual belgian dark aromas but alcohol in the dominance which I don´t like.

Hazy brown with white to beige medium head, that disappears fast, leaving thin layer. Lacing.
Aroma.. plums, raisins, malts, alcohol, some notes of chocolate.
After Rochefort 10, it really seems like "lower gravity cousin". Its great as well, thou first thing that 
comes is high carbonation, that inflicts more intense aroma of alcohol. And this combination overcomes other great aspect of this brew.

Faint raisin and plum aromas on the nose. Colour is a dark cloudy amber with suspended particles, with a thin head that fades quickly after a few minutes. Tastes yummy - raisin bread, dark bread, bananas, complex sugars and then the finish which has hints of tart green apples swirl on the tongue. A pleasant burnt toffee aftertaste that lingers is the final impression, before the inevitable longing for the next swig beckons. I cannot help but comply.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ok! cè bisogno davvero di dire che è buona??. Nel bicchiere si presenta bruna leggermente opaca perchè "sporcata" dai lieviti che si depositano poi sul fondo. Schiuma bianco sporco non molto fine ma molto persistente. Aroma complesso. In dettaglio note di datteri, frutta secca, caramello e di un caldo e suadente ritorno alcolico. Ma sono tante le note che tutti potrebbero dare un loro unica interpretazione. Al palato è la classica trappista ipersupermegaarcicomplessa, corposa con spettacolari note dolci, calde e morbide. Finale (acc!) incredibilmente equilibrato dato da una leggera luppolatura. La magia monacale colpisce ancora.

Aroma if banana and dirty amber pour leads to a complex taste and lingering mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is very fruity (sour apple-ish, maybe plum?) and spicy with some alcohol. 

Flavor starts dry -- and maybe a little tart -- and finishes sweet. Some of the apple/plum flavor from the aroma, as well as raisin, and clove-like spice. Nice dark caramel malt and brown sugar flavor, with a little bit of bread/toast in aftertaste. Pretty sweet -- not cloying, though. An interesting hint of spice in the aftertaste; similar to ginger or cinnamon or something... Slight alcohol flavor, although not unpleasant. 

Dated: "110516", drank October 2011

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2013 Large, thick head with thick rings of lacing and sediment at the bottom. Aroma of dark purple and red fruits like grapes, raisins, cherries, cranberries, and apples. Flavor is all of the aforementioned along with bready malts. ABV incredibly well-hidden as with #10 - no burn despite being over 9%! Rochefort is incredible with this. Only complaint - a bit too much acid. Otherwise, smooth and well-balanced. Reminds me of a better version of Brother Thelonius by North Coast - a fine beer in its own right. Basically, this is almost as good as their legendary 10.  SECOND TASTING NOTES: Not as much acid this time.  Drinking it slightly warmer.  Tasting more brown sugar and molasses.  Butterscotch and caramel, too, including in the aroma.  Carbonation is very high - like soda bubbles on the mouth at first.  This is so tasty - 9% ABV is well-hidden.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; pours dark brown beige frothy head spicy and fruity aroma, complex taste with dried fruits, spice level of bitterness is spot on. Struggling to articulate how good this beer is, Im not big on superlatives but this beer is stupendous.
Rispetto alla 10 questa aveva solo un anno alle spalle e la differenza si è sentita. Buona per carità, ma un po dolciona, può migliorare
Pours a murky raisin colour. Aromas are raisin bread, dark fruits, some sweet candy or bubblegum. Sweet malty fruity flavours with a nice boozy finish. Rochefort 10s little brother...excellent.

Bottle, 33cl. Big, creamy off-white head, brown color. Very good lacing. Strong caramel, bread, banana and nicely balanced alcoholic aroma. Strong, creamy, bombastic palate. Taste is not for everyone: very sweet and malty as it must be, but too alcoholic in my opinion. Anyway, great beer.

If this was a wine I would compare it to a red dry wine on the acidic side. However, watch out!  After the first one the second one will taste like your favorite beer!  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

really is about the perfect example of the style. aroma is a bit musty with some alcohol to it. flavor is dark fruits like figs and raisins, molasses or brown sugar with a brandy like finish. as impressive as expected.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown to amber color with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is fruits, plums, leather, wood. Flavor is licorice, fruits, plums. Slightly dry aftertaste. Too high carbonation for my liking.

Bottle. Hazy brown pour, big off white head, excellent retention/lace. Aroma is grape, fig, licorice, chocolate, fruity esters, molasses. Taste is great: grape drink, licorice, light chocolate, molasses, lightly tart yeast. Palate is bone dry, soft, slick, dry grape finish. Drinks like a 5% beer. Awesome.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Deep hazelnut brown in colour with creamy, steady head. Taste of roasted grains, dried apricots, strong alcohol and ripe nuts. Very easy and nice too drink.

33cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with an off-white to beige head. Malty and fruity aroma with dried fruits, caramel and hints of chocolate and alcohol. Sweet, fruity and well balanced. Very pleasant beer, a pure pleasure to drink. (2012-10-26)

Finally getting around to rating this one. Actually, Ive only had this once or twice... anyway, it pours a ruddy brown color, very cloudy with a rocky off white head that shrinks pretty quickly. The aroma is weak when its cold, but opens up nicely as it warms. Do not drink this one cold. It has tons of fruit from apple to pear, plum, raisins. Mild spicy yeast with a big bready malt character. I see why so many people are mentioning fruit cake. Unfortunately I dont like fruit cake, but I can appreciate this beer. The flavor is heavier on the apples and raisins with some distinct nuttiness that I didnt get in the aroma. Alcohol presence is big as well. Bready, fruity finish. The mouthfeel is thick, but the beer foams up easily in the mouth. More nuts and alcohol in the finish. Im just not into these kind of beers anymore.

Saved this one for a special occasion and this ale was definitely worth the wait. So much to describe. The head pours full and mighty--and quickly disappears. The aroma shifts. One time its a Polish liqueur (wow, sure wish I could remember the name of that one), the next its a well-aged fruitcake. The taste is an incredibly quick shot of sweetness-- followed by a fast-vanishing finish that has just a shadow of the sweetness. Just delicious. Poured from a 330ml bottle.

Poured from a 33 cl  bottle at home Pours a cloudy brown with an off white head.  Aroma of caramel and molasses.  Quite a highly carbonated mouth feel.  Hints of dark cherries with a slighly bitter finish.  Nice.
roasty, earthy, caramel, flavor with a strong kick and a pleasant linger.  head doesnt last very long, but then again neither does this wonderful beer.
After taking his first sip, Rob said, "This is my beer now. This is my favorite beer ever - by a lot." I still think its a little fizzy, but good flavor.

Aroma is sweet and wild. Color is a dark brown that occludes light, with a thin even head across the top. Taste is wild and sweet, hiding the alcohol content until the finish. Palate is a little watery but not too much so, and is compensated by a good level of carbonation.

Rich fruity aroma of raisin, plum and blackcurrant with some brown sugar. Pour a mid-brown with a head that lasts beautifully, leaving a bit of lacing. Taste of figs, sugar and a hint of coffee, smoke, fruit and some hops. Excellent and complex beer, really enjoyable.
Pours a deep, rich mahogany and sediments floating. Raisin aroma, with a sharp, medium body. Notes of licorice and dark fruit with caramel flavours.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2013 aroma: caramel, floral, alcohol,nuts, 
apparenza: amber, orange, cloudy, minimal head, 
gusto: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
palato: full body, creamy, lively, long finish amaro ma non troppo 
birra riassaggiata,ma il primo assaggio risale a tempi biblici,quindi ne vale la pena. la birra si presenta ambrata,con molta schiuma e un bel deposito finale (che adoro)..aroma allinizio poco pronunciato,forse birra troppo fredda,poi si rivela essere ben maltato,si sentono tutti e 9 i gradi alcolici e i sentori fruttati..al gusto è spettacolare,dolce e maltato,carbonazione lievementa alta ma classica da trappista,così come lamaro ottimamente nascosto e non troppo pronunciato..una meraviglia..scende alla grande e ti tiene impegnato nella bevuta!

Estery aroma featuring dark stuff like currants and raisins and and obvious amount of yeast. Opaque russet-tan with fizzy, persistent head. Delicious blend of brown sugars, bitter berry fruits, and sweet grainy malts. Pallet tingling yet foamy, a very filling brew that is easy to drink with  satisfying bite and minor burn on finish. An emperor among mere kings.
Not much head, dark brown and red appearance. Deep raisin aroma. Rich fruit and licorice flavors, sharp on the tongue and lingering. Wonderful beer.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 Bottle at pikkulintu, helsinki. Dark brown color with some white head. Nice aroma of licorice, sweetness, little alcohol. Fantastic sweet, full body taste of licorice, chocolate.

Bottle poured into a wine glass. Aroma of fruit and brown sugar. Tastes like figs and apples and cherries and a hint of smokiness. The taste would be a 10 if the mouthfeel were a little more viscous but that's just my preference. An incredible beer that I was happy to finally try. Go get it

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaske kjøpt på polet i vika. Flott brunfarge med frodig skum. Skummet bruser i glasset nær man heller i glasset. Smaker fruktig og har en kraftig men balansert alkoholsmak. En veldig god øl

Very nice. Pours dark brown/gray with creamy head. Bit of sediment. Notes of fig and slight cocoa. Taste is mild fruit, some light chocolate. Figs, raisins, pears. Thinner mouthfeel than the 10, but still pretty full flavored for the style. Good stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Purchased an 11.2 oz bottle 9.2%abv. Good pour from bottle into a Chimay glass(go ahead, call the beer police). Nice clean aroma, but what blew me away was that taste! A bit fruity with a nice grain base. I even grabbed some coffee in there. Nice and yeasty! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fantastic!  Beautifully complex flavours and that deep, deep, vinous flavour and warmth from a high alcohol beer.  Dates, currants, toasted cereal, spices, ruby richness. Yummy.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2012 Heerlijk volle smaak die bij het uitschenken een romige schuimkraag achterlaat. Uitgesproken smaak van chocolade/vijgen met een licht bittertje. Super

Bottiglia a casa. Colore marrone ma con note ramate in controluce. schiuma compatta quasi cremosa, ma la cosa più assurda è la durata. Se spillata correttamente una sottile velatura non abbandona mai la birra. profumo intenso di spezie e caramello. in bocca è deliziosa. caffè e un gusto vinoso hanno una persistenza pari a quella della schiuma: pervadono tutto il palato per svariati minuti. meno alcolica e meno dolce della 10. non è a quel livello ma ci andiamo veramente vicino.

Marrone ramato con schiuma beige chiaro abbastanza persistente.....
Prugne, datteri, fichi secchi e caramello....in bocca entra dolce e leggermente acida, con note vinose.....i 9,2 % non si sentono....ottima....

Opaque deep brown, 1 finger persistent tan head. Aroma is like its brothers, vinious, dark fruits, dates etc. Very prevalent whiskey like characteristic but not noticably alcoholic. Moderate carbonation, full bodied. Peppery towards the finish. Undoubtedly world class but I prefer the 10.
Nice thin head, reddish brown color. Medium bodied. slight sweetness. Very smooth, very little bitterness.  Almost no alcohol presence.

Il colore di questa birra è marrone, più intenso di quello della 6° ; la spuma è fine e compatta, a bolle molto piccole, persistente. Il naso, allinizio, ha un che di agrumato, netto, e nel complesso dimostra una forte caratteristica fruttata, spiccata e quasi sciropposa. Corpo importante, ma non eccessivamente consistente. Il sapore iniziale ricorda la liquirizia ma poi prevale il caramello. Si tocca quasi leccellenza, con questa trappista.

Bottle, 33 cl. Hazy mahogony with a nice, diminishing yet stable beige head. As I pour up the beer a very intense and strong, sweet and fermented fruitiness hits my nose. Flavor is just as intense with a wide range of balancing notes, sweet fruity, meaty, bready, yeasty, spicy, earthy, bitter finish, complex and extremely elegant. A beer for relaxation and meditation.
From bottle. A taste bomb. Very intense and complex. Aromas with hints of licorice and strawberry, both bitter and fruity with basement aromas, superbly balanced. A magnificent Belgian.
dark chocolate, nuts, earthy, brown, cloudy, rocky head, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, long finish
Bottled,pours Mahogany with a beige head.Sweet and spicy aroma with notes of stone-fruit,coffee,cereal,nuts,citrus,spice,yeast, and licorice..

(33 cl bottle from Belgisk Bryg - stored for one year; BBD: October 13th 2015) Pours a seemingly clear dark copper with quite potent, tan head. Beautiful lacing and good retention. Aroma is ... complex. I detect notes of caramel, chalk, fruit and bread. Oily texture, medium carbonation, medium to full body and a sweet finish. Very pleasant and extremely harmonic taste. The ABV is so well integrated its very hard to detect. Impressive and dangerously seductive beer. Seems to me to have a greater degree of elegance than the 10, which is also very good but perhaps a bit on the sweet side compared to this.

Bottle at home. 
Offwhite foam one finger, hazy hazelnut color. 
Sugar pepper aroma. 
Sweet pepper taste with a nice bitterness.
Super nice beer. 

Bolton Brew Rocks !!

Bottle to snifter. Looks good; a cloudy brown with off-white lacing. Smells solid; raisin, plum, and sweet dark candy. Tastes  like it smells with a good mouthfeel. Abv is nicely subdued too. Tasty, but overrated, and nowhere as good as the 10.

Pours a deep hazelnut brown with a small fizzy head. Aroma is brown sugar/treacle, dark fruits (raisins, plums, figs), banana, little alcohol. Mouthfeel is medium with big, lively carbonation, which settles down to a nice smoothness as you drink the glass. The middle is nice and spicy, which mellows into a fruity, warming, caramel malt finish. Brilliant.

Poured from a bottle into a trappist glass, nice deep brown, velvety head covering the surface with a smooth feel to the carbonation, the aroma is yeast, fruit and taste that is sweet, a little spice on the finish and a lot of residula warmth on the way down but in a good way.

Brass City Brew Fest 2012.   The aroma is caramel, raisins, brown sugar.   The appearance is amber, off-white head.  The flavor is caramel, brown sugar, fruit, raisin, odd wallboard sort of flavor.  The finish is peppery, yeasty, fruit.  Good.

Balance and elegance is this beers strong points. Delicate layers of caramel, Brûléed sugar, dried fruit and brandied raisins. Lots of carbonation initially.. which then subsides with time in glass. Minimal sweetness. Medium bodied. 9% alcohol is completely hidden. Best enjoyed near room temperature. Nothing spectacular if only considering flavors and concentration... though a beautiful beer if you consider the balance and finesse of the total package. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...
Bottled. Pours cloudy brown with a big light brown head. Smells nutty and alot of roasted malt. Tastes alcohol, nutty malty, abit buttery with similar finish.
Great beer. Fantastic in the glass and with flavour to boot. Really enjoyed this.
UPDATED: SEP 12, 2012 Flaske fra Polet: etter Kings Blue fremstår den som litt tørrere både i aroma og smak, men allikevel med stor smaksrikdom og en herlig, laaang ettersmak. Et klasseøl.

pours a deep amber colour with 2 fingers of white head that leaves some nice lacing.lots of caramel  and biscuity malts on the nose are magnified in the flavour with some nice spicy hops. finishs bitter with some great banana and cloves yeastyness.

Pours dark brown with a small head. A sweet aroma of dark fruits, malts, raisin, plums. Taste is excellent: sweet maltiness added with strong, dark fruity notes. Nicely spicy too, really varied. Alcohol completely hidden. Rich, medium to full bodied, long.
This is an allround great, heavy beer, that tastes great for all occasions. I would prefer drinking it alone, enjoying its depth and different hints of flavour and aroma.
Just deliciously smooth and tasty and lovely and fresh and yum and noodles.

color marrone scuro ,velata con schiuma cappuccino.aroma maltato con note di frutta secca e anche frutta rossa, cioccolato e un bel pò di pepato.in bocca è frizzante corpo abbastanza leggero per la gradazione alcoolica.si confermano in bocca le note olfattive con un tocco di liquirizia nel finale.chiude abbastanza secca e leggermente luppolata.forse preferibile alla sorella maggiore

330 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a murky brownish orange with a moderate-sized lasting light tan head.  Aroma is dark fruit, toffee and a little wood.  Flavour is raisin, plum, toffee and some leather and wood.  Big body.  Very good.

33cl Bottle, Brown body with a beige head that last very long and sticks to the glass. Roasted, caramel malts in the nose with floral hops and a hint of honey. Tastes a bit like dark chocolate mixed with caramel, sweet taste from the alcohol.
Pours a dark amber with tons of head. Very carbonated. Aroma is spice, fruit, very rich. Taste is same but can taste alcohol. Great beer.

A melhor trappista que já degustei, completa em todos os aspectos.
Não tenho nem muitas palavras pra descrever essa   beldade

A-- Poured a dark brownish cherry color. Somewhat murky at first but cleared up nicely. Nice ruby hues to this. Half finger of light brown head, quickly falling to splotchy film. Aggressive swirling got a better looking head but fell to a ringed collar. no lacing but very visible alcohol legs that were slow moving. 

S-- Rum soaked raisins and dark cherries. Touches of earthiness and a bit of wood as well. Once warmed up more the alcohol became obvious. liked the nose a bit colder but a small complaint. 

T-- Dark fruits galore. Raisin, dark cherry, stewed plumb and fig. Get notes of cinnamon and other spices with this. Not a lot of alcohol in the taste and a lighter thinner than I expected. Still good though. 

M-- Lighter bodied than expected. Just bits of carbonation. A little bit thin on the mid and back palate. Some syrupy dark cherry qualities in the back as well. Not bad but not great. 

O-- Well hidden alcohol. Easy to drink for 9%. Good beer even with some syrupy qualities to it.

33cl bottle from SAQ. Pours a dark cloudy brown, frothy beige head that dissipates slowly. Aroma: Malt, bubblegum, vanilla, banana, raisin, caramel, toffee, hints of chocolate. Amazing smell. Palate: Full bodied, fizzy, smooth finish. Very nice. Taste: Sweet, but not too sweet. Very nice flavour. Alcohol is present, but not too strong. Damn good beer.

From notes sampled Aug 19 2010 at Ebs
Pours a fairly clear dark copper color with a decent off white head that shows some retention. Smells of caramel, figs, raisins, a bit of earthy yeast with hints of brown sugar. The flavor follows the aroma quite well. A solid hit of caramel, dark sugar, and dark dried fruits. Medium body with an overzealous level of carbonation and sweet bubbly mouthfeel. I like this beer a lot, but dark Belgians like this always seem over carbonated for my palette.

330 ml bottle. Pours a reddish brown with huge fluffy head that dissipates to a medium head with nice lacing. Aromas of yeast, caramel, spices and roasted malts. Rich and sweet. Flavors of light toffee, malts, and spice. Beautiful balance.

Thin bodied dark brew.  Champagne like carbonation.  Aroma of mixed fruit, grapefruit, apricots, apples.  The high carbonation detracts from the flavor for me.  Sweet fruit beer flavors are prominent.

330 ml bottle. Murky brown body, huge mocha head, ok retention. Aroma of yeast, prunes, raisins, spices. Taste dominated by yeast, caramel, tons of spices, dried berries. Alcohol is not as strongly noticeable as in Rochefort 10, and much more pleasant. Lots of sedimentation. Late warming effect.
Bottle from Beer Planet, Brussels. Brown beer with a big beige head. Floral, fruity, malty, caramell. dark sugar and dark dried fruits aroma. Alcohol, dark dried fruits, malty and spicy flavour.

Aroma: Heavy and sweetish.Spices, brandy, caramel, dark sugar, yeast, mould, dry fruit like figs and plums, strong banana notes.  

Body: Full body with a syrupy feel. A thin, creamy head and medium to high carbonation.

Taste: Tends towards sweetness. Dark fruit, alcohol, a tiny bit of sourness in the background. Very refined, but bold.

Finish: Mild and warming.

Overall: Very complex. Despite the relatively low alcohol volume, it is warming.

Yeasty fruit smell, bubbly on the tongue  and coats. Nice big head two finger, really good lacing. Caramel aftertaste and smell. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Head: beige colored foam. Color: ruby brown. Aroma: spices. Taste: spices, bitter. Palate:full body, lasting. Overall: very nice.

Rich carmel color. Opaque and hazy. Nice sediment in the bottom of the bottle. Banana and Belgian yeast aroma like grassy citrus. Very sptrizy mouthfeel and also light. Just a little more malt on the finish distinguishes this from the 6. The head is spritzy and light tan. It rejuvenates itself with each sip.

Others have described the flavour of this beer far better then I could. So I will describe something else.
Its texture is unbelievably smooth, given its carbonation. Also soft on the palate as every flavour balances another. This balance is typical of trappistes offering, since this beer is an expression of the Devine.

Bottle. Pours clear dark brown color with a medium off-white head that laces well. Aroma is nice, malt, raisin, plum, with notes of spice and yeast. Flavor is medium sweet malt, raisin, a touch of yeast. Finish is a bit alcoholic, but the ABV is well masked otherwise.

Poured in snifter.  Pours a dark amber-brown color with a nice off-white head that lingers a bit.  Nice fruity aroma.  Picking up cherries, prunes, berries, dark fruit, and a little chocolate and caramel too.  Taste is slightly sweet, bitter, and fruity all at once.  Very nicely balanced.  All kinds of fruity flavors come out throughout.  High carbonation is nice in this beer giving it a slight champagne feeling.  Alcohol is very well hidden.  Finish is long and leaves a nice fruit and chocolate taste.  Really like this beer.
Bottle pours a dark amber color with head that disappears quickly. Notes of yeast, fruit, dark fruit, prunes, caramel and sweetness. All of which nicely mask the high alcohol content.

Light aroma has fruits and spices. Hazy brown, short head. Taste has ripe dark fruits, alcohol, spices; bit pepper. Light to medium body, fizzy carbonation, long lively finish. Slightly bitter and sweet. Easy to drink and plenty of nuances to enjoy. Overall this is a beer with character, not a standard beer. Enjoy!  :)

Very little head, fully diminishing, cloudy light brown, off white, fizzy

Not a strong aroma

Fizzy medium body 

Hides the 9.2% very well

amber brown, white head. yeast esters, caramel, sweetness. body is smooth, prunes, caramel. Again, an excellent brew from Rochefort. A tad lighter and easier than the 10, and not that much aging, old plumes and all that.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 How: Bottle, 1995 vintage, best before 2000-05-30.
Where: Shared with Halle.
Appearance: Dark brown colour. Quickly vanishing beige head.
Aroma: Raisin, dried fruit, some alcohol.
Body: Medium body, quite heavy carbonation at pour but that quickly dissipates and leaves a low carbonated beverage.
Flavour: Raisin, dark fruit, caramel.
Comment: More even than the same aged 6. Less faults in the flavour, but at the same time a bit more boring.

First rating, fresh bottle (8-4-7-4-17):

Bottle @ Monks Sveavägen. Dark colour with a long lasting head. Aroma of roasted grain. Malt, coffee and fruit flavour.

A - Dark brown with a nice medium carbonation and lacing. 

S - Smelled of rummy raisins and molasses with a sweet malty nose. 

T - Smooth start and finish to this beer with a nice warmth of alcohol. Raisins and date flavors shine through with a caramelized licorice/anise root beer flavor profile. 

M - Smooth from start to finish a little syrupy on the tongue but the carbonation helps move that along into the smooth creamy finish.

O - An amazing beer from one of my favorite Abbey's. Absolutely delicious. A must have for anyone who wants to start there Trappist experience on the right foot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2oz bottle poured into a Trappist glass. Pours a cloudy dark brown with about a finger of light tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, vanilla and toffee. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Dark fruits, caramel and vanilla. Full bodied with a thin yet sticky texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, not bad. I dont think its worthy of the 100 rating it has but I would gladly drink it again.

exactement le genre de bière que jaime pour le soir

sombre et onctueuse

Rochefort 10 is a great beer, 6 is fine but doesnt excite me. This is the first time Ive had 8, and it is bloody delicious!
Bottle. Bit of yeast sediment - is this bottle conditioned? 
Very malty aromas of raisins, and juicy dark cake. Some dark fruits & vanilla.
Tastes sweet, but not overly so, as it is nicely balanced by a touch of bitterness which lingers longer than the sweetness does, so it is not cloying.  Flavours of raisins, cake, maybe rum or muscat.  Hides the alcohol very well, but you know it is there by that happy viscosity that coats your tongue when you take a sip - excellent thick, creamy mouthfeel, without feeling like you have to chew it.  
Would make a great pairing with dessert - muscat and ice cream, or a rum & raisin cake maybe.  Cant wait to get this again.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Color bruno carico con un sottile strato di schiuma beige. Aroma intenso e maltoso con sentori di caffè, caramello e lievito; più lievi venature tostate e fruttate con note che ricordano mirtilli e pasta frolla. Gusto robusto e rotondo, mediamente dolce con forti note di malto e toffee, lievi accenni tostati e nocciolati nel finale. Corposa e robusta, piacevolmente effervescente e con un abv non preponderante. Perfetta come ale invernale!

33cL bottle.  Awesome pour, deep rich mahogany color, lots of sediment, bubbly head fades to head oyster.  Very similar to the 10, very distinctive taste, profile, complexity.  I love this beer, but the 10 is still my favorite.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet.
Dark brown body, white, tanned head. 
Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, malt, chocolate, yeast esters. Taste of malt, some roast, caramel, dark fruit, alcohol. Lovely finish, an old time favourite

Caramel nose with some fruit and yeasty bread like aromas.  Rich malt flavors mixed with sweet fruits that almost overide the characteristic yeast taste, which dominates the #6.  Smooth creamy body, mellow silk polished finish.  Classic!

Pours a very deep brown with a eggshell colored head. Nose is toffee, caramel, raisins, prunes, wood with a touch of alcohol. Medium to full bodied with flavors of muscat grapes, fig, toffee, earth and hints of vanilla. Slightly silky mouthfeel with a touch of heat in the end. Pretty tasty.
Tastes good. Not so hot on the nose. Looks awesome, beautiful rich dark tone. Very enjoyable
Pours dark brown with very little head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, alcohol, vanilla, and dark fruits.  Taste follows the aroma with some pleasant sourness.

Carbonated.  Yeast  slightly fruity notes.       Some malts. Nice Trappist  just not my favorite.      

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I poured an 11.2oz bottle into a Trappist chalice.

Appearance: Dark brown color, proper. Plenty of spastic carbonation visible. Forms a large, beige, foamy head which doesnt fizzle away completely  but doesnt leave much lacing on the glass.

Smell: Surprisingly milder nose with a generic Trappist ale scent. Some dark fruits and hints of clear liquor sweetness. A hint of rum or vanilla, some alcohol.

Taste: Both the Trappistes Rochefort 6 and 8 are technically "Belgian Strong Dark Ales" as opposed to "dubbel" proper, but it shows in their taste. Whereas the 6 was overtly sweet and on the lighter side, the 8 is a little more intense all around. Quite mild up front with only a hint of bitterness, the 8 finishes with a very different palate than it begins with. A milk chocolate and almost tart fruitiness finish the palate here. Similar to a chocolate covered cherry or some kind of Starbucks concoction. While sweeter on the ending than the beginning, this beer still ends with more of a thud on the palate. Rum-like flavors combined with tart fruit make for a more "serious" drinking experience. Theres a sweetness to be found,  and its delectable for sure, but seems to be a bit lacking considering the strength of the beer. 

Drinkability: Whereas the 6 felt and drank like flat soda, Trappistes Rochefort 8 drinks like a traditional Trappist brew - spastic and peppery across the tongue with plenty of carbonation building up in the throat. Its not a sipper, but theres more of an aftertaste and an alcohol presence - which isnt surprising considering its quite hefty at 9.2% ABV. Yet theres no alcohol warmth and only a mild dryness to the palate. Not sweet enough to qualify as a dessert beer, this is more of a nightcap.

Drank from a tulip glass. Cola cola with little head. Not much lacing left on the glass. Lots of floaties in the glass, tasty yeasty bread bugers. Aroma is not too overwhelming which is nice. You pick up the rasins, bread, malt, clove and belgium spices. Taste and palate are bar none. Very smooth, no detection of alcohol, light carbination and a creamy mouthful. Taste of dry fruits, bread, dough, malts and yeast. Excellent beer and would love to drink again.
Aroma of wheat, light spicy and fruity hops. Taste of moderate sweet malts, bisquity,long duration, ends with a bitterness.

Its another very drinkable trappist for me. i can really smell and feel the warmth of the alc on this one. 
Sure does warm me up.
Taste bubbles the tongue at first but its very smooth with a dark fruit aftertaste. again, strong alc breath and taste.
Very good.
Pour from bottle into a wide mouth glass.

12 oz bottle pours a hazelnut brown with a huge foamy off-white head and lots of lacing.  Complex aroma has lots of caramel and fruits. (I drank this one too fast to enumerate them).  Taste is slightly sweet with a good malt backbone.  Moderate carbonation, full body, and a creamy mouthfeel.  This is what great Belgian ales are all about.  Just as satisfying as the 10.  I look forward to trying the 6, and will definitely return to this one again.

Second of the three tonight - richer smell about this one, dark forest and cake fruits. Taste a bit sweet and fruity, feels warm and spicy on the throat - fortified wine-like. Good little liquorice kick, with a syrupy mouth feel. Excellent. Bring on the 10...!

Shared with Mike & Amy in a blind tasting of Rochefort 6, Rochefort 8, Rochefort 10, Russian River Salvation, and Abbaye de Rocs Brune.

The beer is hazelnut brown, with a towering, frothy, tan cap. Plenty of lacing stuck on the chalice. The aroma brings forth yeast, malt, toffee, caramels. The beer has a yeasty sweetness to it, like fresh bread from a bakery, or perhaps a pastry. Delicious. We all found Rochefort 8 to be remarkably similar to Abbaye de Rocs Brune, which is interesting. Smooth, creamy feel, with minimal alcohol presence. While I do prefer the Rochefort 10, this beer is a gem. Recommended.

Bottle poured a cloudy brown with a medium tan head, active carbonation, and minimal lacing.  Aroma includes plum, raisins, cherry, and molasses.  Taste is well balanced and includes fig, pumpernickel bread, dark fruits, and caramel malt.  Significant mouthfeel and smooth finish with slight alcohol warming.  Very enjoyable with ABV barely noticeable.
Donker, sterk bier met een diverse smaak. Ideaal met kaas of uiensoep, of andere hapjes. Pas op: ook al bevat dit biertje pruimen, noten en chocola, het telt niet als stevige bodem.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Vol aroma met koffiebonen, verse chocolade croissantjes, drop en karamel. Smaak is karamel, zoetige noten, drop, sinaasappel, pruim en licht koffie. Hapt fijn weg. Ziet er goed uit, alleen kraag verdwijnt wel aardig rap. #2 aroma van sinaasappel, complex van smaak, veel bezinksel. Punten meer dan waard. #3 iets minder pakkend, koetjesreep gevoel ipv 80% cacao chocolade, wel complex. Net onder vier dan. -1 smaak en -1 palet

Wow.
Dark brown color. Visibles gray yeast floating happily in there. After pouring in the glass 3 finger of foam settled and became thinner like 1/2 finger. Lacing is always there on the surface of the glass.

The aroma in intriguing. Some caramel here, roasted malt and sweet yeast.

Taste is good, cannot complain but I was expecting more. Westmalle impressed more. I felt some dark fruit here and caramel. 

Palate is pleasant, oh my, probably the better topic of this dubbel. Carbonation is really high as belgians are.

I probably should try it again to define better my valuation. But at the end I am satisfied.

chocolate, coffee, roasty, grass, earthy, brown, black, cloudy, sparkling, white foam, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly sour, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, lively, brief finish, astringent,

Pours hazy dark brown  with thick frothy head that lingers well. Aromas of plum, raisin, chocolate, caramel, alcohol, and malt persist. Taste is excellent and follows aromas with with dark fruits, cherry, raisin, caramel, and touch of alcohol bite. Mouthfeel is full and creamy with quite good carbonation.  Just like Rochefort 10 but more subdued. 

--- Cheers
Beste øl som er å finne i basisutvalget til Vinmonopolet. Ypperlig følge til sjokoladekake!

Pours deep opaque brown. Aroma of dark fruits, malt, caramel/vanilla, alcohol. Tastes lighter than expected, with some underlying spice/bitterness. A lot of flavor and it hits with a surprising sweet and then sour taste before meddling into a medium creamy carbonation feel. Interesting. I could learn a lot from this beer.

Poured from 330 ml bottle at Yangshuo Village Retreat in Yangshuo, China. 

Opaque, deep mahogany with 2-finger head and beautiful creamy lacing. 

Complex aroma of dark fruit, toasted malt, bread, molasses, spice and brown sugar. 

Taste sweet caramel and dark malts, dark fruits and alcohol. 

Medium/full body and high carbonation.

pour is deep copper&amber with a gigantic creamy beige head, subdiding to a dense inch witch lasts long.
complex aroma of candy, figs, dates, caramel, plums, gooseberries and raisins. Hints of leathers, lightly roasted malts and light hints of alcohol.
Taste is marvelously balanced and consisting of all the above just smoothly mashed into a rollercoaster of taste-o-rama :) this beer is one of my favorites when it comes to the trappist beer, mostly because of its rather easy drinkability combined with the wonderful complexity and mellow smoothness of the heavyer trappist beers. This is a truly awesome beer witch must be tasted again and again and again.
Full to medium body and just above softly carbonated. Silky smooth and pure awesomenss!
Verry good mix of foremore caramel and back fruit taste. Favorite beer for autumn and spring.

one of my favourite  winter tasting beers. drink it slowly and enjoy the fine but strong taste

Rerated after having 6 and 10, get a very feint dark fruit scent. Taste is of dark fruit mixed with alcohol, better version of 6.
